ValueDefinition.Name: AudioText
ValueDefinition.Description: A single audio text for this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Group
ValueDefinition.Description: A group of audio texts for this pool

Property.Name: Position
Property.Description: A 3D world position

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Internal name of the asset

ValueDefinition.Name: WikiPage
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the page after https://wiki.related-designs.de/wiki/display/MMHO/

ValueDefinition.Name: Creator
ValueDefinition.Description: Creator of this profile

ValueDefinition.Name: CreationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: time when this asset was created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comments
ValueDefinition.Description: List of comments for this asset

ValueDefinition.Name: LastChangeUser
ValueDefinition.Description: user who made the last change

ValueDefinition.Name: LastChangeTime
ValueDefinition.Description: last time when this asset was changed

ValueDefinition.Name: ID
ValueDefinition.Description: ID used to identify this GUID. A constant int will be generated which can be used by programmers

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Comment used to describe this asset

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description fluff of the object, used with [ToolOneHelper InfoDescription([RefGuid])]

ValueDefinition.Name: GraphViewConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: The GraphView config to use when opening this asset in the graph view

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCharacters
ValueDefinition.Description: max characters this text may have. May be ignored when set to 0

ValueDefinition.Name: LastFinalText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text als der Status auf Final gesetzt wurde

ValueDefinition.Name: Status
ValueDefinition.Description: Aktueller Status dieses Textes

ValueDefinition.Name: ExportCount
ValueDefinition.Description: how many times this text was exported

ValueDefinition.Name: Localize
ValueDefinition.Description: true when this text needs to be localized. When set to false the german text will be used for every language

ValueDefinition.Name: OasisComment
ValueDefinition.Description: Comment visible in Oasis for translation teams

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: A single text for this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this text will be chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: Group
ValueDefinition.Description: A group of texts for this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this group will be chosen. Inside the group every text has the same weight.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this pool will be chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: object label of a single object or group label for a group of objects

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: finds all objects with this GUID (performance critical!) which belong to ObjectParticipant

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckParticipantID
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, ObjectParticipantID will be used to additionally check the owner of the objects

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectParticipantID
ValueDefinition.Description: use together with ObjectGUID

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectUseParentConditionObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used in Actions! Uses the objects that the parent condition found during evaluation. This is not implemented for many conditions yet, please contact PRG before you use this value

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If provided, only objects from the given session are filtered

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckQuestStarterSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and this action is fired from within a quest, the quest start session will be checked for objects

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and this filter is used within a quest, then the current quest area (if any) will be used to filter objects

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectivePrebuiltObjectUseVisibilityAutomatism
ValueDefinition.Description: This flag is only used in quest objectives! If true the quest will remember the initial object visibility on quest start and set the object to visible. When the quest ends it will restore the initial visibility again. If false, the object visibility is not touched

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectRestrictToQuestObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and this action is fired from within a quest, only objects that are used in the linked quest will be taken into account

ValueDefinition.Name: IncludeOnlyBlueprintObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, ONLY blueprint objects will be filtered for. All other include booleans will be ignored in this case.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxObjectCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If > 0 this will set an upper limit for the number of filtered objects. Objects will be chosen at random from the filtered object list

ValueDefinition.Name: Object
ValueDefinition.Description: The object of interest.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The exact amount of objects. If this amount is set MinAmount and MaxAmount will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: If Amount is not set, the amount will be generated randomly. This value defines the minimum.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: If Amount is not set, the amount will be generated randomly. This value defines the maximum.

ValueDefinition.Name: DoSetOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the owner will be used to set the owner participant of the object. Otherwise a default (usually neutral or enemy) will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: Owner
ValueDefinition.Description: if setOwner is true, this defines the owner of the newly created objects

ValueDefinition.Name: DoSetVisualOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you will visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: CargoAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: DEPRECATED - Will be interpreted as single CargoAssetList entry with amount 1. A context asset that is important for the object, e.g. an item that will be put inside the cargo of the object

ValueDefinition.Name: Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CargoAsset but more of that :)

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of goods for this entry

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: object label of a single object or group label for a group of objects

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: finds all objects with this GUID (performance critical!) which belong to TargetParticipant

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetCheckParticipantID
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, ObjectParticipantID will be used to additionally check the owner of the objects

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetParticipantID
ValueDefinition.Description: use together with TargetGUID

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetUseParentConditionObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used in Actions! Uses the objects that the parent condition found during evaluation. This is not implemented for many conditions yet, please contact PRG before you use this value

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If provided, only objects from the given session are filtered

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetCheckQuestStarterSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and this action is fired from within a quest, the quest start session will be checked for objects

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetCheckQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and this filter is used within a quest, then the current quest area (if any) will be used to filter objects

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectivePrebuiltObjectUseVisibilityAutomatism
ValueDefinition.Description: This flag is only used in quest objectives! If true the quest will remember the initial object visibility on quest start and set the object to visible. When the quest ends it will restore the initial visibility again. If false, the object visibility is not touched

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectRestrictToQuestObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and this action is fired from within a quest, only objects that are used in the linked quest will be taken into account

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetIncludeOnlyBlueprintObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, ONLY blueprint objects will be filtered for. All other include booleans will be ignored in this case.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetMaxObjectCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If > 0 this will set an upper limit for the number of filtered objects. Objects will be chosen at random from the filtered object list

Property.Name: ParticipantRelation
Property.Description: Property that provides information on a source-target relation between two participants

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceIsOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the source participant should be the owner of this condition (in quests this would be the quest receiver)

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that is the source of the relation (its state is checked against or of target)

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetIsOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the target participant should be the owner of this condition (in quests this would be the quest receiver)

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The target participant of the relation

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowParentConditionSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Allow the session of the parent condition (if any) to be an allowed session for this action

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED! Ask programming if you really need it! Allows the currently active session to be allowed for this action.

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowProcessingSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Allow the processing session to be an allowed session for this action

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Accepts Assets and AssetPools

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextMarkerName
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the marker inside the context object where the target object should be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationBringItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Which item needs to be brought to this Destination Target.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationRetrieveItem
ValueDefinition.Description: The item that the player gets at this trading station

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAllowedLayers
ValueDefinition.Description: Sets the path planner layers of ships that can complete the smuggle

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAttackerObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which ships should spawn at destination points and attack and pursue the player ship having the Quest Item onboard. Attacker spawn immediately after a new destination point has been activated. Attacker Objects despawn after the Quest completion.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAttackerMinDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum distance from the destination object where the attacker ships will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAttackerMaxDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum distance from the destination object where the attacker ships will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnTradingStationVisited
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be triggered when this trading station was reached and items were exchanged successfully

Group.Name: ConditionObjectType - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: Infolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: the infolayer icon above the quest object

ValueDefinition.Name: PlayerKontorUseQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, only the Kontor of the current quest area (if any) will be a valid target

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectCheckOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Use together with PrebuiltObject to filter results by owner

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltUseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the owner should be resolved dynamically by code depending on the context of use

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Use together with PrebuiltObject to filter results by owner

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectSpecifiySession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the session of the prebuilt object(s) should be specified

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectUseQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, only prebuilt objects of the current quest area (if any) will be a valid target

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectUseProcessingSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates that the processing session should be used as constraint for the prebuilt object(s). In quests this is the session where the quest is about to start.

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Session guid that the prebuilt objects should be looked for in

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectUseVisibilityAutomatism
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest will remember the initial object visibility on quest start and set the object to visible. When the quest ends it will restore the initial visibility again. If false, the object visibility is not touched

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Accepts Assets and AssetPools

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: The owner of the spawned object

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTiming
ValueDefinition.Description: Choose the time when these objects should be spawned during the quest

ValueDefinition.Name: DoSetVisualObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you will visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectGroupLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: If a text is given the spawned object will be added to a group with the text as label. If the group did not exist before, it will be created

Group.Name: Conditions - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: The region from which a session has to be active. If no region is given then any active session triggers this condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session which has to be active. If no session is given then any session triggers this condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionActiveSessionUseActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Will override ActiveSession

ValueDefinition.Name: Island
ValueDefinition.Description: which construction area

ValueDefinition.Name: Claimed
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition is valid if claimed status matches

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessCheckSpecificBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, AttractivenessSpecificBuilding will be considered

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessSpecificBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: A specific building that is checked for its attractiveness

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintBuildingType
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set to something other than Invalid GUID, it will only count the blueprints for that procided GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectAmountComparisonOP
ValueDefinition.Description: Comparison Operator for the Amount of Objects that fulfill the configured need

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectAmountThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of Objects to fulfill the overall condition

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsToCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: The needs that needs to be fulfilled per object

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraMovementDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance is in meters

ValueDefinition.Name: StartDistanceTrackingOnFirstEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the distance of the camera action be tracked when the condition was evaluated for the first time or when the tracking for this participant started.

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionFluffText
ValueDefinition.Description: The decision text displayed to the user to describe what decision to take

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionPortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: The portrait that should be displayed in the decision popup

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionOptionList
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of options to choose from

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionOptionText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text displayed on the decision button that describes the decision option

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionList
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that should be executed when the user chose this option

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockRequirements
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of assets that need to be unlocked to be able to choose this decision option

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockInfotipDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip text that is displayed when this option is locked

ValueDefinition.Name: HideDecisionPanelAfterChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the decision popup should close after this option was taken

ValueDefinition.Name: FollowUpDecisionList
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of follow up decisions that will be a result of this decision option

ValueDefinition.Name: HasDecisionCostBehavior
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, any ActionAddGoodsToItemContainer in the action list would be evaluated and following things happen: 1. Decision gets disabled if player could not pay the resources 2. Resource requirements will be shown in infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: HasNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, triggers the DecisionNotification when the decision option was chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Will get triggered when this decision option was chosen and HasNotification is true

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowDecisionBuffs
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, buff icons with infotip will be shown for each buff action in the action list

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceIsQuestOwner2
ValueDefinition.Description: When true, the source participant is overriden by the quest owner

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetIsQuestOwner2
ValueDefinition.Description: When true, the target participant is overriden by the quest owner

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreTeamAlliance
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether an alliance state should be considered when the two participants started the game as a team (in multiplayer)

ValueDefinition.Name: TextSourceString
ValueDefinition.Description: The textsource that should be evaluated for this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonType
ValueDefinition.Description: [only used when textsource returns a number] Type of comparison you want to apply to the result

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonValue
ValueDefinition.Description: [only used when textsource returns a number] The value you want to comparte the result to

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of event that will be watched by this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextData
ValueDefinition.Description: A context string that defines additional information about the event (e.g. the GUID of an asset if the event type is Object_Destroyed)

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: A context GUID that defines additional information about the event

ValueDefinition.Name: EventCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The number of events of this type that should be called. Usually 1

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckForActive
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to false to check if the festival has ended (is not active)

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreType
ValueDefinition.Description: Don't care for the type of the festival, just check if any or none festival is active

Property.Name: ConditionFiniteResource
Property.Description: Is there a resource slot with the described type and remaining amount?

ValueDefinition.Name: StartAmountTrackingOnFirstEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the number of times the game pad action is pressed be tracked when the condition was evaluated for the first time or when the tracking for this participant started.

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodsInRangeType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of goodsInRange check that should be performed. See Dataset entries for more information

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowKontors
ValueDefinition.Description: True if ships and kontors are valid to bring goods in range, False if only ships can do so

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingParticipant_chl
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the participants should be chosen dynamically by the current context (e.g. quest asignee)

ValueDefinition.Name: InRangeList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of assets that should be checked to be in range

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The building or pool asset that should be checked to be in range.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAny
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether any or all elements in the InRangeList must be in palace range for this condition to be fulfilled

ValueDefinition.Name: InStorageGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: List of goods that are checked by the condition

ValueDefinition.Name: Product
ValueDefinition.Description: The product that gets checked

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of the product that needs to be reached

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigatedModulesRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Select range of modules which should be irrigated. CAUTION: Farms without any modules will be ignored in this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckNonIrrigated
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if you want to check the non-irrigated modules instead of the irrigated modules

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of applied buffs required to fulfill this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: UseEffectHandler
ValueDefinition.Description: Instead of checking if Buildings have the specific buff we check the EffectHandler (only used by BuffFactories, ForwardBuffs and AreaBuffs) for a specific buff and count the affected Buildings. This could increase performance when having a lot of potential affected Buildings.

Property.Name: ConditionIsDiscovered
Property.Description: Condition that checks whether a given participant has discovered another participant

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCAssetList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of DLCs that should be checked for activation

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckIndustrializationTypeInsteadOfObjectFilter
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all objects of a given type will be checked. Otherwise the object filter will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: InGameParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Checks if a participant was selected in the game setup.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsObjectPaused
ValueDefinition.Description: True if you want to check for paused buildings, False otherwise

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPauseRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Define which of the configured buildings need to match the paused state

Property.Name: ConditionIsTutorial
Property.Description: Condition checking if the tutorial is currently enabled

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Item the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of items the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemTargetObject
ValueDefinition.Description: At which game objects the item(s) have to be activated/socketed. If nothing is setup here, then it's only checked whether the item(s) have been activated.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemNeedsActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the item nees to be equipped AND activated

Property.Name: ConditionModuleCount
Property.Description: Compares the current amount of modules built per building with a given percentage

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleComparison
ValueDefinition.Description: The comparsion that should be used to compare the percentage of modules existing

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAbsoluteCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether an absolute number of modules or a percentage of modules should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictToMandatoryModules
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the absolute module count should be capped at the mandatory amount and ignore addional modules built for visuals

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage (0 = 0%, 1 = 100%) of modules that the current amount should be compared to

Property.Name: ConditionMutualAreaInSubconditions
Property.Description: Condition that ensures that all subconditions are fulfilled in a mutal/common/shared area

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaFlags
ValueDefinition.Description: Flags to filter only for certain types of islands

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecifySession
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the SessionAsset should be evaluated

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingSession
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if only areas of the processing session should be used

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: If given and SpecifySession is true then only areas of this session are accepted

ValueDefinition.Name: Radius
ValueDefinition.Description: an object is considered as at a target if its distance is less than this radius

ValueDefinition.Name: AllObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: is it sufficient to have one of the objects at one of the targets, or are all objects checked?

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyOneTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: when all objects are checked, do they need to be at the same target object?

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpectObjectExists
ValueDefinition.Description: If existence is expected and the object does not exist, the quest will auto resolve. Otherwise it will wait until the object exists

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpectTargetExists
ValueDefinition.Description: If existence is expected and the target does not exist, the quest will fail. Otherwise it will wait until the target exists

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreSelectionBeforeActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this condition needs the selection to happen _after_ it was activated (e.g. the parent condition was fulfilled). If false, previous selections also count

ValueDefinition.Name: StagedPhotography
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this picture will be shown instead of the actual screenshot made by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: CircleAreaPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the area that the circle around the object has in relation to the total screen space. Toggle quest hint cheat during photography quest to see details

ValueDefinition.Name: ScreenBorderPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The object has to be inside a smaller rectangle than the screen itself. This is the percentage of the area that is reduced from each border to define the inner rectangle

ValueDefinition.Name: AppearInNewspaperArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: If any article is selected, this picture will be shown in the given article

ValueDefinition.Name: PlayerCounter
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of this player counter

ValueDefinition.Name: Context
ValueDefinition.Description: The context info for the player counter

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextAllowAny
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all counters will be summed up, ignoring the context

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: The comparison operator for counter value and desired value

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The desired value the counter should match

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScope
ValueDefinition.Description: The scope of the counter

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeUseCurrentContext
ValueDefinition.Description: Use the processing scope for this counter

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeUseActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the session that is taken as context is the active session of the player

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeContext
ValueDefinition.Description: Context information for the counter scope, i.e. GUID of a region or session

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeKeepFirstFound
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the first time this condition gets evaluated and a scope context was found it will be kept forever (e.g. You don't know in which session this coindition will be started, but once it was started it should keep looking in that session). Otherwise the scope context will be checked continuously (e.g. You want to keep checking in the given session, used for quest preconditions for example)

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeToQuestStart
ValueDefinition.Description: True: Counting from current condition start - False: Counting from 0.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowAbsoluteValues
ValueDefinition.Description: If RelativeToQuestStart is set, this value defines if absolute or relative values should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowInvertedValues
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the player counter values shown in the questtracker should be inverted

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the MIN the MAX or the CURRENT value should be returned.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSpecificParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, not the condition owner will be checked but the participant that is specified under <CheckedParticipant>

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckedParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: if <CheckSpecificParticipant> is true, then this defines the participant to check

ValueDefinition.Name: Good_CP
ValueDefinition.Description: The Good that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: The required percentage of productivity

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of production per minute of the required good

ValueDefinition.Name: EveryPoolMustBeRunning
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether every pool of the vector list should be running a quest. If false, the condition will be true if ANY quest pool is running a quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPoolsToCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of quest pools to check

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionQuestStateStates
ValueDefinition.Description: All the states that satisfy this condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionQuestStateIsBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the given state flags should be treated as a blacklist instead of a whitelist

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionQuestStateQuestGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: A quest or a quest line that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionQuestStateRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: If the ConditionQuestStateQuestGUID is a quest line, this operator checks for which quests the states need to match

ValueDefinition.Name: CompletedResearchField
ValueDefinition.Description: All research fields that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the completed research recipes and the desired amount

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchDesiredAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The desired amount of completed research recipes

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which research fields need to match the desired amount

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchRelativeToQuestStart
ValueDefinition.Description: True: Counting from current condition start - False: Counting from 0.

ValueDefinition.Name: Reputation
ValueDefinition.Description: [IngameValue] [ComparisonOperator] [Reputation] e.g. X < 5

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidentsBuildingRangeOP
ValueDefinition.Description: All Found Buildings need to reach the amount, any, or none?

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionToCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: Session to check season for. If empty all sessions will be checked.

ValueDefinition.Name: Range
ValueDefinition.Description: The range in which the ships can be detected

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObject_sir
ValueDefinition.Description: The object that the ships should be near to

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSpecificTargetOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the owner of the target object should be specified.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetOwnerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The owner of the target object

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSpecificShipOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a specific owner of the ships should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipOwnerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The particpant whose ships are checked to be near the target

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSpecificShipGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a specific ship needs to be close to the target. If empty, any ship will be able to fulfill the condition

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecifiedShipOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the ship or ship pool that should be near the target object(s)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowKontorsInRange
ValueDefinition.Description: True if ships and kontors are valid objects in range, False if only ships are

Property.Name: ConditionShipsOwnedInSession
Property.Description: Condition that checks if a certain amount of ships of a participant are in a certain session

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session in which the ship amount is checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: The target ship GUID that should be checked (also accepts asset pools)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipComparison
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of comparision that should be use to check the ship amount

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The ship amount that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: The owner of the ships

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipyardIsSomethingInQueue
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if any object is currently in the construction queue of this shipyard

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: A time limit for the timer.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPaused
ValueDefinition.Description: True, when the timer is currently not ticking

ValueDefinition.Name: TimerID
ValueDefinition.Description: An ID by which the timer can be referenced from other conditions or actions.

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepTimerOnUnregister
ValueDefinition.Description: timer value is not reset when condition is unregistered

ValueDefinition.Name: CountComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Comparison operator the is used to check the current count, i.e. (CurrentGameValue) (ComparisonOPerator) (TradeRouteCount)

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradeRouteTransportationType
ValueDefinition.Description: Only routes with the given transportation type will be counted. Will be skipped if no flag is set

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterAssignedTradeRouteObjectOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Only routes with the given assigned objects will be counted. Will be skipped if no asset or pool is set

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradeRoutesWithoutWarnings
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, only trade routes without warnings will be counted

ValueDefinition.Name: HintType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of hint that should be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedInputTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition will be skipped if the active input mode is not checked here

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowScrollHintWhenOffscreen
ValueDefinition.Description: True = When the hinted object is offscreen, show a marked in that direction. False = Don't.

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialConditionType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of interaction that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: NegateTutorialConditionType
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the tutorial condition type should be negated to succeed (NOT selected, NOT visible, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: HintEndCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition that has to be fulfilled to hide the hint

ValueDefinition.Name: HintDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The duration the hint should be displayed before it disappears automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: HintAnchor
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the direction of the arrow pointing of to the tutorial element. The box will be positioned accordingly

ValueDefinition.Name: HintText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that should be displayed in the ui hint box

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialUiCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: The category of the tutorial that is used to reference phoenix objects

ValueDefinition.Name: RefGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: The RefGUID of the phoenix element that should be highlighted

ValueDefinition.Name: HidePortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the speech bubble should have a portrait or not (false = show portrait)

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSpecificPortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a special portrait should be used for the hint. If false, the quest giver will be taken

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecificPortraitProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The profile asset of the portrait that should be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecifyHintColorType
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether there should be a specific color for the background of the hint

ValueDefinition.Name: HintColorType
ValueDefinition.Description: The specific (background) color of the hint

ValueDefinition.Name: ScreenOpenConditionFlow
ValueDefinition.Description: Configure additional screens here that are also part of the flow.

ValueDefinition.Name: SubConditionCompletionOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Parallel: All sub conditions can be solved at any time. Linear: The sub conditions have to be completed in order. Mutually Exclusive: Only one sub condition has to be completed and the sub conditions are solvable before the main condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOptional
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true, if it is not needed to satisfy this condition to satisfy the parent condition

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlaceConfirmOnReached
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, triggers a message when goods are delivered that needs to be accepted to continue

ValueDefinition.Name: NegateCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Negate the result (success/still checking) of this condition

Property.Name: ConditionPropsSessionSettings
Property.Description: Base property for conditions with objects

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedBySecondParties
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this trigger will also be created for all second party players

Property.Name: TriggerProgress
Property.Description: Actions that should be performed when progress of condition is changed by ProgressStep

Group.Name: ConditionObjectives - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: VehicleLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Which vehicle is moved? If left empty, the command vehicle needs to be moved by player command.

ValueDefinition.Name: VehicleDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Needed distance between vehicle and context object. If 0 the interaction distance of both objects will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowConfirmOnReach
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a notification should be triggered once the player reached the target location

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestCameraMovementDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance is in meters

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestStartDistanceTrackingOnFirstEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the distance of the camera action be tracked when the condition was evaluated for the first time or when the tracking for this participant started.

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionBG
ValueDefinition.Description: The background shown in the decision popup UI

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of decisions to take until the objective is met

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoAcceptLastDecisionOption
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the last of the current decision options will automatically be chosen when the quest times out or gets cancelled

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoShowDecisionScreen
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the decision screen will be forced to show when the quest gets active. Caution this might interfere with other menus at that point

ValueDefinition.Name: HideDecisionScreenCloseButton
ValueDefinition.Description: Hides the close button from the decision screen to enforce a decision by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowDownInDecisionScreen
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the game will slow down as long as the decision screen is opened and continue with normal gamespeed as soon as a decision was made. Does not work in multiplayer matches!

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of delivery for this quest. See the dataset for more information on the available options

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowKontorsToDeliver
ValueDefinition.Description: True if ships and kontors of the player are valid objects to deliver wares, False if only ships can deliver

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryExecutionPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: If DeliveryType == Ship then this will be the place where the goods need to be brought. In the other cases this object will only be used for the selection reminder message AND only if not starter object is configured

ValueDefinition.Name: UseQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the area should be dynamically choosen where the quest takes place (decided by precondition or starter object)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConfirmOnReach
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, triggers a message when goods are delivered that needs to be accepted to continue

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyObjectsPrebuilt
ValueDefinition.Description: List of prebuilt objects that should be destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyFinishObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the object that will spawn right at the place where the last destroy ship sunk. The object should have an infolayer and should be unsinkable.

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowShipToCancelMovementToDefendItself
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the destroy object will cancel its movement commands when attacked and attack the attacker. If not, it will follow its movement command and onlty auto attack

ValueDefinition.Name: TreasureItem
ValueDefinition.Description: The specific Item that the player should receive. Either a real item or a treasure dummy item

ValueDefinition.Name: AddScrapToTreasure
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether there should be scrap as an additional reward for the treasure

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalScrapItem
ValueDefinition.Description: The reward pool to choose the scrap from

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountScrapSpots
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of scrap spots spawned in the world besides the treasure

ValueDefinition.Name: ScrapDummyItem
ValueDefinition.Description: The item representing scrap that the player receives when searching a scrap spot

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnedTreasureGround
ValueDefinition.Description: The object spawned in the world to visualize a diving bell location and holding the items

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnAdditionalObjects
ValueDefinition.ExcludedVersions: Indicates whether additional objects should be spawned around each treasure spot (i.e. seamines, attacker, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalObjectData
ValueDefinition.ExcludedVersions: The definition of the additional objects that should be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowTreasureMapButton
ValueDefinition.Description: Shows the treasure map button in the quest tracker UI

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Which objects the player has to escort. Each List entry contains an exact amount of objects to escort.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSurvivors
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum amount of escorted ships that should survive, otherwise the Quest will fail.

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveDirection
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the target where the escorted ships move to.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the target object where the escorted objects should move to.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Initial damage of target ships in percent [0..1]

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObjectDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Initial damage of escort ships in percent [0..1]

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortBeginRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in what a player ship has to be to start the escort. In game, this is dynamic: 11 + colliderShipA + colliderShipB. It would be better if this was dynamically calculated, but we have not data about the colliders at the time of the check. So for now, a range of 32 should be sufficient for even the longest ships. Also note, that as of now, this value is never overwritten.

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObjectDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: The way how the escort object should despawn after the quest ended

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerObjectDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: The way how the attacker object should despawn after the quest ended

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which objects should spawn and attack the escorted ship(s).

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerList
ValueDefinition.Description: At list of attacker settings that are spawned during the escort quest

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The time at which this attacker should spawn relativ to quest activation

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerObjectList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of attacker objects that should be spawned at this time interval

ValueDefinition.Name: HasEndlessAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the escort will spawn attacker indefintely. This will be used after the last entry of the attacker list has been spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerEndlessSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: The attacker objects that should be spawned as endless attacker

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerEndlessInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The time interval at which the endless attacker should be regularly spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDistAttackerToObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum distance from escorted ship where the attacker ships will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDistAttackerToObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum distance from escorted ship where the attacker ships will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: DistMinBetweenAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum distance between multiple attackers when spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: DistMaxBetweenAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance between multiple attackers when spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerSpawnInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the interval after which the first and all following attacker waves will spawn. Attacker waves spawn until the escorted ship is destroyed or leaves the map.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsShipInRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether there has to be a ship near the escort objects to be able to start the escort

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterHeadlineTextWithoutShip
ValueDefinition.Description: The objective text used when there does not have to a ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetMapBorderText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that is used when the destination is the map border

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortFinishObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the objects that will spawn right at the place where the last escort ship reached it's destination.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestedExpedition
ValueDefinition.Description: This expedition needs to be completed

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeWarningText
ValueDefinition.Description: This text will be shown if the ship is too near or too far away from the target ship

ValueDefinition.Name: MinRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance of player ship and target ship must not fall below this value

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance of player ship and target ship must not exceed this value

ValueDefinition.Name: HitTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: The target object that should be destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: WaypointAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of waypoints used to mark the radial track of the target

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPatrolRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in which the target object will patrol around its spawn position

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipItemRetrievalPlaceConfirmation
ValueDefinition.Description: If false, a confirmation message needs to be accepted to get the item, otherwise the player gets no notification

ValueDefinition.Name: UseItems
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Items the player has to activate/socket and how often

ValueDefinition.Name: Item
ValueDefinition.Description: Item the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of items the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObject
ValueDefinition.Description: At which game objects the item(s) have to be activated/socketed. If nothing is setup here, then it's only checked whether the item(s) have been activated.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the item nees to be equipped AND activated

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleBuildingAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The module owner building that will be checked for the number of modules

ValueDefinition.Name: Efficiency
ValueDefinition.Description: The efficiency that needs to be reached. Must be >= 0 and <= 1. The efficiency is calculated by (modules / max number of modules)

ValueDefinition.Name: Negate
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the condiion should be negated

ValueDefinition.Name: PhotographyObjectList
ValueDefinition.Description: Which objective needs to be photographed. After the quest is accepted, the palyer is able to enter a special photography view. While being in the photography view, the player needs to center the objective on the screen. He can take pictures anytime, by pressing a certain button on the interface, but when the objective is centered, he will get a special feedback that he took the right picture.

ValueDefinition.Name: StagedPhotography
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this picture will be shown instead of the actual screenshot made by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: CircleAreaPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the area that the circle around the object has in relation to the total screen space. Toggle quest hint cheat during photography quest to see details

ValueDefinition.Name: ScreenBorderPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The object has to be inside a smaller rectangle than the screen itself. This is the percentage of the area that is reduced from each border to define the inner rectangle

ValueDefinition.Name: AppearInNewspaperArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: If any article is selected, this picture will be shown in the given article

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOnlyDecoration
ValueDefinition.Description: If true: These objects will not count towards the quest goal. They are only decoys.

ValueDefinition.Name: Behaviour
ValueDefinition.Description: Different behaviours of spawned objects. 'Static': Objects will be placed and stand still, 'Mob': Special behaviour for moving mobs.

ValueDefinition.Name: PathLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used when Behaviour is set to 'Mob'. Use it if you have a predefined path that the mob should take

ValueDefinition.Name: PathIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used when Behaviour is set to 'Mob'. Use to define on which island the mob should spawn on

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOnlyDecoy
ValueDefinition.Description: If true: These objects will not count towards the quest goal. They are only decoys.

ValueDefinition.Name: MobTryStreetPath
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the mob tries to use only streets

ValueDefinition.Name: MobOverwriteUnitType
ValueDefinition.Description: The units spawned in houses to join the mob will all have this unit type. (If set to invalid the unit type of inhabitants of the spawning building are used)

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestCompletedResearchField
ValueDefinition.Description: All research fields that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestResearchComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the completed research recipes and the desired amount

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestResearchDesiredAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The desired amount of completed research recipes

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestResearchRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which research fields need to match the desired amount

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestResearchRelativeToQuestStart
ValueDefinition.Description: True: Counting from current condition start - False: Counting from 0.

ValueDefinition.Name: AvoidShipInRangeCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Does not generate a condition to force a ship to be near a target object

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that the player has to sell an object to

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectToSell
ValueDefinition.Description: The object that the player has to sell to the participant

ValueDefinition.Name: SellAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount the player has to sell to the buying participant

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialTradingStation
ValueDefinition.Description: The (optional) very first station where the player needs to go to start the quest. Setting this to "anywhere" means that no initial trading station is needed.

ValueDefinition.Name: RetrieveItemAtInitialTradingStation
ValueDefinition.Description: If not null, player will receive this item upon activating the quest at the initial trading station

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowKontors
ValueDefinition.Description: True if ships and kontors of the player are valid objects to give/receive wares, False if only ships can do so

ValueDefinition.Name: EnforceStationOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all stations need to be visited in the given order

ValueDefinition.Name: FailObjectiveOnDetection
ValueDefinition.Description: CURRENT DESIGN ENFORCES THIS TO TRUE! If true, the quest will be failed if any of your ships was detected by a scanner. If false, the scanner ships will only start attacking

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipInRangeForActivationText
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be shown when the ship is in range of the starter object and ready to activate the smuggler quest

ValueDefinition.Name: TextTradingStation_NoItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Objective text that will be shown for trading stations where no item is needed to be delivered

ValueDefinition.Name: TextTradingStation
ValueDefinition.Description: Objective text that will be shown for trading stations where an item needs to be delivered

ValueDefinition.Name: ScannerCenterObject
ValueDefinition.Description: The object that the scanner units will move around

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxObjectiveCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If there is a pool used as a context, this value can restrict the number of generated objectives. This value is only used when AutoSpawnConditionsPerObject is true.

ValueDefinition.Name: LimitToQuestArea_SQ
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the player counter should only be checked on the current quest area. Note, that the player counter must match AREA in order to use this.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAnyPoolAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates if the player counter should be checked for ANY or ALL assets from a given asset pool. Can be ignored if context guid is not an asset pool

ValueDefinition.Name: CombinePoolAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: If TRUE, the sum of all context pool results will be added and compared. In that case <CheckAnyPoolAsset> has no effect. Can be ignored if context guid is not an asset pool

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowSignsAndFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the signs and feedback of the objective will be used for all objects matching the given Context. StatusQuo objectives do not show signs and feedback per default

ValueDefinition.Name: BestAreaIsHighestValue
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the area with the highest counter among all areas will be returned. Otherwise the lowest

ValueDefinition.Name: SustainTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long the Status should be sustained in order to solve the Quest

ValueDefinition.Name: ResetTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the timer be resetted to the initial value, in case the player counter is not be fulfilled anymore?

ValueDefinition.Name: SustainObjectiveText
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the headline text for the timer. If an icon is assigned to the text GUID, it is shown in the Quest Tracker.

ValueDefinition.Name: LimitToQuestArea_Sustain
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the player counter should only be checked on the current quest area. Note, that the player counter must match AREA in order to use this.

ValueDefinition.Name: BestAreaIsHighestValueSustain
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the area with the highest counter among all areas will be returned. Otherwise the lowest

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionFlowGamepad
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used when we are in gamepad mode and there are some interactions configured

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialInteraction
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used when we are in gamepad mode and there are some interactions configured

ValueDefinition.Name: UseItemInAreaSignsAndFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: these signs and feedback are used for the objects where the items should be used

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveIntoSession
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the StarterObjectObject should move into the session to the docking place. False, if the StarterObjectObject should be selectable from the very beginning

ValueDefinition.Name: DockingPlaceDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If MoveIntoSession is true, then the StarterObjectObject tries to come near StarterObjectDockingPlace, respecting this distance

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjectObject
ValueDefinition.Description: The object that needs to be selected to start the quest. If MoveIntoSession is true, this object (=ship) will need to move into position first

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjectDockingPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: The place where the StarterObjectObject tries to move to, when MoveIntoSession is true

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteExistingQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the starter condition will not only set the area of the starter object as quest area when it is empty but also when is already set

ValueDefinition.Name: DropOnObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Objects that are checked if they are hit by an air drop action

ValueDefinition.Name: DropObjectRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines what objects of the DropOnObject list are required for this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: DroppedProjectile
ValueDefinition.Description: The projectile that is required for this condition. Can be a projectile or a pool of projectiles. If left empty: any projectile is accepted

ValueDefinition.Name: IsVisibleInQuestTracker
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if this condition should be shown in the quest tracker

ValueDefinition.Name: TextCombinedContextValue
ValueDefinition.Description: this is the combined description text with a value text of a quest objetive (e.g. "Build houses 2 / 5")

ValueDefinition.Name: FakeMinimapPings
ValueDefinition.Description: Mininmappings that are not related to the objective can be defined here

ValueDefinition.Name: JumpToVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the visibility of the jump-to button for this objective

Group.Name: Actions - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: AddQuestID
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the quest ID of this action should be added to the items (i.e. quest items)

ValueDefinition.Name: SetGoodPoolLimitToAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: This value only makes sense for AssetPools as Good. If false: Amount specifies the amount per good in that pool. If true: Amount specifies the total amount that may be transferred, probably leaving out some goods from the pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemContainerObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: The objects in here need either PropertyItemContainer or PropertyDistributionCenter !

ValueDefinition.Name: UseQuestAreaKontor
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the kontor of area where the quest originates is used as a target to add/remove goods

ValueDefinition.Name: UseQuestGiverAsTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the ParticipantTarget will be replaced by the quest giver

ValueDefinition.Name: MemorizeBank
ValueDefinition.Description: .memBnk File that was exported from Editor

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: Island that the memorized objects/Streets should be applied to. Has to be compatible with map that exported the .memBnk

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: Look for target Island in this session

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnOverTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the Objects and Streets be spawned instantanously or over time?

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnOverTimeDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long until the last object/street was spawned?

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnOverTimeCenterObjectLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Which object (label) should be the center of the circle which marks the spawn spreading

Property.Name: ActionBindItemToQuest
Property.Description: Action to bind instances of items in the world to the quest of this action

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemToBind
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of all item instances that should be bound to a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The buff asset that should be applied or removed

ValueDefinition.Name: AddBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the buff should be added or removed (true = add)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this buff should affected the processing participant or a specific participant

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that should be affected

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: If you enter something here, the buff will automatically run out after the given time

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildObjectGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Replace objects in this object group with BuildObjects (e.g. railroad)

ValueDefinition.Name: NewParticipantID
ValueDefinition.Description: change owner of objects

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The item or asset pool that should be removed from the game

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecificSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to specify a session where the item(s) should be removed

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipsLeaveMapFirst
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all ships among the selected objects will leave the map before being destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingSourceParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the processing participant (mostly the owner of the parent condition) should be used as the source participant

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverSourceParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the participant who discovers someone

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverTargetParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the participant being discovered

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverParticipantOmitWelcomeMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the welcome message will not be triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableQuest
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest is enabled

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableTicks
ValueDefinition.Description: True if the game should be paused, False otherwise. Use with care!

ValueDefinition.Name: WinQuest
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest ends successfully otherwise it is marked as failed.

ValueDefinition.Name: AbortQuestExceptionally
ValueDefinition.Description: PLEASE HANDLE WITH CARE! Quests aborted this way will treat it as if it was internally aborted, see also https://confluence.ubisoft.com/display/anno7/Quest+Implementation+Guide for "Special Reason". If this flag is set, the flag "WinQuest" will be ignored

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session that should be entered. This session has to be loaded already!

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomacyAction
ValueDefinition.Description: The diplomatic action that should be executed

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticSourceUseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the source of the diplomatic action should be the processing participant. (Useful in Multiplayer)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticSourceParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The source participant who started the diplomatic action

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticTargetUseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the target of the diplomatic action should be the processing participant. (Useful in Multiplayer)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticTargetParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The target who is affected by the diplomatic action

ValueDefinition.Name: ScriptFileName
ValueDefinition.Description: The script file that should be executed

Property.Name: ActionFinishMemorization
Property.Description: Makes sure that all (desired) Pending Memorizations were finished. This allows for referencing those.

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionTarget_
ValueDefinition.Description: Required Parameter. In which session should Memorization be finished

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEntitiesInGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, no objects/streets are affected that are not part of this group

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEntitiesWithGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, no objects/streets are affected that are not part of this GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEntitiesOnIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, no objects/streets are affected that are not to be memorized on the given island

ValueDefinition.Name: OpenNewspaperUI
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, we will open the newspaper UI as soon as the action was triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: OpenNewspaperType
ValueDefinition.Description: If openNewspaperUI set to true, this defines the type of newspaper scene that should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: EditorMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: If a value is set, this message will be taken as editor welcome message in the newspaper scene. If nothing is set, the default message will be choosen

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyWelcomeRequiredAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset GUID that is needed to identify the correct reaction asset in the PamSy trigger: MenuWelcomeMessage

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowPamsyMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the editor should announce the new newspaper to the player

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadSession
ValueDefinition.Description: the session to load

ValueDefinition.Name: DoChangeDefaultVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: True, to also set the default visibility of the menu

ValueDefinition.Name: SetDefaultVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: The new default visibility. Only used when DoChangeDefaultVisibility is true

ValueDefinition.Name: Variable
ValueDefinition.Description: The variable that is modified by this action

ValueDefinition.Name: Modifier
ValueDefinition.Description: The modifier that should be used on the variable

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of value that should be used as modification value

ValueDefinition.Name: ModificationValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value that should be used to modify the varibale. Format: Time in seconds, Percentage in [0..100] (i.e. 78 for 78%)

ValueDefinition.Name: ModificationValueMin
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum limit of a random value that should be used to modify the varibale. Format: Time in seconds, Percentage in [0..100] (i.e. 78 for 78%)

ValueDefinition.Name: ModificationValueMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum limit of a random value that should be used to modify the varibale. Format: Time in seconds, Percentage in [0..100] (i.e. 78 for 78%)

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampVariableValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the varibale value should forced into a certian range of values (i.e. the varibale should always be between 30% and 80%)

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampValueMin
ValueDefinition.Description: The lower limit that the variable should never exceed, regardless of the modification applied

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampValueMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The upper limit that the variable should never exceed, regardless of the modification applied

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreEveryDistractionDuringMove
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the units won't get distracted by for example enemy ships and will move to their destination

ValueDefinition.Name: UseDangerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the unit will avoid the danger based on the danger layer of its owning participant

ValueDefinition.Name: PerformIntegrityCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the notification should only be triggered if the profile has been discovered/defeated/etc.

ValueDefinition.Name: Movie
ValueDefinition.Description: Link to a movie asset that should be enqueued

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressGamePause
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the game will NOT be paused during the movie

ValueDefinition.Name: ArticleEditorMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: If a value is set, this message will be taken as editor welcome message in the newspaper scene. If nothing is set, the default message will be choosen

ValueDefinition.Name: UnregisterTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: If false, the trigger will be created. CAUTION: If it is already created it will be reset to its origin state. If true, the trigger will be unregistered instead of registered

ValueDefinition.Name: InheritArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true if you want the area by the paren Quest/Trigger to be passed on to the newly registered trigger

Property.Name: ActionSetCamera
Property.Description: Sets the game camera to a certain position marker in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: PositionMarker
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that represents a position marker placed in world through the anno editor

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The session where the position marker should be found in

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: The session in which the island can be located

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The asset of the island that should be renamed

ValueDefinition.Name: NewIslandName
ValueDefinition.Description: The new name of the island

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandName
ValueDefinition.Description: which Island will change its reservation?

ValueDefinition.Name: NewOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to neutral to remove the reservation

ValueDefinition.Name: Visibility
ValueDefinition.Description: The new object visibility

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Show construction or deconstruction effect (after deconstruction, the object will be invisible forever)

ValueDefinition.Name: AlsoSetGameLogic
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the GameLogic of this object is set with the visibility. No visibility -> no GameLogic

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressSettingVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: This action can affect more than just visibility, i.e. changing GameLogic state. If these effects are desired without a change of visibility, you should set this flag. Unfortunately we canno name it "ModifyVisibility" with a default value of TRUE because of savegame compatibility.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualDamagePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The damage of the object in the range [0..100]

ValueDefinition.Name: WeatherTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Set weather types you want to trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeMirageEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you can start/stop the Miarge effect via SetMirageEffect

ValueDefinition.Name: SetMirageEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Works only if ChangeMirageEffect = true! If true mirage effect will be startet, false to stop

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: spawned objects will show this infolayer

ValueDefinition.Name: Highlight
ValueDefinition.Description: Highlights the spawn assets with an outline

ValueDefinition.Name: DoSetVisualSpawnOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you will visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualSpawnOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnObjectGroupLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: If a text is given the spawned object will be added to a group with the text as label. If the group did not exist before, it will be created

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableInitialSpreading
ValueDefinition.Description: The incident will spread on start

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableSpreading
ValueDefinition.Description: The incident will not spread by itself

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableIntensityTick
ValueDefinition.Description: If the intensityTick is disabled the intensity of every building stays stable (e.g. the incident resolver won't heal the buildings)

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableFireDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Disables the fire damage (if the incident is a fire ^^)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxInfectedObjectAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximal amount of objects that are affected by the incident (0 means all objects)

ValueDefinition.Name: PlayerIncidentCommunication
ValueDefinition.Description: The way this incident is communicated to the player (via notifications, newspaper articles, pamsy trigger...) configurable via the GeneralIncidentConfiguration

ValueDefinition.Name: startSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: Start this sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: SetLocalFeedbackSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: True if local feedback should also be set

ValueDefinition.Name: StartLocalFeedbackSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: The local feedback sequence that should override the default behaviour

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteLocalFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: Play StartLocalFeedbackSequence until next ChangeGUID

ValueDefinition.Name: InheritQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the action should pass on the quest area of the the quest assigned to this action

ValueDefinition.Name: InheritQuestSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the action should pass on the quest session of the the quest assigned to this action

ValueDefinition.Name: InheritQuestObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Inherits the list of all objects that were related to that quest, so they can be used by object actions

ValueDefinition.Name: UseCurrentSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the quest should be spawned for the session where the current player is in

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session where this quest should be started or a region(= list of sessions) where a session is randomly chosen from if the player entered that session already

ValueDefinition.Name: GetQuestSessionFromArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the session is determined by the given area. Needs an area to be set and also InheritQuestArea needs to be set!

ValueDefinition.Name: TreasureSessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: The session where this quest should be started or a region(= list of sessions) where a session is randomly chosen from if the player entered that session already

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTimerTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time that will be added to the timer with a given ID. Use a negative time to subtract time from the timer.

ValueDefinition.Name: PingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should the ping be visible

ValueDefinition.Name: UnloadSession
ValueDefinition.Description: the session that should be unloaded

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets get unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: UnhideAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets get visible

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockGroups
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets in these groups get unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: UnhideGroups
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets in these groups get visible

ValueDefinition.Name: UbisoftEventName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the event to send to ubiservices

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionProgressFieldName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the field where progress should be saved, can be empty

ValueDefinition.Name: SeasonToOverwriteWith
ValueDefinition.Description: The season that will overwrite the "next" season. Is the next season is already an overwriting season, this season will be queued.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteSeasonPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: A default overwrite season has priority 0 and will only be queued based on the time it was added. If priority > 0 then it might be the next season immediately.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewSeasonPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Sets a new season pool from which next seasons will be chosen from

ValueDefinition.Name: HiddenControl
ValueDefinition.Description: If the control is hidden it won't show up in the options menu. Can be used to implement options that should not get released yet

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowControllerPreview
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the controller preview is shown as reference in the options menu

ValueDefinition.Name: TextTextsource
ValueDefinition.Description: Textsource which returns the text next to the slider. Use >> percentage for (0-100) or >> optionValue for (0-1.0)

Property.Name: OptionGamepadButtonMapping
Property.Description: Used as a placeholder to dynamically add a list of gamepad button remappings

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingParticipant
