ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the owner should be chosen dynamically by the current context (e.g. quest asignee)

ValueDefinition.Name: PropertyBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether game object should or should not have the property

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalStartOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval the Scaling Value starts adding Rewards

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval Size

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalIncreasePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Increase of the Interval Size

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardPerInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Reward added for each Interval

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Value by how much the Reward Increases for each Interval

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardMaximum
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum amount of reward in total

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Initial value for the reward at the start

ValueDefinition.Name: HidePropsRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: While in build mode, hide props in this radius

ValueDefinition.Name: DeletePropsRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When constructing, remove props in this radius additionally to the blocking rect

ValueDefinition.Name: RemovePropsRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: for QuestObjects: Props are restored when Object is removed

ValueDefinition.Name: GroundDecalAssetExtra
ValueDefinition.Description: some building need three different ground plates, use this setting in that case

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteGroundDecalWithRegionQuay
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true the GroundDecal as well as the GroundDecalInvisible are replaced with the quay decals defined in the associated region asset.

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetOutside
ValueDefinition.Description: should a street be generated at the outside

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildDecalOutside
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if the ground decal should be placed outside of construction areas

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockWater
ValueDefinition.Description: should only be true for objects which are placed completly alone outside of island zones and cannot trap ships

ValueDefinition.Name: HasBuildingBaseTiles
ValueDefinition.Description: BuildingBaseTiles will be build if dummies are configured

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableDefaultTrafficFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the feedback layer will not get stamped into the pathplanner. This is used for special feedback for e.g. farms where we dont want public traffic feedback but still need the feedback layer for specuial feedback.

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveGrass
ValueDefinition.Description: You can disable the grass removal with this flag

ValueDefinition.Name: BlocksBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to false, other buildings can be placed here. How the ovelap of the two objects is handled will be left to the developer

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockWhileInvisible
ValueDefinition.Description: Some systems ingore invisible blockers. Overwrite this behaviour.

ValueDefinition.Name: HasBuildableTilesBelowArch
ValueDefinition.Description: TLDR: Set True for gates. If this is true and our BuildBlocker is more complex then our BuildBlockerAABB, then all buildable tiles within AABB are only buildable for some other Buildings (see [BelowArchBuildHeight]). If false, those tiles are buildable for all buildings. This should be set to True for Gate-Buildings to prevent HugeOrnamentals or other Gate-Buildings to be built within. This should be false for L-shape buildings, as they can be intertwined without problems.

ValueDefinition.Name: ArchHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: If [HasBuildableTilesBelowArch] is set, this value determines the height of the arch, so only tiles with a height lower or equal can be built below

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteBelowArchBuildHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the height of this building (when checked against another Arch building (see [ArchHeight])) is not taken from CFG-BoundingBox, but overwritten with [BelowArchBuildHeight]

ValueDefinition.Name: BelowArchBuildHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: See [ArchHeight] and [OverwriteBelowArchBuildHeight]

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalBlockRectSize
ValueDefinition.Description: the pathplanner update increases the update rect by this size to allow blockings outside of build blocker

Property.Name: Bridge
Property.Description: Property creates a Spline Mesh for Bridges

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipUnlockMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the unlock message for this building will be supressed

ValueDefinition.Name: Destructable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, player can destruct this building with destruction mode

ValueDefinition.Name: Movable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, player can move this building with move mode

ValueDefinition.Name: PickingAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: when copying with pipette, start buildmode with this guid instead

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionMenuText
ValueDefinition.Description: overrides the title in construction menu, if set

ValueDefinition.Name: SnapRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: tells the buildmode how far this object can be snapped

ValueDefinition.Name: SnapRadiusAlternativeOverwrite
ValueDefinition.Description: If this value is not zero and gamepad input is active, this value will be used as the snap radius.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionConfirmation
ValueDefinition.Description: When destroying via shortcut or destruction mode, the player has to confirm the destruction

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildModeRandomRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: if multiple buildings are placed (continued building or drawing a rect), this controls how subsequent buildings are rotated (0 -> same rotation, 90/180 -> random rotation in 90/180 steps)

ValueDefinition.Name: AssociatedRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: The regions in which this building can be placed.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: relative weight for random, 0 = 1

ValueDefinition.Name: DeactivateHideWhenClippingIntoCamera
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this building will not get invisible when clipping into the camera

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowChangeVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: Player can change variation with Shift+V in buildmode and when selecting

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyRelevant
ValueDefinition.Description: AI will ignore irrelevant buildings. If a building is flagged as SecondPartyRelevant this does not mean that the AI will necessarily parse the building, there are a couple of additional conditions which need to be met.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildModeStartDirectionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: when starting buildmode of harbor object, the direction of nearest coastline is used. This offset is only needed to point the harbor blocker in the intended direction

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepRotationInBlock
ValueDefinition.Description: BuildingBlocks are not allowed to rotate this building, e.g. because it has harbour blockers

ValueDefinition.Name: VariationIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: only fill if variations should have own icons in their object menu (e.g. hedge system)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowCodeToControlRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the code will decide if this building can be rotated with . / , while selected. If set to false this building cannot be rotated once build.

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnerChangeTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: put a value bigger 0 and this monument will not get destroyed when the owner changes, instead it is replaced with said GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleParentType
ValueDefinition.Description: When building this module from construction menu, automatically select the area unique parent building

ValueDefinition.Name: IsCreativeModeOrnament
ValueDefinition.Description: This building can only be unlocked in creative mode. When used in a stamp this info is shown in the upgrade infotip

Property.Name: BuildingModule
Property.Description: Addon to a production building

ValueDefinition.Name: PlazaSize
ValueDefinition.Description: >0 allows drag build of farmfields

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleType
ValueDefinition.Description: which limit is used?

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleMoodImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Background for Module object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: UniqueType
ValueDefinition.Description: If != none there can only be one building of all the buildings with the same uniqueType build per island

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowInfolayerOnlyIfRelevant
ValueDefinition.Description: Missing Bus Infolayer is only shown if a bus stop is already built

ValueDefinition.Name: BusNeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Which need is supplied via bus connection

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivationRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: BusActivation Buildings inside this radius are activated if the bus network is active (see StreetConnectionRange)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowNeeds
ValueDefinition.Description: Object menu shows needs in this order

Property.Name: Constructable
Property.Description: Defines how this object will be constructed.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Category for destruction mode

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionType
ValueDefinition.Description: if more than one object should be added to a destruction type, select one asset of that type and set it as DestructionType for every asset, leave it empty otherwise

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionMenuIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace icon when used in construction menu

ValueDefinition.Name: CultureSpawnGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Has this building a spawngroup behaviour (resident feedback)?

ValueDefinition.Name: UndiscoveredSet
ValueDefinition.Description: if an item set has not been discovered, this name is shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleListHeader
ValueDefinition.Description: the module overview in culture main building popup has this header

ValueDefinition.Name: OpenSetPages
ValueDefinition.Description: Text is shown on Button in ObjectmenuCulture

ValueDefinition.Name: HasPollution
ValueDefinition.Description: If this building has negative attractiveness (or gets negative by items), show a pollution effect

ValueDefinition.Name: Feedback_AllowSpawnAtEntranceComing
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, units will spawn at entrance and also on surrounding buildings. If false, the feedback units will not spawn at the entrance dummies but only on surrounding buildings. Used when entrance is clearly visible and we don't want to show a lot of spawning units out of nowhere.

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeedBoostPerModule
ValueDefinition.Description: per speed module the loading speed is increased by this factor (LoadingTime = GoodsAmount/LoadingSpeedBoost) The value 0.2 has the same effect as a 20% item

Property.Name: FloorStackOwner
Property.Description: sky scrapers have multiple floors

ValueDefinition.Name: FloorCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of floors between base and roof

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeTargetGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: when adding a floor, change guid to this

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowDirt
ValueDefinition.Description: Whithout GoodViewBuff, skyscrapers can show dirt

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionDelayPerFloor
ValueDefinition.Description: delay is increased with each following floor

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionDurationPerFloor
ValueDefinition.Description: duration is increased with each following floor

ValueDefinition.Name: HaciendaRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Base radius. Can be increased by population thresholds. Hacienda buildings outside of radius are paused.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalRadiusThresholds
ValueDefinition.Description: only the threshold with the highest reached resident amount adds to the hacienda radius

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvidesDifficultyInfluence
ValueDefinition.Description: Provides the investor influence as defined in the difficulty settings

ValueDefinition.Name: NumOfPiers
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many loading slots are available on this building

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long the building needs to load or unload the goods on a ship (in tons per second), can be changed by LoadingSpeedFactor of ship

ValueDefinition.Name: MinLoadingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long a ship at least should stay in the loading pier. Can be overwritten by ships if needed

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleLimits
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum allowed amount of building modules (set to 0 for unlimited modules)

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulesRequiredForFullProductivity
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to 0, all (ModuleLimit) modules are neded

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalModule
ValueDefinition.Description: Extra module that can be applied to this module owner. (i.e. Bright Harvest Tractor)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalModuleMustBeMainBuildingAdjacent
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. Tractor / Silo module with special build rules different to other modules

ValueDefinition.Name: AdjustModuleOrientationOnceSpecialModuleWasPlaced
ValueDefinition.Description: If the main modules should be axis oriented if a tractor / silo / fertilizer module was added. Used for vehicle feedback on farms

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleBuildRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: set to 0 if modules have to be build adjacent

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowModulesInSameHarbor
ValueDefinition.Description: Modules can be build free like with ModuleBuildRadius, but the build area is defined by the coastline

ValueDefinition.Name: ImplicitProductivityModules
ValueDefinition.Description: for productivity calculkation of farms, the main building counts as x additional farmfields

ValueDefinition.Name: AddModuleLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: Holding shift while building modules increases the module limit for ModuleType_Main

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSingleModuleUpgrading
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set then only the selected module will be upgraded after clicking on the upgrade from blueprint button. Otherwise all will be upgraded at once (farm fields for example)

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintModuleOption
ModuleButtonIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: owners with multiple construction options should configure the module button for the blueprint menu. If not configured, the first construction option is used (default for farms)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowRemainingModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: the module popup can show the remaining module count
for the blueprint menu: how should the module button look like and is there a popup with multiple options?

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: The next phase of the monument. 0 if this is the final state (completed)

ValueDefinition.Name: UseReplaceInsteadOfChangeGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set instead of changing the GUID on upgrade, the object is destroyed and a new one is created. Is used when properties have to change on upgrade.

ValueDefinition.Name: MicrophaseCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of microphases.Each microphase is a production cycle configured in FactoryBase

ValueDefinition.Name: ShutdownText
ValueDefinition.Description: Message is shown in Monument event screen if monument is in shutdown state

ValueDefinition.Name: FakePrerequisites
ValueDefinition.Description: Campaign tunnel needs demolition expert

ValueDefinition.Name: FinishButtonText
ValueDefinition.Description: The button to finish this phase has this text

ValueDefinition.Name: EventSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Background showing in EventSelection state of MonumentEvents

ValueDefinition.Name: BonusRewardAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used for getting additional bonus items from buffs

ValueDefinition.Name: AddOneToPhaseCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Regular monuments want to add 1 to their phase count since placing them is considered the first phase already. This should be false for preplaced monuments.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConnectToLogistics
ValueDefinition.Description: disables that a monument is connected to the logistics, this will break normal monuments but is in use for some special monuments in GGJ

ValueDefinition.Name: InfolayerWhileWorking
ValueDefinition.Description: if set this is shown while the monument is constructed (and blocks the initial pause infolayer, so a default infolayer with low prio should be set!)

ValueDefinition.Name: AccessEventText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text for small monument object menu describing what happens when you click on the start event button

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownText
ValueDefinition.Description: is shown instead of AccessEventText if Event is on cooldown

ValueDefinition.Name: EventConclusionText
ValueDefinition.Description: when collecting the reward this text explains where the reward is coming from

ValueDefinition.Name: InvestmentContribution
ValueDefinition.Description: shown on event size selection card

ValueDefinition.Name: RandomIdleVariations
VariationSoundSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound switch of te EventTypeSwitchGroup that will be set if this variation is chosen
first entry is the standard variation, duration of a variation is chosen randomly between MinDuration and MaxDuration

ValueDefinition.Name: PlazzaSize
ValueDefinition.Description: if above 0 you can draw a plazza out of this elements, one dimension of it restricted by this number

ValueDefinition.Name: OrnamentUnit
ValueDefinition.Description: grid size of this ornament, used in attractiveness calculation

ValueDefinition.Name: OrnamentType
ValueDefinition.Description: only ornament AttractivityTypes are allowed here!

ValueDefinition.Name: RepairDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: when switching to a new target, wait some time until start repairing

ValueDefinition.Name: HealBuildingsPerMinute
ValueDefinition.Description: when repairing buildings, this rate is used. Set to 0 if no buildings should be targeted

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: ID to find this button from the tutorial component

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTabData
HideTabsIfDLCNotActive
ValueDefinition.Description: If one of the following DLCs is not active we should hide the tabs. Tabs will only be shown if there is an AssemblyFilter
Tab in UI will only be shown if this asset is unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: SnapsToSlot
ValueDefinition.Description: Is this a slot or does this building need a slot to snap to?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotType
ValueDefinition.Description: What kind of slot is this / is needed

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkArea
ValueDefinition.Description: which workarea is attached to this slot building?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoChangeVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: if you snap to this slot, the variation changes automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: HighlightOnSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the WorkArea be highlighted when the complex is selected?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotCategoryName
ValueDefinition.Description: BuildingCategory in Objectmenu of slot buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkAreaSupportsLogistic
ValueDefinition.Description: Can Logicist transporter use WorkArea as target additional to main building?

ValueDefinition.Name: IdleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If the thirdparty menu is visible and no message was triggered for this time than the idle message will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: CurrentTier
ValueDefinition.Description: An ordering number indicating which tier the current building represents in the chain of upgrades for this building

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnerChangeGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: put a guid bigger than 0 here to not destroy this completly but just downgrade to that GUID when the owner changes

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatesBusStops
ValueDefinition.Description: Starting point for the Bus network of tourism DLC

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: The higher, the likelier that this CFG is spawned more often. Do not need to add up to one.

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawn_AmbientZones
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: In which ambient zones do we find this animal?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawn_Regions
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: In which regions do these animals spawn?

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountMin
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: How many units are in this group at minimum?

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountMax
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: How many units are in this group at maximum?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawn_RelativeProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: If autospawning: how likely is it to spawn this unit compared to others?

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: As animal CFGs are used both in AnimalSystem and in FeedbackEditor, and they often get a custom scale factor in FeedbackEditor, we also need one in AnimalSystem

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleDeviationFactorMin
ValueDefinition.Description: To have slight size-variations within the same herd, we additionally multiply every size with this factor. Allow every scale between ScaleDeviationMin*ScaleFactor and ScaleDeviationMax*ScaleFactor.

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleDeviationFactorMax
ValueDefinition.Description: To have slight size-variations within the same herd, we additionally multiply every size with this factor. Allow every scale between ScaleDeviationMin*ScaleFactor and ScaleDeviationMax*ScaleFactor.

Property.Name: AnimalFlock
Property.Description: Flock of animals, used for birds and fishes

ValueDefinition.Name: Speed
ValueDefinition.Description: The speed with which the single units fly

ValueDefinition.Name: HardBoundingBoxConstraint
ValueDefinition.Description: True: never ever leaves bounding box. A tiny bit less smooth movement. False: May leave bounding box to a small extent.

ValueDefinition.Name: Underwater
ValueDefinition.Description: Makes sure the units are never higher than the water surface.

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawnOverWholeMap
ValueDefinition.Description: Should some AutoSpawned Flocks fly over whole map?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawnOverIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Should some AutoSpawned Flocks be bound to certain Islands?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawnAtCoasts
ValueDefinition.Description: Should some AutoSpawned Flocks fly in circles around the Harbor?

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchesFishes
ValueDefinition.Description: Bird Flock can fly down and catch FlockFishes

ValueDefinition.Name: IsCatchableFish
ValueDefinition.Description: Other Bird Flocks can fly down to this fish flock and catch fishes

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: MinHeight above ground

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Max Height above ground

ValueDefinition.Name: Lands
ValueDefinition.Description: BirdFlock can land on the ground

ValueDefinition.Name: LikesToRunAround
ValueDefinition.Description: Should Running (instead of only walking) be triggered now and then? If false, herd only runs when it is fleeing.

ValueDefinition.Name: StandTogetherRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: How far away from herd center are individual animals allowed stand around.

ValueDefinition.Name: GroupPositionChangeInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: In which interval does the whole Herd try to find another center position

ValueDefinition.Name: IndividualPositionChangeInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: In which interval do individual units do small movements within StandTogetherRadius?

ValueDefinition.Name: Attacks
ValueDefinition.Description: If animals of this herd should attack other herds

ValueDefinition.Name: Attackable
ValueDefinition.Description: If this Herd can be attacked by another Herd

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyAutoSpawnNearRiverspots
ValueDefinition.Description: Should we suppress auto-spawning for herd areas without a river spot?

ValueDefinition.Name: GotoRiverSpotInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Herd will search a River Spot target at this interval

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSpotStayDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: After finding a river spot target, how long until moving on

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSpotInteractionProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: How many of the herd units will interact with the river spot, how many will just stand around like there was no river spot

Property.Name: ChannelTarget
Property.Description: Object that can be interacted with by a channel item. See ActionID::Channel

ValueDefinition.Name: CargoAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that is put into the ships container on collection

ValueDefinition.Name: WaitRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Object will stop walking when Commnad Ship is out of range.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaitForwardDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Moves the Wait-Circle-Center x units forward.

ValueDefinition.Name: FogOfWarSpecialDiscovery
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: THIS IS EXPENSIVE AND ONLY MAKES SENSE FOR REGROWING FOG_OF_WAR SPECIAL CASES. Will continuously undiscover a circle around the object with given radius as long as the object is alive for the ProcessingParticipant when this object is spawned by a ActionSpawnObject.

Property.Name: Scanner
Property.Description: Scanner vehicles search for command vehicles and fails their quest if one is found

ValueDefinition.Name: ScanRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: which area is scanned by the scanner

ValueDefinition.Name: FlyRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: in which distance from the guarded object should the scanner fly?

ValueDefinition.Name: FlyCircle
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 circle, 0,5 ellipse, 0 line (direction of line/ellipse is random)

ValueDefinition.Name: ScanEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: The scan range as particle effect displayed on the scanner (scaled by ScanRadius)

ValueDefinition.Name: AlarmTime
ValueDefinition.Description: When command vehicle is scanned, the scanner changes to alarm mode. After AlarmTime the quest fails.

ValueDefinition.Name: AlarmEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: The scan range as particle effect displayed on the scanner in alarm mode (scaled by ScanRadius)

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackableType
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty! The type or role this attackable plays within the game rules that decide when it is attackable.

ValueDefinition.Name: PausedTimeIfAttacked
ValueDefinition.Description: buildings get shutdown if under attack

ValueDefinition.Name: AlertRange
ValueDefinition.Description: If this attackable is attacked (or attacks) an enemy, it sends an alert to all ally units within this range. 0 = no alerts

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyObjectGroupOnDeath
ValueDefinition.Description: If object is dead, the complete object group is removed

ValueDefinition.Name: OmitPamsyUponDestruction
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a pamsy should be triggered when this attackable is destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: width of this object for accuracy calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: DefenseByAIFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: how will the AI defend this? 0 - never defend, 100 - defend with normal calculation, 200 - defend with higher prio, even if 2:1 outnumbered

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryDefensePoints
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for the AI to determine how strong their fleet / harbour defense is and should be

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryAirDefensePoints
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for the AI to determine how strong their air fleet / harbour air defense is and should be

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockBuildActionsAfterAttackDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: building actions: repair, move, destruct, upgrade are blocked after damaged by an attacker

ValueDefinition.Name: MoralePower
ValueDefinition.Description: morale to prevent military takeover

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandWarFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: Morale buildings show flag when island war is active

ValueDefinition.Name: HasRuinState
ValueDefinition.Description: When buildings loose their last Hitpoints, they are change to ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticles
ValueDefinition.Description: The smoke particles that will be spawned during ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticlesMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Min amount of smoke particles during ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticlesMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Max amount of smoke particles during ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticleRectBorderPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The smoke particles spawn on the whole building bounding box minus a border area - this value states how big of a percentage this border is on each of the 4 sides.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: When the building enters ruin state, one of the cfgs in here will be played

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionEffectsMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Min amount of explosion effects that will play on enter ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionEffectsMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Max amount of explosion effects that will play on enter ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealPerHealTick
ValueDefinition.Description: building heals this amount of HP per Heal tick (currently 1 per second)

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealPausedTimeIfAttacked
ValueDefinition.Description: building starts self repair after this time if not under attack anymore

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideAttackMarkerScale
ValueDefinition.Description: When set to anything >0, will be used as the scale for the attack marker instead of the mesh bounding boxes scale

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of damage that is dealt within one ProjectileSalve. CAUTION: Exploding Projectiles do not use this value

ValueDefinition.Name: ReloadTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How many 100ms game ticks does it take to fire the next projectile?

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetAngleVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: how much can this ship variate his target angle without turning itself

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackRangeApproachPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Range percentage of attack radius at which ships will stop & shoot as well as at which shooting ships will start chasing away driving ships

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDistanceToPatrolRouteToBeAggressiveIn
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum range we can be away from our patrol route to be able to start a passive attack. This helps to prevent use starting to attack an enemy when we are far away from our patrol route

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnSpan
ValueDefinition.Description: Degrees (0 - 360), that the turrent can rotate (half to the left of its initial rotation, half to the right)

ValueDefinition.Name: TurretCfg
ValueDefinition.Description: Config of the Turret (if none, no separate config will be spawned)

ValueDefinition.Name: FullVolleyTimeMin
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum time (in seconds) it takes for all projectiles to be shot. This is only relevant for ships with sidetracking & turrets

ValueDefinition.Name: FullVolleyTimeMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum time (in seconds) it takes for all projectiles to be shot. This is only relevant for ships with sidetracking & turrets

ValueDefinition.Name: VolleyMaxPerBulletRandomOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum time (in seconds) an individual bullet shot will be delayed by randomly. This will only be used for ships with side cannons

ValueDefinition.Name: EmitProjectileTimeAfterStartAnimation
ValueDefinition.Description: The time between the start of the attack animation and the spawn of the projectiles. In seconds,

ValueDefinition.Name: AfricaOnlyWeaponActivationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: !DoNotUseApartForAfricaPirate! [Can be removed for Limestone] Delay in milliseconds before Weapons are ready to shoot (needed for Towers / Turrets)

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyBase
ValueDefinition.Description: basic accuracy, width of a volley in tiles

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyIncreaseOverDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: increases accuracy if you get closer to the enemy, describes the percentage of the shot width a zero distance, e.g. 100% accuracy does not increase at all if target is closer or 0% the accuracy increases to maximum if getting closer

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracySpeedDecay
ValueDefinition.Description: accuracy is lost if the target moves, at this speed it loses 50% of accuray

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyByDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Attack accuracy by distance. Please enter values ascending, sorted by the distance to the enemy.

ValueDefinition.Name: EnemyDistanceRelToAttackRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance from us to the enemy, relative to our attack range. 0% = Enemy is right on top of us. 100% = Enemy is exactly our attack range away

ValueDefinition.Name: CorrespondingAccuracy
ValueDefinition.Description: The accuracy in % for the stated distance of the enemy.

ValueDefinition.Name: WeaponIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Shipyard menu shows icons for special weapons like airship turrets, flaks or flamethrowers

ValueDefinition.Name: Shafts
ValueDefinition.Description: The amounts of shafts this bombarder can use. Current maximum is 6 based on UI restrictions

Property.Name: CampaignBehaviour
Property.Description: Implements some special features for the campaign

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyOnCollect
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, delete object on collect

ValueDefinition.Name: OnCollect
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when collecting this object.

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectableType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines type of this collectable. Used to distinguish e.g. different types of allowed collectors

ValueDefinition.Name: OnScreenTextAsDivingBellReward
ValueDefinition.Description: Shows the onScreen notification in diving bell reward optic

ValueDefinition.Name: NotCollactableIfTargetStoragePartiallyFull
ValueDefinition.Description: Collection is blocked if not enough storage capacity in target

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDragShips
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of Collectables a collector can carry

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedToCollect
ValueDefinition.Description: All types of collectables that this collector is allowed to collect

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPlayerControllableVehicle
ValueDefinition.Description: This flag should be set true for all human-controllable ships (controllable vehicles are visible in ship list, game loose condition checks existance of a ship, only controllable ships can increase influence costs of other ships)

ValueDefinition.Name: FollowRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The Radius to keep while following another unit

ValueDefinition.Name: CommandChainLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum number of queued commands, 0 = ignore

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: The Higher a unit's Formation Priority, the further to the front it is positioned in Group-Based-Formations

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryShipPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: value used for calculating military strength

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryAirShipPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: value used for calculating air military strength

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeShipPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: value used for calculating highscore

ValueDefinition.Name: AirShipPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: value used for calculating highscore

ValueDefinition.Name: InsecurityAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: if an enemy vehicle is nearby an island, this attractiveness malus is added

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableVideoCaptureChanges
ValueDefinition.Description: Only use for video capture, might break the game! Makes ships not send any move commands.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipUniqueType
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to something != None the ship guid will be tracked as soon as acquired by the player. If the player then looses the ship replacements are offered on all traders which flagged to provide this replacement.

Property.Name: DayNightReaction
Property.Description: Is not needed for a Local Feedback Unit, but gives additional meta information

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitNightBehavior
ValueDefinition.Description: Overwrites the building night behavior for this unit if not default

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: After creating or moving, the building is paused for this time

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: block upgrade wile delayed contsruction is in progress

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockDowngrade
ValueDefinition.Description: block downgrade while delayed contsruction is in progress

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPickupDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: max distance from the diving bell object in which the diving bell command still works

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPickupTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum amount of time it takes to recover something (excluding length of diving animation)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPickupTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Max amount of time it takes to recover something (excluding length of diving animation)

ValueDefinition.Name: GetsCarriedByFlyers
ValueDefinition.Description: If a flyer wants to attach this draggable, its forced to fly down and link the draggable to its mesh. Note: cannot be disattached.

ValueDefinition.Name: DragRopeStiffness
ValueDefinition.Description: Should be between 0-1.

ValueDefinition.Name: DragRopeHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how high the rope will be placed on both ships

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideAssetWidthAndLength
ValueDefinition.Description: False: Use the assets bounding box as the units width/length, True: Use custom values

ValueDefinition.Name: Length
ValueDefinition.Description: Length of the capsule collider used for drifting (back to front)

ValueDefinition.Name: Width
ValueDefinition.Description: Width of the capsule collider used for drifting (left to right)

ValueDefinition.Name: FactorMovement
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast does this unit get moved by drifting

ValueDefinition.Name: FactorRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: How strong does this unit get rotated by drifting

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedByDriftingWhileIdle
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit is affected by drifting (tries to drift away from other drifters)

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedByDriftingWhileMoving
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit is affected by drifting (tries to drift away from other drifters)

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedQuality
ValueDefinition.Description: The quality that is affected by this provider

ValueDefinition.Name: DeltaValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The delta value applied by this provider to the specified quality

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplodeOnLethalDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Makes only sense in combination with PropertyAttackable

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisForceX
ValueDefinition.Description: The force applied to the X-Axis

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisForceY
ValueDefinition.Description: The force applied to the Y-Axis

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisForceZ
ValueDefinition.Description: The force applied to the Z-Axis

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The number of objects spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: HasHitNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a (reaction) notification should be fired when the projectile explodes (no hit or hit)

ValueDefinition.Name: HitSuccessNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification that should be played when the projectile hit a target

ValueDefinition.Name: HitFailNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification that should be played when the projectile hit NO target

ValueDefinition.Name: PauseMeshSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: SequenceSpeed of Mesh-Sequence is paused instead of changed to idle

ValueDefinition.Name: UpdateMeshSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: productivity changes automatically lead to mesh sequence changes

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreIncidents
ValueDefinition.Description: do not disable feedback for incidents (make sure that no persons are walking where flames appear)

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableOnAttack
ValueDefinition.Description: disable feedback if building has been recently attacked (PausedTimeOnAttack is needed)

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableOnIslandWar
ValueDefinition.Description: disable feedback if island war is active

ValueDefinition.Name: StopOldSequenceWhenStartingNewOne
ValueDefinition.Description: I true, the old sequence is reset when a new sequence is started.

Property.Name: IceFloe
Property.Description: Used for ice floes. Should disappaer and remove blocking when objects with a specific attribute are close enough

Property.Name: IceFloeDestroyer
Property.Description: Destroys all IceFloes in Distance

ValueDefinition.Name: ScrapAmountLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: when SCRAP_ITEM_DUMMY is replaced, this amount level unlocks the entries in ScrapPool with more amount

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemReplacementPools
ValueDefinition.Description: Some collectables contain only dummy items which are replaced with a real reward from the ReplacementPool

ValueDefinition.Name: Time
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 means life forever

ValueDefinition.Name: FlyDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for flotsam spawned from airships on land, determines the time it takes for the flotsam to land

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyVisibleInEditor
ValueDefinition.Description: Only visible in Editor

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: false = Object is set to invisible on map load (first session enter)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 for no construction effect

ValueDefinition.Name: DeconstructionEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 for no deconstruction effect

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: used for construct and deconstruct effect when moving buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeGUIDEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Effect Duration when upgrading, set to 0 if no effect should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ForbidCollapseEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: The collapse shader looks shitty on some rare meshes. Rnd cant easily fix that so we try to replace it with something similar like a simple fadeout

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreDamageDesaturation
ValueDefinition.Description: In rare cases, units get a destruction-texture assigned, that should not appear desaturated, so damage only results in flames, not in flames+meshDesaturation

ValueDefinition.Name: LogoMode
ValueDefinition.Description: DEPRECATED!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: SetCompanyLogo
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the company logo from the player will be added to the TextureAtlas and set for the RenderObject

ValueDefinition.Name: UnderwaterOutlineIfOwnedOrAllianceMember
ValueDefinition.Description: Outline for underwater objects (e.g. sea mines) visible for owner and alliance members

ValueDefinition.Name: TokenAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon that is displayed on the minimap

ValueDefinition.Name: StrategicMapAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon that is displayed on the strategic map

ValueDefinition.Name: TokenList
ValueDefinition.Description: List here all the minimap tokens that should have a different representation in the strategic map

ValueDefinition.Name: Color
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant if 'Interactive' is true

ValueDefinition.Name: Interactive
ValueDefinition.Description: If interactive, the Fields 'Visualization' and 'Color' are used, If not interactive, the Fields 'Texture Index' and 'Scaling' are relevant.

ValueDefinition.Name: Tooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant if 'Interactive' is false

ValueDefinition.Name: Scaling
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant if 'Interactive' is false. Scales the size of the picked Icon from the 'Texture Index' Field.

ValueDefinition.Name: TextureIndex
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant if 'Interactive' is false. Describes the position of an Icon in a pre-made picture file. Ask Andreas Jupe for additional Information.

ValueDefinition.Name: Filter
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the associated minimap filter that toggles the visibility of these kind of tokens

ValueDefinition.Name: UsePlayerColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Overrides the color setting and uses the player color to colorize the token

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreGameObjectVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this token won't turn invisible when the corresponding gameobject is turned invisble

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteNameWithTextAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the name of the nameable will be overwritten by the given text asset

ValueDefinition.Name: Variations
ValueDefinition.Description: Vector of variations.

ValueDefinition.Name: Filename
ValueDefinition.Description: path of the .cfg file;

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSkinName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the Default skin in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSkinDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Fluff text of the default skin in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSkinCategoryName
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the category a skin belongs to. Like name of a CDLC

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideDefaultIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional Parameter: If this path is set it overrides the standard icon for the Default Skin

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of skin assets

ValueDefinition.Name: AssignDefaultParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: True = When the object is placed in the editor. The assigned participant will be based on this asset configuration, not on the current editor state.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The role of a participant that is assigned to this object by default when placed in the editor.

ValueDefinition.Name: AddToObjectGroups
ValueDefinition.Description: Editor Feature: True = object is assigned to an object group/folder on creation in editor

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreForMinimapGeneration
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to true, the object is invisible while generating the minimap image

ValueDefinition.Name: CanPauseManually
ValueDefinition.Description: Can the player pause this object

ValueDefinition.Name: IsHaciendaDependent
ValueDefinition.Description: Building is paused if not inside of hacienda radius

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomIDFixedCam
ValueDefinition.Description: The zoom ID of that should be applied if the user is using the fixed cam

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomIDFreeCam
ValueDefinition.Description: The zoom ID of that should be applied if the user is using the free cam

ValueDefinition.Name: ShotHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Mortar: Maximum height in ballistic-curve, Torpedo: water-travel-height

ValueDefinition.Name: ShotAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: The angle at which the projectile should be shot

ValueDefinition.Name: ProjectileSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Currently only used by Aim Rocket & Straight Projectiles. Speed for initial firing and max speed while aiming. (In units per second, or units per session game tick for homing straight projectile types)

ValueDefinition.Name: Effectivities
ValueDefinition.Description: Map from GUID to Factor. If the GUID-Condition is fulfilled for an attacked object (e.g. attacked object is an object of given GUID), the factor is applied to the base damage

ValueDefinition.Name: GUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The GUID of an Attackable or things that can be linked to an Attackable

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: The factor that is multiplied to the damage, if given GUID-Condition is fulfilled by attacked object

ValueDefinition.Name: StatusEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: List of StatusEffects that will be applied on all units this projectile hits

ValueDefinition.Name: ApplyStatusEffectsWithoutDamageCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, status effects are applied to all hit objects, disregarding wether the object is damageable by the projectile

ValueDefinition.Name: StatusEffectChainDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: A description text for status effect chains

ValueDefinition.Name: ChainTotalRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Total Range around first hit where enemies can be hit

ValueDefinition.Name: ChainAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Child Projectiles are spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: How is Damage modified (0.5 means half-as-much-as-last-level)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRange
ValueDefinition.Description: How far can a projectile of this level travel? Can never travel further than ChainTotalRange around first hit

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnImpactObject
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. create a sea mine on impact

ValueDefinition.Name: HealedIncident
ValueDefinition.Description: projectile heals incident immediately from targeted buildings/ships

ValueDefinition.Name: HerdBlocking
ValueDefinition.Description: Does this prop block herd-animals? Passabel = blocking is ignored (use for bushes). PassableWhenSparse = single objects area passable, groups of objects not. Only center of object blocks (use for trees). NeverPassable = always blocking with full bounding box (use for rocks)

ValueDefinition.Name: VegetationType
ValueDefinition.Description: is this prop usable by a woodcutter?

ValueDefinition.Name: RespectDummySpawnerMap
ValueDefinition.Description: Set this value to 1 to IGNORE the dummy spawner map. Set to < 1 to place dummies only on positions which are valid in the dummy spawner map

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: Chance between 0 and 1 to spawn a dummy at a certain position. Independent of the RespectDummySpawnerMap value

ValueDefinition.Name: ChoseRandomVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the variation of the random slot is not kept when replacing

ValueDefinition.Name: ChoseRandomRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the direction of the replaced object is randomly chosen in 90 degree steps

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceType
ValueDefinition.Description: when set to a resource type, this gets assigned a finite resource amount

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceMinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: min amount of resources

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceRegrowFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: regrow speed depends on the depletion of the resource spot. Interval = FiniteResourceRegrowInterval + FiniteResourceRegrowInterval * (FiniteResourceRegrowFactor - amount * FiniteResourceRegrowFactor / capacity) . Set to 0 if you want a constant regrow rate.

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceReplenishPermit
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Item is used to replenish this resource slot

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceReplenishAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: When a replenish permit is used, how much resources are added?

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceVariationThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Variation changes depending on amount of remaining resources

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCSlotReplacements
DLC
ValueDefinition.Description: Weight is only considered if this DLC has not been active before, Replacement is only considered if this DLC is active (use 0 for a permanent blocker)

ValueDefinition.Name: OrDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: alternative DLC. Replacement is available if at least one of the two DLCs is active

ValueDefinition.Name: Replacement
ValueDefinition.Description: the usable mine slot that can be used as replacement if the DLC is active

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: Relative weight (all slots get replaced if all DLCs are active, the weight defines a relative share of all exisiting to be replaced slots in a session)

this editor object is a placeholder for a mine slot that will only become active if a specific DLC is activated. In contrast to normal random mine slots, this one is visible in game and always blocks its tiles

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: In which distant do attackable objects trigger explosion? 0 = only trigger explosion when we have a kamikaze-commando by AI or Human.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockSecondGUI
ValueDefinition.Description: When this is unlocked, the SecondGUIType is used instead of the normal GUIType

ValueDefinition.Name: StaticHelpEntryPoint
ValueDefinition.Description: Where to enter the static help page when opened from the selected object

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiSelectable
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, this object might be added to a multi selection

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructSelectable
ValueDefinition.Description: Safeguard attribute for objects that should be deletable but not selectable (like bridges). If selectable is set, this value will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: Should really be called [SelectionRectPriority]. When drawing a selection rect and multiple non-multi-select-compatible objects are within (e.g. a ship and a feedback unit), the priority determins which will be selected.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when selecting this object.

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: When this object is the part of an interaction, how far away should the Bounding spheres of Source and Target Spheres at least be? (only the maximum of source and target is used)

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantMessageTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: If not [NONE], this overwrites the target participant for the message.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoCorner
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip that is shown on infocorner (clear to hide infocorner)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedDragType
ValueDefinition.Description: Which drag operations may be dropped to this object?

ValueDefinition.Name: Baseprice
ValueDefinition.Description: The baseprice might be modified by factors (e.g. the damage percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: Resource
ValueDefinition.Description: Metaresources only

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBeSoldToTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to false the ship can not be actively sold to the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: SellPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is multiplied to the base price when the ship is beeing sold.

ValueDefinition.Name: FireDamagePerFireTick
ValueDefinition.Description: How much damage does this ship get every fire tick (fire tick rate can be set in the fire incident settings)

ValueDefinition.Name: Maintenance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maintenance per minute. costs are managed by MetaMaintenance

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableShipDestructionTracking
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this asset should be ignored for tracking as "destroyed ship" for tracking. Enable for assets that are not considered "real ships"

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableEscort
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this ship must not be escorted

Property.Name: Skin
Property.Description: Asset Data Property for the cfg file for skins

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the skin displayed in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the skin displayed in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinCategoryDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the category a skin belongs to. Like name of a CDLC

ValueDefinition.Name: DefensiveReturnDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for the PassiveDefense & ActiveDefense stance - The range ships will chase an enemy they started to attack before returning to where they stood in the bgeinning. Aggressive Stance will chase infinitly

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the Speed of Transportation Units walking on this tile. 1.0 means "take your normal speed, wherever that may be balanced"

ValueDefinition.Name: IsLogicRoad
ValueDefinition.Description: Street System is used for so many stuff (railways, decals, ...) but this means a good old road for logistic usage

ValueDefinition.Name: UsesObjectHighlighting
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. bridge and courtyard

ValueDefinition.Name: IsDeletable
ValueDefinition.Description: can the user delete this street

ValueDefinition.Name: HasFeedbackPathPlanningPenalty
ValueDefinition.Description: Do Feedback Unit try to avoid spending too much time on this street? (only necessary when IsLogicRoad is set)

ValueDefinition.Name: CfgAdditionAtlas
ValueDefinition.Description: If rendering CFGs instead of Decals, we use this atlas to map atlas-index to cfg.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeighborsThatMakeUsAdapt
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: Our own guid will be adapted to implicitely

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecuteTransitionRule
ValueDefinition.Description: this setting can copy the transition rule from another internalID

ValueDefinition.Name: NeighbourToTransitionRule
ValueDefinition.Description: this makes this GUID a neighbour of a specific transition rule, even if the rule requests another neighbour

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeModeTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: put an asset here, if upgrade mode should do something

ValueDefinition.Name: DowngradeModeTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: put an asset here, if downgrade mode should do something

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeedFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: actual Loading Speed consists of two factors: Loading speed of LoadingPier of building and Loading speed of trade route ship

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumLoadingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum time the ship has to wait while trading goods (in seconds) Will override the minimum loading time of a pier, if this one is longer

Property.Name: Trailer
Property.Description: Adds another object behind the main object

ValueDefinition.Name: TrailerType
ValueDefinition.Description: With what Type of connection is the linked object Connected to its parent?

ValueDefinition.Name: TrailerEndPartCfgVariations
ValueDefinition.Description: Which objects are linked to this object?

ValueDefinition.Name: CfgVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: Config File for Mesh that is carried around

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: How Likely to pick this LinkedCFG out of all configured

ValueDefinition.Name: Stiffness
ValueDefinition.Description: 0: Angle between parent and child object is not constrainted. 1: Child object always has same rotation as Parent Object

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialMovementType
ValueDefinition.Description: Do we use any special behaviour?

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortenSailsAfter
ValueDefinition.Description: Sails are shortened when ship is idle for this time. 0:00:00 means "never"

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = Disable Discover

ValueDefinition.Name: ReservationLength
ValueDefinition.Description: When using GridReservations (avoiding unit cluttering), this determines the size of the reserved rectangle. Length = from back to front.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReservationWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: When using GridReservations (avoiding unit cluttering), this determines the size of the reserved rectangle. Width = from left to right

ValueDefinition.Name: PathPlannerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Path Planner Layer does the unit use?

ValueDefinition.Name: ForcePrimitiveMovement
ValueDefinition.Description: Enforces simple movement where object does not accelerate / obey turn radii / turn while moving. Object just moves-stops-turns-moves-stops-turns...

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpensiveDirSmoothing
ValueDefinition.Description: Should only be used for important vehicles. Better algorithm for setting rotations (not used for first and last second of each way).

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnAroundRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: How big of a half-circle is added when the unit gets a new Path and tries to turn into new path direction. (0 = no turnAround)

ValueDefinition.Name: Acceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Acceleration

ValueDefinition.Name: Deceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Deceleration

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When driving a corner, how much should it be rounded? (corner-radius in world-units)

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How quick can we rotate around Y-axis? (degrees per second)

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnSpeedInPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: How quick can we rotate around Y-axis when we are turning in place? (degrees per second) - only used for ship-movement

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnDeceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: How much will we slow down in order to drive around a corner? 0 = no slow-down, 1 = slow down a lot

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnMovement
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Affects Hard turns at beginning of a new Command. 0 = Turn in place, then move. 100 = Move, even if you do not look in the right direction yet. [1-99] = While turning, do a bit of movement. This is only triggered for sharp turns at the beginning of a new movement command and will not happen when turn curves are used as they soften out harsh curves. Currently in game, this is the fallback value that is used when the start curve creation fails.

ValueDefinition.Name: LeaningSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast does unit change its leaning when driving curves? Nice Value: 0.3

ValueDefinition.Name: LeaningDamping
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast does unit turn towards "normal" rotation after a curve? Nice value: 0.13

ValueDefinition.Name: LeaningMaxAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum Leaning Angle (in degrees). Positive Value: Lean Inwards, Negative Value: Lean Outwards. 0 = no Leaning. Nice Value: 27

ValueDefinition.Name: ForwardSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Speed in world-units-per-second

ValueDefinition.Name: WindMinSlowdownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When driving against wind, whats the lowest possible Factor on speed

ValueDefinition.Name: WindSlowdownEffectOnTurningSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: [0.1 - 1] How much does "WindMinSlowDownFactor" affect us during turns?

ValueDefinition.Name: WindMaxSpeedupFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When driving towards wind, whats the max possible Factor on speed

ValueDefinition.Name: WindSpeedupEffectOnTurningSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: [0.1 - 1] How much does "WindMaxSpeedUpFactor" affect us during turns?

ValueDefinition.Name: CargoThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: At what cargo-slot fillage percentage (relative) will the CargoWeightStartFactor kick in to alter speed?

ValueDefinition.Name: CargoStartFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When we have cargo-slot-fillage percentage equal to CargoThreshold, what factor do we apply to speed?

ValueDefinition.Name: CargoFullFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When we have 100% cargo-slot-fillage percentage, what factor do we apply to speed?

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: At how much damage (relative) will the DamageStartFactor kick in to alter speed?

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageStartFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When we have damage equal to DamageThreshold, what factor do we apply to speed?

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageFullFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When we have 100% damage, what factor do we apply to speed?

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSlowdownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: After applying all speed factors, what minimum-speed-factor do we clamp it to?

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionTransferSpeedFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for the speed on the worldmap. A Factor of e.g. 2 means this ship will be transfered from one session to another twice as fast as other ships

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreWeightFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Base Value for Upgrades that reduce the effect of weight on the ship speed

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreDamageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Base Value for Upgrades that reduce the effect of damage on the ship speed

ValueDefinition.Name: CurveSegmentDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: When partitioning the Circle into linear segments, how dense should these be?

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipDoubleClickSelectionRange
ValueDefinition.Description: double clicking on a ship selects all the ships with the same GUID in this range

ValueDefinition.Name: RelevantSkinGUIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: Skin GUIDS of the skins that are relevant for influencing the music. If empty, all skins are relevant.

Property.Name: DynamicVariation
Property.Description: Property for objects that choose .cfg during runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: ValidFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: Value at which the selected text should be chosen. Ignored for the first entry in the list, so all values below map to this one.

Property.Name: VariableValue
Property.Description: Property that provides a value either as a plain value or through a variable

ValueDefinition.Name: UseVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a variable should be used as value

ValueDefinition.Name: FloatValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the attribute

ValueDefinition.Name: VariableUsed
ValueDefinition.Description: The variable that should be used as value

Property.Name: AmbientArea
Property.Description: Describes Local Light Variations

Property.Name: MusicArea
Property.Description: Plays Music when camera enters a given Radius

ValueDefinition.Name: Playlist
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Playlist should be played when camera comes into radius?

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBeforeStartPlay
ValueDefinition.Description: When Radius is entered, the music is only played when we stay at least that time within

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownBeforeNextPlay
ValueDefinition.Description: After we started playing, we wait until this timespan elapsed before we check radius-critera for replay

Property.Name: WorkAreaPath
Property.Description: handles the "Workarea Rollercoaster"

ValueDefinition.Name: Building
ValueDefinition.Description: Building

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How Long does an emitter sound (vehicle that goes out of camera / disappears) fade out?

ValueDefinition.Name: TrafficSoundEmitterCount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many SoundEmitters do we have simultanously to represent all visible vehicles

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackLeaning
ValueDefinition.Description: Basic value for all feedback leanings (further modified by speed and per-asset-value)

ValueDefinition.Name: ClippingInfos
ValueDefinition.Description: How are Traffic and Local Feedback Units Clipped?

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Over which Range (distance to clip-distance) do the units start to fade out before they clip

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistances
ValueDefinition.Description: At which distance do the units clip?

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistanceMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Clip Distance is a random Value between DistanceMin and DistanceMax

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistanceMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Clip Distance is a random Value between DistanceMin and DistanceMax

ValueDefinition.Name: ApproachInDummyDirection
ValueDefinition.Description: E.g. a fishing-dummy is directed towards the water. So we have to approach it from the land, i.e. in dummy direction. A sit-dummy is facing from the benchback to the area in front of the bench, so we have to approach it against dummy direction.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountFactorByQualitySetting
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of units tied to the quality setting. 0 = Low, 1 = Medium, 2 = High, 3 = Very High, 4 = Ultra High

ValueDefinition.Name: Limit
ValueDefinition.Description: How much units total can be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: On which level the limit is applied (session, area, spawn group, ...)

ValueDefinition.Name: DespawnUnitsOnLimitPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Start despawning out of frustum units when current limit is at chosen percent of total limit

ValueDefinition.Name: DespawnFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Despawn chosen amount of units at once

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepUnitsCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not despawn this amount of out of frustum units to avoid empty map

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Spawn this amount of units per tick per spawngroup

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxUnitSpawnPerAreaPerTick
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to anything > 0, this is the limit of how many units can be spawned per area per tick

ValueDefinition.Name: DeleteInactiveSessionUnitsAfter
ValueDefinition.Description: If more than 0 all feedback units will be killed in inactive session after set delay

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetUnitCountFactor_OutOfFrustum
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1] determines a factor on the desired target unit count of out of frustum spawn groups

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit count is dependent on amount of burning buildings, type of burning buildings etc. So this is just a factor to scale it.

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenersPerDemagogueBase
ValueDefinition.Description: The base amount of listeners per demagogue

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenersPerDemagogueIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Every x intensity [0..100] of the associated building an additional Listener is called (where x is this value)

ValueDefinition.Name: DemagoguePerBuildingBase
ValueDefinition.Description: The base amount of demagogues per Building

ValueDefinition.Name: DemagoguePerBuildingIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Every x intensity [0..100] of the associated building an additional Demagogue is spawned (where x is this value)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinLooks
ValueDefinition.Description: How many things a visitor should see on one visit (minimum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLooks
ValueDefinition.Description: How many things a visitor should see on one visit (maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinLookDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should a visitor take a look on an object (minimum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLookDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should a visitor take a look on an object (maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinVisitorsCultural
ValueDefinition.Description: How many visitors do culturals attract at 0 attractivity -> No built modules / items

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxVisitorsCultural
ValueDefinition.Description: How many visitors do culturals attract at "max attractivity" (other balancing value)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsiderIslandVisitorFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the amount of island visitors will have an impact on the attracted monument visitors

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseSpawnRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum range in which the visitors are spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSpawnRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum range in which the visitors are spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSpawnBuildingsToExpand
ValueDefinition.Description: If the system finds less spawn buildings in the range than this value, it will expand the range

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSpawnBuildingsToShrink
ValueDefinition.Description: If the system finds more spawn buildings in the range than this value, it will decrease the range

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnRangeIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Range in which the spawn area is shrinking/expanding

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: If the set amount of attractiveness is reached, 100% of MaxVisitors are spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnResidenceEntranceRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Range 0-1. On 0 all the visitors will spawn at the entrance. On 1 all the visitors will spawn at surrounding residence buildings. 0.5 means 50% spawn at residence, 50% spawn at the entrance.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTouristsResidenceRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Range 0-1. On 0 all visitors are residence persons. On 1 all the visitors will be tourists. 0.5 means 50% tourists, 50% residence persons

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHappiness
ValueDefinition.Description: The given mood is choosen when the happiness is bigger or equal than the given value

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWorkPlaces
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines on how many places every unit should work at least

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWorkPlaces
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines on how many places every unit should work at maximum

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWorkDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long an unit should work on a single place (minimum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWorkDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long an unit should work on a single place (maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSearchRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: How far the units should search for a new workplace

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryTakeoverUnitCountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for how many units there will be during military takeover. E.g. 0.5 -> Only 59% of the units will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time span between the spawning of two units

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnIntervalDerivation
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the random time derivation of SpawnInterval

ValueDefinition.Name: usesPerlingNoise
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, props will spawn using the perling distribution, otherwise they will be evenly distributed

ValueDefinition.Name: PerlingFrequency
ValueDefinition.Description: if using Perling noise, the frequency of the noise

ValueDefinition.Name: PerlingThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if using Perling noise, the threshold of the noise

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: Which class is chosen depends on the weight. So if there are 2 classes, Class1 with weight 30 and Class2 with weight 70 it's more likely that Class2 is chosen (with 70% probability)

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: Which class is chosen depends on the weight. So if there are 2 classes, Class1 with weight 30 and Class2 with weight 70 it's more likely that Class2 is chosen (with 70% probability)

ValueDefinition.Name: TourismBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Buildings in this list will be considered tourism buildings and therefore only spawn feedback units from the tourism pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWaterAvailSizeToSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: When trying to spawn the water avail has to be this size minimum before a unit will be spawned. Used to not spawn ships in very small water areas. !!!! Don't use big numbers here!! This is quire performance heavy!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPierTourists
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximal amount of tourists which will get spawned at the pier.

ValueDefinition.Name: TourismPierFeedbackFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A pier will spawn min( #visitors * TourismPierFeedbackFactor , MaxPierTourists) tourists

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount_Default
ValueDefinition.Description: UnitCount, when the building is non motorized and has 100% productivity? (is scaled up and down in a hardcoded way, depending on productivity and field count)

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkingSequenceTimeMin
ValueDefinition.Description: in ms

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkingSequenceTimeMax
ValueDefinition.Description: in ms

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount_BaseModulesCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Count when [CurFarmFieldCount] == [FarmFieldCount_NonMotorized]

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount_AdditionalModulesCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Count when [CurFarmFieldCount] >= [FarmFieldCount_Motorized]

ValueDefinition.Name: DrivesRegularPattern
ValueDefinition.Description: Are Target positions picked randomly or in a Right-Down-Left-Down-Right-Down Pattern

ValueDefinition.Name: DrivesRectengularInGrid
ValueDefinition.Description: Does the tractor only drive in 0 90 180 270 degree angles or also diagonally?

ValueDefinition.Name: PercentageBeforeParade
ValueDefinition.Description: Relative to the parade length, how many people are spawned before the parade reaches that position

ValueDefinition.Name: PercentageAfterParade
ValueDefinition.Description: Relative to the parade length, how many people stay in line after the parade has passed them

ValueDefinition.Name: MinParadeDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum distance from the first row of spectators to the parade

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredSpace
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the reserved square space for each spectator

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnChunkLength
ValueDefinition.Description: How long it is the area of spectators that are spawned each time

ValueDefinition.Name: PercentageSpawnOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: How random it is the position inside the required space for an espectator (zero means in the center of the square)

ValueDefinition.Name: DensityRows
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many rows of spectators and with which density they are

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Time span between the spawning of two units

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnIntervalDerivation
ValueDefinition.Description: Random time derivation of SpawnInterval

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedReactions
ValueDefinition.Description: In contrast to @FeedbackClassFlags allowed reactions are common and therefore true for most units. The reactions this unit is allowed to perform. E.g. to listen to a priest the reaction "listen" is required.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClassFlags
ValueDefinition.Description: In contrast to @FeedbackReaction class flags very special and therefore false for most units.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSpecialPathPlannerLayer_Deprecated
ValueDefinition.Description: Does the unit use Special-Blocking information e.g. Fisherboat or FarmWorker

ValueDefinition.Name: HappyEventDates
ValueDefinition.Description: When a HappyEvent is set this unit class will only be shown if this happy event is currently active. If none is set it will always be active

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: -1 : take speed from sequence speed

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: In which distance from camera does an Animal Group get Clipped

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeRange
ValueDefinition.Description: How far in front of the clip distance does the Group start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: OverseaDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Bird Flocks are there that fly over the whole map? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerIslandDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Bird Flocks are there that stay within island bounds? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Bird Flocks are there that circle around a coast line? (1 = every coast)

ValueDefinition.Name: CityBuildingsPerDynamicFlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Roughly every x residences in a city spawn a flock above the city

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastBuildingsPerDynamicFlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Roughly every x coast buildings at a harbour spawn a flock above the harbour

ValueDefinition.Name: HerdDensity
