ValueDefinition.Description: How many Herds are there? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: FishFlockOverseaDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many FishFlocks are there that run the BirdFlock algorithm and are placed overseas? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: FishFlockCoastDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many FishFlocks are there that run the BirdFlock algorithm and are placed near Coasts? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: OverseaDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many FishShoals are there that travel around the whole map? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: HeightmapRelevantRiverLabels
ValueDefinition.Description: Rivers with one of these labels will be considered for height calculation. Used for rivers that will change their height in game (like the river behind the dam in SA)

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotsForBuy
ValueDefinition.Description: How many slots can be used in the active trade for buying?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotsForSell
ValueDefinition.Description: How many slots can be used in the active trade for selling?

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodValueFromDocklandMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: if this value is above 0 goods price will be calculated with the new algorithm from docklands

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyInvalidMoves
ValueDefinition.Description: Allow invalid moves. Without a multi move is blocked if one building is not valid

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRectSize
ValueDefinition.Description: MultiMove/-Copy/Stamps allow a square of this size

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreBuildCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for Scenarios to turn of build costs

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHarbourAreaRenderCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum amount of harbour areas that will be rendered during placement of any coastal objects

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiPlaceGridRadiusMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Grid radius multiplier for multi move / copy tools. The radius itself is based on the size of the rect, defined by the placed objects.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCosmeticModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum additional modules that can be built for factories. These cosmetic modules do not have any effect on the production.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimapPingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long the minimap ping lasts

ValueDefinition.Name: LocalPingMarkerAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: ping marker used for the pings of the local player

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: ping marker used for the pings of other co-op players

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerLifetime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long a ping marker stays before it is removed

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerInfolayerOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: If a building is pinged, this value defines how far above (or below) the infolayer the marker will be placed

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerGroundOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: If a location is pinged, this value defines how far above the ground the marker will be placed

ValueDefinition.Name: CoopMarker2DSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 2D sound for the markers of remote coop players

ValueDefinition.Name: LocalCoopMarker3DSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D sound for the marker of the local player

ValueDefinition.Name: Time
ValueDefinition.Description: Time from 0 to 24

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: UI Icon representing this time

ValueDefinition.Name: NightTimespans
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: ASK CODER BEFORE CHANGING! (Effects multiple systems). Describes at which times Feedback/Audio & co start to change their behaviour. Should be in sync with what artistis define visually in ambient settings.

ValueDefinition.Name: GameDaytimeToRendererDaytimeMapInfo
ValueDefinition.Description: This is supposed to a temporary solution to be able to stretch day and night without changing all the curves. Should be removed once everything is in place.

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandDilation
ValueDefinition.Description: How much we dilate the island shape to cover everything with fog?

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandDiscoverySpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how fast islands are discovered (radius increase per second)

ValueDefinition.Name: TileFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the duration it takes to fade out one single tile (in seconds)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxFragmentSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Undiscovered shapes smaller than this value are fragments and will fade out automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoveredSessions
ValueDefinition.Description: This list contains all session which should be discovered right from the beginning (no fog of war)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoveryEventObjectLabelPrefix
ValueDefinition.Description: If objects with a label or of a group starting with this prefix will be discovered an event will be triggered by the discovery manager. Events will only be sent once. CAN ONLY GUARANTEE EVENTS FOR NON-MOVING UNITS THAT ARE PLACED IN THE MAP FROM THE VERY BEGINNING AT THE MOMENT!

ValueDefinition.Name: HistoryInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the interval between two economy snapshots. These snapshots are used to display graphs in the economy statistic UI

ValueDefinition.Name: HistoryLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long we want to capture economy data. E.g. two hours means the user can see the data of the last two hours

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value this quality starts at

ValueDefinition.Name: ForestationImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: How much should forestation impact this quality? 0 = 0%, 1 = 100%, 2 = 200% etc

ValueDefinition.Name: IllnessChanceFactorZeroAt
ValueDefinition.Description: The water quality value at which the illness chance caused by water quality starts to get active

ValueDefinition.Name: IllnessChanceFactorOneAt
ValueDefinition.Description: The water quality value at which the illness chance caused by water quality is fully active at

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterRegenerationUpgradeBase100
ValueDefinition.Description: Care: The valuegets divided by 100 before being applied. This is to give the possibility to balance values like -150 (=-1.5).

ValueDefinition.Name: AirRegenerationUpgradeBase100
ValueDefinition.Description: Care: The valuegets divided by 100 before being applied. This is to give the possibility to balance values like -150 (=-1.5).

ValueDefinition.Name: SoilRegenerationUpgradeBase100
ValueDefinition.Description: Care: The valuegets divided by 100 before being applied. This is to give the possibility to balance values like -150 (=-1.5).

ValueDefinition.Name: DeltaIs0AtForestationPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The forestation percentage at which the delta caused by forestation is 0

ValueDefinition.Name: ForestationPercentageThatCauses1Delta
ValueDefinition.Description: If this value is 20, that means that every 20% forestation over/under the initial forestation causes a forestation delta value of 1.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumPositiveForestationDeltaCaused
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum positive delta that can be caused by forestation

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumNegativeForestationDeltaCaused
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum negative delta that can be caused by forestation

ValueDefinition.Name: QualityMaximumValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The highest value that a quality can reach

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal Amount of algae in a standard size harbor when reached minmal water quality

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterQualityMax
ValueDefinition.Description: When reaching this water quality, one algae is spawned in a standard harbor

ValueDefinition.Name: StandardHarborSize
ValueDefinition.Description: amount of tiles in a standard harbor

ValueDefinition.Name: AllAnimalGroupsVisibleAtIslandHealthPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The island health percentage [0; 100} at which the maximum amount of animals roam the island

ValueDefinition.Name: NoAnimalGroupsVisibleAtIslandHealthPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The island health percentage [0; 100} at which the no animals roam around the island

ValueDefinition.Name: ImpactOnLUTBlending
ValueDefinition.Description: How much does a value of 0 for this quality cause us to blend toward the desaturated LUT, with 0.0 = 0% and 1.0 = 100%.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestGiver
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit that spawns as quest giver.

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroductionMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Message that gets triggered when first talking to QuestGiver (Only Audio)

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroductionMessageText
ValueDefinition.Description: The additional Text displayed for the introduction Message

ValueDefinition.Name: TaskType
ValueDefinition.Description: What is your task? (Depending on this the ReferenceAsset is interpreted differently)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReferenceAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: For TaskType Building, the building you have to interact with. For TaskType Collect the FeedbackUnits that should be spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReturnToQuestGiverMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Message that tells you, you have finished the task and should head back to the quest giver (Only Audio)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReturnToQuestGiverMessageText
ValueDefinition.Description: The additional Text displayed for the ReturnToQuestGiver Message

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectObjects_SpawnCount
ValueDefinition.Description: When TaskType == Collect, the amount of objects that should be spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectObjects_FindCount
ValueDefinition.Description: When TaskType == Collect, the amount of objects you have to find in order to complete the task

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectObjects_Moves
ValueDefinition.Description: When TaskType == Collect, tells the spawned objects whether they should be static or move around

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Message when the Quest succeeded (Only Audio)

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessMessageText
ValueDefinition.Description: The additional Text displayed for the success Message

ValueDefinition.Name: Reward
ValueDefinition.Description: Reward when quest was successfull

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestInfo
ValueDefinition.Description: Export Plz

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceStartQuest_Debug
ValueDefinition.Description: -1 == dont force. When this is set, the StartNewQuests-Logic ignores all Quests but this one (index within the MiniQuest-Array). As there is no DebugInfoPage to start specific quests, this is your workaround. However the quests precondition still has to be met.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestIndicatorCfg
ValueDefinition.Description: The InfoLayer-Icon above the quest giver.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsoleTextScale
ValueDefinition.Description: Scale applied to quest info texts in the top left of the screen

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingSpeedRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: E.g. used for rollercoaster sound

ValueDefinition.Name: Updates
ValueDefinition.Description: Add new entries at the end (index is used to track which change has already been applied to a savegame)

ValueDefinition.Name: States
ValueDefinition.Description: When happiness is bigger or equal this value, the happiness state is applied

ValueDefinition.Name: Value
ValueDefinition.Description: When happiness is bigger or equal this value, the happiness state is applied. Value for the very first entry is ignored because this is used as default value

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessWithoutPollution
ValueDefinition.Description: How much happiness we gain if there is no pollution on our island

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessWithMaxPollution
ValueDefinition.Description: How much happiness we loose at maximum with a very strong pollution

ValueDefinition.Name: Steepness
ValueDefinition.Description: steepness of happiness loss with pollution

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Threshold the happiness started to loose

ValueDefinition.Name: Rate
ValueDefinition.Description: rate at which the happiness decreased per % of morale

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: StartValue is applied when no island war is active. When an island war is active, the StartValue is subtracted by the calculated happiness of the morale loss

ValueDefinition.Name: FactoryNoHeatAmbientSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: The switch choice which is set if the factory is not heated

ValueDefinition.Name: FactoryHeatedAmbientSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: The switch choice which is set if the factory is heated

ValueDefinition.Name: MenuAmbientSwitchDefault
ValueDefinition.Description: Whenever a building which doesn't need heat is selected the group is set to this switch

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalHighscoreFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A global modifier. Every score is multipied with it. Usefull to change 100 to 1000

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the total production (t/m)

ValueDefinition.Name: StorageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the total amount of stored goods in islands (t)

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeShipPointsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the tradeship points.

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryShipPointsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the militaryship points.

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the attractiveness value.

ValueDefinition.Name: CompletedSetFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the completed sets

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketedItemsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the amount of socketed items

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoveredItemsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the amount of discovered items.

ValueDefinition.Name: BalanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the income balance.

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalPopulationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Balancing modifier for all populations. Gets multiplied with every population score

ValueDefinition.Name: UrbanizationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the skyscrapers with the highes urbanization effect

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationBalancing
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains all factors for the different populations. ! don't forget to add the new population and its balancing here, when creating a new one!

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: In which category should this entry be shown?

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: The GUID of the text next to the icon, Leave empty if we don't want to show a text here.

ValueDefinition.Name: IconPath
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon shown for this entry

ValueDefinition.Name: Infotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip GUID for this entry

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: This UI Entry gets only shown if the player has this dlc activated in the current session

ValueDefinition.Name: OrNeededDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: Alternative DLC to activate this Highscore element

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowScoreIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, the score icon will be displayed next to the score text

ValueDefinition.Name: ModdingIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Filepath to the icon, which is shown in the highscore screen if the player has a modded game

ValueDefinition.Name: PlaytimeIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon infront of the playtime in the highscore screen

ValueDefinition.Name: CurrencyIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: filepath for the icon

ValueDefinition.Name: DifficultyLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Text guid for the difficulty label

ValueDefinition.Name: PlaytimeLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Text guid for the playtime label

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationInfotipGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: infotip for the population entries in the global population category

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionBalanceInfotipGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: infotip for the single session entries in the economic category

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowCategoryIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, The score icon is displayed behind the category score of each category

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenSellShareDiscount
ValueDefinition.Description: Selling to queen

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenBuyShareDiscount
ValueDefinition.Description: discount when buying from queen

ValueDefinition.Name: TakeoverMoneyCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Hostile takeover costs (islandValue + buildingsValue)*TakeoverMoneyCostFactor

ValueDefinition.Name: ShareIncomeTaxFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Total dividend as factor on balance

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandSellBasePrice
ValueDefinition.Description: When selling, this fixed island value is used

ValueDefinition.Name: FreeAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of free buildings/units a player can build before the influence costs are needed

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceCosts
ValueDefinition.ExcludedVersions: if more than the FreeAmount is used, each building/unit costs influence

ValueDefinition.Name: SubCategoryInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip is shown on back of category card

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryBuffs
ValueDefinition.ExcludedVersions: Multiple Buffs can be active at once

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSpentInfluence
ValueDefinition.Description: How much influence needs to be spent until a player is eligible to get this buff (sort the buffs from highes tier to lowest prerequisite)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSpentInfluence
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to 0 for no limit, otherwise set to next levels MinSpentInfluence if the buff is only active for one level

ValueDefinition.Name: SharePriceKontorFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: sharePrice = SharePriceKontorFactor * kontorInfluenceCost / 5 + BaseSharePrice

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableFeatureInfluence
ValueDefinition.Description: Remove influence feature from game? Do not forget to also disable newspaper feature and island shares and check costs of charter ships if trade routes are not disabled!

ValueDefinition.Name: PropagandaInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Special infotip only needed for gamepad version

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigationSpreading
ValueDefinition.Description: define how water spreading works

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigationSpreadRule
ValueDefinition.Description: which rule is used to spread the water

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigationTiles
ValueDefinition.Description: defines different tile types which influence water generation

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBetweenFillSpread
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = 100ms, 30 = 3s. How long does it take for one canal tile to spread its water to the next one.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterPlaneMovesIn
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: Does not work if ADAPT_TO_TERRAIN is activated in waterplane cfg. Moves CFG additional to FadeIn.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterPlaneMovesOut
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: Does not work if ADAPT_TO_TERRAIN is activated in waterplane cfg. Moves CFG additional to FadeOut.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterPlaneFadeInDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst?!

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterPlaneFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst?!

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticleFillPlaza
ValueDefinition.Description: If we simultanously fill a big canal plaza, the inner tiles of this frontline will use this particle effect instead

ValueDefinition.Name: PlankCfg_Wall_Open
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst

ValueDefinition.Name: PlankCfg_Open_Open
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst

ValueDefinition.Name: PlankMovesIn
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: Does not work if ADAPT_TO_TERRAIN is activated in Plank cfg. Moves CFG additional to FadeIn.

ValueDefinition.Name: PlankMovesOut
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: Does not work if ADAPT_TO_TERRAIN is activated in Plank cfg. Moves CFG additional to FadeOut.

ValueDefinition.Name: FadingSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: 0.001 == super slow, 1 == immediately

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = no blur at all

ValueDefinition.Name: StaticIrrigationRandomizerFrequency
ValueDefinition.Description: Frequency that alternates between MAX_SPREAD and MIN_SPREAD for randomized-spread-sources

ValueDefinition.Name: CreativeModeItemCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Cooldown that is applied to all items when transfered in creative mode

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorSlotMoveThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If a kontor slot is too far away from the ship, it automatically changes its position

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorBuildDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Max distance in which a ship can build a kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorSwitchCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: Money costs to switch a kontor to the imperial kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: CanDamageTargetedAttack
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this attacker can start targeted (or counter) attack on that type of target

ValueDefinition.Name: CanDamageTargetedAutoAttack
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this attacker can start auto targeted attacks on that type of target. Auto-attacks exclude counter attacks

ValueDefinition.Name: CanDamageUntargeted
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this attacker can cause damage by untargeted/AOE attacks on that type of target

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluencedDangerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: The danger layer that objects with this attack type cause danger in

ValueDefinition.Name: RespectedDangerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: The danger layer that objects with this attackable type are referring to when respecting danger

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowDamageFlyouts
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which health related flyouts should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: LowHealthThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When health is below this value, show the health bar as 'low health'. Value in percent (0-1)

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluencedDangerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: The danger layer that objects with this attack type are causing danger in

ValueDefinition.Name: BombardementProjectiles
ValueDefinition.Description: Used by AI; Defines the projectiles to be used for any of the AI bombardement types

ValueDefinition.Name: AmmoGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the bombardment ammunition good to use to find the fitting projectile

ValueDefinition.Name: BombardementUIFewProjectiles
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of projectiles in a barrage that needs to be exceeded for the effect indicator in the UI to start to show up

ValueDefinition.Name: BombardementUIManyProjectiles
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of projectiles in a barrage at which the effect indicator in the UI is at full size

ValueDefinition.Name: CompanyLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: to reach a profile level up to SecondLevel, the global population count PopulationCountOffset + PopulationFactor * Level^Exponent is needed. Level 1 has a fixed amount of 0 population as requirement and all levels are rounded to a multiple of 10.

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: from this profile level on, the second values apply (offset for this level is still calculated by base values: PopulationCountOffset + PopulationFactor * Level^Exponent)

ValueDefinition.Name: BalanceCalculationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: The average balance gain is based on the buys/sells by passive trade of the last X minutes

ValueDefinition.Name: HistoryTrackTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long do we want to track trades? After which time we remove these trades from the history?

ValueDefinition.Name: PriceFactors
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration for price factors which are applied to the trade prices

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalProductSellPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of a PRODUCT which is SOLD by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalProductBuyPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of a PRODUCT which is BOUGHT by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalItemSellPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of an ITEM which is SOLD by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalItemBuyPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of an ITEM which is BOUGHT by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: Scope
ValueDefinition.Description: The counter will only be evaluated for these scopes

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: The counter will only be evaluated for these value types

ValueDefinition.Name: MinValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum value (including) that this counter may have. Is used for error checking.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum value (including) that this counter may have. Is used for error checking.

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextNeedsToBeZero
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the context for this counter should always be 0. Will be checked by the game during runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextNeedsToBeNonZero
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the context for this counter should never be 0. Will be checked by the game during runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that will be displayed for a fun fact of this category

ValueDefinition.Name: Scope
ValueDefinition.Description: The scope types that are allowed to use for this fun fact

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: The value types that are allowed to use for this fun fact

ValueDefinition.Name: PlayerCounter
ValueDefinition.Description: The player counter used for this fun fact category

ValueDefinition.Name: SumUpAllCounterContexts
ValueDefinition.Description: Sums up all counters ignoring counterContext, counterScope and counterValueType

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreContexts
ValueDefinition.Description: All contexts in here will be ignored when evaluating this fun fact

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreScopeContexts
ValueDefinition.Description: All scope contexts in here will be ignored when evaluating this fun fact

ValueDefinition.Name: Min
ValueDefinition.Description: minimum of ignored range, including min itself

ValueDefinition.Name: Max
ValueDefinition.Description: maximum of ignored range, including max itself

ValueDefinition.Name: ID
ValueDefinition.Description: The identifier by which the tracked counter can be identified in the platform service

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterType
ValueDefinition.Description: Type of player counter that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowAnyContext
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if all counters no matter the context should be summed up

ValueDefinition.Name: Context
ValueDefinition.Description: A context for the counter if needed, can also be a pool in which case all included guids will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: The counter value type

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScope
ValueDefinition.Description: The scope where this counter should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ScopeContext
ValueDefinition.Description: A scope context to define the exact scope where you want to check for a counter, e.g. a session GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: RestartRouteUpperThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum number of product amount a train may have loaded before he *has* to return to the train station.

ValueDefinition.Name: RestartRouteLowerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The missing supply a train will tolerate before he *has* to return to the trainstation to pick up more.

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchPopulation
ValueDefinition.Description: Population that has to be increased to raise the limit

ValueDefinition.Name: RecipeResearchCostBalancing
ValueDefinition.Description: ResearchPoint costs to research new item recipes

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSubCategoriesToSelect
ValueDefinition.Description: How many subcategories should be selected when researching new recipes. You can e.g. link5 subcategories but only select 3 subcategories randomly for the player to chose from

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverCommonRecipesAutomatically
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all common item recipes of all research fields will be researched at game start automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: CommonRecipesBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: A pool excludes items of the automatic discovery. Has only an effect when DiscoverCommonnRecipesAutomatically is true. Only items of rarity 'Common' make sense here

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemCraftingWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: Workforce that has an impact on the crafting time

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of workforce the user needs at least to start the crafting

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumWorkforceTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of crafting with the minimum amount of workforce

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of workforce the user can set at most for crafting

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumWorkforceTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of crafting with the maximum amount of workforce

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchCostConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration for research costs to craft a new item with this rarity

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxQueueEntries
ValueDefinition.Description: How many entries the Crafting Queue can have. 5 == 5 queued entries

ValueDefinition.Name: QueueBlockedInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Infolayer for the research center if the queue is blocked

ValueDefinition.Name: ChanceForGodlikePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Chance to drop a new godlike item while crafting an item in percentage. Enter 2,5 for a 2,5% chance to drop godlike

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchGain
ValueDefinition.Description: Researchpoints the user gains when donating an item with this rarity

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowResearchPointsInResourcebar
ValueDefinition.Description: Disable to remove the research button from the resource bar

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeLists
ValueDefinition.Description: Each entry represents on selection list the user can toggle through which contains more than one guid (especially needed if upgrades of a building should be part of the selection list)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Each building and all of it's upgrades in this group will be part of a common selection list. All upgrades will be added automatically to this list so please only add the base assets

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSmoothMoving
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, camera moves smoothly from one object to the other. If false, camera jumps instant between objects

ValueDefinition.Name: PirateAvoidanceRange
ValueDefinition.Description: On a session transfer, the pirate island is tried to avoid by this range when ships are spawning or leaving the session

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLeaveSessionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How far a ship should travel out of the playable area at most before starting the session transfer

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxReservationCost
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal money cost for reservation

ValueDefinition.Name: ReservationCostPerConstructionTile
ValueDefinition.Description: money cost per 1000 tiles for reservation

ValueDefinition.Name: GuidSkinToVariationSkinMapping
ValueDefinition.Description: Used to map the old guid skins to the new skins assets. Needed after the Skin Rework in Jan 2021

ValueDefinition.Name: OldSkinGuidAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the object which was used as skin (e.g. Battle Cruiser 2nd skin)

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseObject
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the base object. E.g. the Battle cruiser ship guid.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewSkinAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the new skin asset

ValueDefinition.Name: StartShipSkinConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration to select a skin for the start ship based on posession

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: guid of the start ship (e.g flagship)

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: guid of the skin asset which shall be selected (e.g. imperial flagship skin) !! The ship asset needs to have this skin asset configured !!

ValueDefinition.Name: PossesionCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: player possession has to be true for the skin to be set

ValueDefinition.Name: TrainSkins
ValueDefinition.Description: Train Guid to Skin mapping, Train guid is used for the feedback unit logic and its graphics. TrainSkinGuid is used for the icon, texts and locking of the skin

ValueDefinition.Name: TrainGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: Feedback unit asset of the train

ValueDefinition.Name: TrainSkinGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: Skin asset of the train, matching to the TrainGuid

ValueDefinition.Name: HappyDaySkins
ValueDefinition.Description: Configure skins to be used at special events (e.g. have a Xmas skin for marketplaces)

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: guid of the building which should change its skin on a special day (e.g. market place)

ValueDefinition.Name: HappyDay
ValueDefinition.Description: The happy day at which the skin should be replaced

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the skin asset !make sure that the ObjectGuid has this skin configured!

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderOverlay
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this layer should be rendered

ValueDefinition.Name: InsideRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g used for hacienda radius

ValueDefinition.Name: OutsideRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g used for hacienda radius

ValueDefinition.Name: SameNeighborColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Holding shift while selecting a residence highlights all residences with same GUID in current area

ValueDefinition.Name: CitySize
ValueDefinition.Description: global balancing for the city size thresholds (once reached, you cannot lose them per island

ValueDefinition.Name: CityStati
ValueDefinition.Description: Culturehappiness-Indicator changes if enough attractivity is available

ValueDefinition.Name: CityStatusFluff
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the attractiveness level

ValueDefinition.Name: OrnamentAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how much attractiveness an ornament generates. Depends on ornament units (normally 1 used tile = 1 unit) and amount of resident buildings.

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessMultiplicatorLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: attractiveness multiplicator is used in attractiveness calculation: limit / (-1 - steepness * ornment ratio) + limit

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessMultiplicatorSteepness
ValueDefinition.Description: attractiveness multiplicator is used in attractiveness calculation: limit / (-1 - steepness * ornment ratio) + limit

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessPerRuin
ValueDefinition.Description: each ruin building decreases the attractivity

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessNatureBaseMin
ValueDefinition.Description: base attractiveness of an islands (random between BaseMin and BaseMax)

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessNatureBaseMax
ValueDefinition.Description: base attractiveness of an islands (random between BaseMin and BaseMax)

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessNaturePerTile
ValueDefinition.Description: nature attractiveness per buildable tile

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessNatureMinPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Nature attracticity reaches zero if this many percent of tiles are blocked

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessWarThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: At which island war morale percent does the attractiveness start to decrease?

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessWarMin
ValueDefinition.Description: attractiveness of war when morale has reached the threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessWarMax
ValueDefinition.Description: if the island war morale percent reaches 0, what is the attractiveness of the war?

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorDecreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of visitors dissapearing per GameTick 100ms if Unloaded Visitors < Current Visitors

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: optimalVisitors = attractiveness * visitFactor

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorBalanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: the VisitorIncome per second is calculated as #AmountVisitors * VisitorBalanceFactor

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: The duration between ships coming to your visitor harbor updating your visitors

ValueDefinition.Name: MinUnloadingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Be careful, this value shouldn't be too small (at least ~2:00) as the feedback needs some time to reach the ship

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationTouristDeltaPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: the min delta in tourists required before a notification is send to PAMSI / Newspaper

ValueDefinition.Name: MinVisitorAmountForHighestVisitorIslandArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: The min amount of visitors an island needs to have to be taken into account for the article for the best visitor island

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialistSpawnProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability of the highest reached visitor amount is taken as probability for a specialist to spawn

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialistSideNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: When a specialist arrives, both a character and a side notification get send. The event filters make it so that only one of the two gets displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorHarborDestructionGracePeriod
ValueDefinition.Description: After the visitor harbor gets destroyed this grace period starts in which you will not loose current visitors.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxVisitorDeltaPerSecondFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: MaxVisitor may per second only increase / decrease by CurrentVisitors * thisFactor. E.g. 0,01 means 1% may leave per second.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxVisitorMinDeltaPerSecond
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimal allowed MaxVisitor delta per second (so delta = max(CurrentVisitors * factor, this))

ValueDefinition.Name: NegativeVisitorPlayerAction
ValueDefinition.Description: A Notification which is triggered when a player action reduces current and future amount of money gained by visitors

ValueDefinition.Name: NegativeVisitorPlayerActionDeltaPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Lost Visitor DeltaPercentage before NegativeVisitorPlayerAction is triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: PrognoseTimeBeforeIntervalEnd
ValueDefinition.Description: a certain time before the interval ends a prognose notification (will there be more or less visitors next interval) will be triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: TotalUnlockablePoolLikeliness
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how likely it is that you get a specialist from one of the unlockable specialist pools (0-100)

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialistPoolsThroughSets
ValueDefinition.Description: Sets might unlock additional specialist pools

ValueDefinition.Name: Pool
ValueDefinition.Description: Pool that gets unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockingSetBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: SetBuff that is used by the Set that unlocks the pool

ValueDefinition.Name: UseAbsoluteGoodTransportByDefault
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the system uses absolute values in the good transportation by default. If false it uses relative values (percentages)

ValueDefinition.Name: EnqueueDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: When distance between the ship and the target (loading pier) is undershot, the ship will reserve a slot

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckBestCoastDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If this distance is undershot, the ship will evaluate the best loading pier

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictedGood
ValueDefinition.Description: Only the goods configured here can be transported by this kind of route. If the list is empty, all goods can be transported (beside the excluded goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludingGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: Goods which are configured here can never ever be transported by this kind of route

ValueDefinition.Name: Unlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Link to an unlock asset to lock/unlock this type of a route. If this value is empty, the type is always available

ValueDefinition.Name: DumpEverythingAtStation
ValueDefinition.Description: this route type does not allow delivering to different islands

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliverGood
ValueDefinition.Description: is executed at every station of the route

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: is executed when the ship leaves a session

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteChange
ValueDefinition.Description: Is executed when ship leaves the traderoute or the current station is changed

ValueDefinition.Name: DowngradedGood
ValueDefinition.Description: Leave at 0 if loaded product should vanish

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreMinimumLoadingTimes
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true this type of trade route will ignore the min loading time from ship and pier for loading time calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingTimeGoodFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is multiplied with the amount of loaded / unloaded goods for loading time calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: HarborQueueDataPerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Array that defines the waiting queue settings per path planner layer

ValueDefinition.Name: QueueToConstructionAreaDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance between the end of the construction area and the beginn of the ellipsis on which ships are enqueued in harbours

ValueDefinition.Name: MinEllipsisWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: Harbor ellipsis width of a harbor with just a single pier

ValueDefinition.Name: EllipsisAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle of the harbor ellipsis on which ships will wait. E.g. 30 would mean that ships could wait between -30° & +30° relative to the kontor to sea direction

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceBetweenWaitingRows
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance between two rows of the waiting queue of an harbor

ValueDefinition.Name: LongWaitingTimeError
ValueDefinition.Description: How long a ship has to wait at least before we trigger a warning

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSecondThirdPartyQueueWaitingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should ships of second or third parties wait in a loading queue at most? When this time expires they will automatically skip the current station and go to the next station

ValueDefinition.Name: TravelTimeMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: When ship evaluates the best pier, all the travel times will be multiplied by this value to make moving more costly

ValueDefinition.Name: FolderDefaultName
ValueDefinition.Description: The default name for folders

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableFeatureTradeRoutes
ValueDefinition.Description: Also Disable Diplomacy and World Map to remove buttons under minimap.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBailoutsBeforeLost
ValueDefinition.Description: How many times the queen gives the player money until he has lost

ValueDefinition.Name: BailoutMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: How much money the user gets by a single bailout

ValueDefinition.Name: BankruptcyThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The game is lost if the player has less or equal the money configured here

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorAssetPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Pool with all buildings considered as an imperial kontor or a single kontor. The user has lost if one of them is destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandsToHold
ValueDefinition.Description: List of islands that leads to a defeat as soon as the player looses one of them. They don't have to be owned by the player at the beginning of the game

ValueDefinition.Name: LoseWhenEcoQualityFallsTo
ValueDefinition.Description: The eco quality at which the green game jam scenario is lost

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowReverseFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: If true half the ships will drive the other way around

ValueDefinition.Name: RoughFeedbackShipDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: This value will determine how many ships are spawned (by calculating a route distance approximation and dividing it by this value)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnloadTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time the ship will stay on the workforce transfer pier after arriving there

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteDurationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Total time a trade route with the world market can be active without continuation in some way.

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteExpirationWarningTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time left for the first warning about route expiration to appear.

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteExpirationOfferTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time left for the continuation offer to appear. Will stay visible until the route expires, or any interaction takes place.

ValueDefinition.Name: PriceChangeText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text to be added for each product price change that passes criteria

ValueDefinition.Name: PriceChangeEventText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text to be added for each product price change that passes criteria in case of active event for this product

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeInNextSeasonWhenTimeLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time before end of season at which the next season is already faded in visually

ValueDefinition.Name: UnknownNextSeasonNameText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that will be shown when we want to display the next season name but there is no next season

ValueDefinition.Name: UnknownNextSeasonTypeText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that will be shown when we want to display the next season type but there is no next season

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualEffectConfiguration
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the strength of the visual effects over the time in the season

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateVisualEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this visual effect is active for this season

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalEffectStrengths
ValueDefinition.Description: !Please Sort! Does not require entries for t=0 and t=1. Specify additional points in time in the season at which a certain effect strength is reached

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeInSeason
ValueDefinition.Description: A point in the season at which a certain effect strength should be reached. [0; 1] 0 = start of season, 1 = start fade to next season, some seconds before end of season

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: The effect strength to be reached at a given point in time in the season [0; 1]

ValueDefinition.Name: PercentageModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: how much does the trade price change, e.g. -10 subtracts 10% or 50 increase prices by 50%

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetAssetOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: target of the trade price change, can also be a pool with multiple GUIDs

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeEveryProduct
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to true, this effect will be used for every product (not filtered by TargetAssetOrPool)

ValueDefinition.Name: TimerProgressColor
ValueDefinition.Description: sets the colour for the progress bar in Season UI

ValueDefinition.Name: IsSpecialSeason
ValueDefinition.Description: This makes a color gradient (color for it is controlled by BackgroundColor), deco pattern and thicker frame visible

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundColor
ValueDefinition.Description: sets color for the gradient when it is a special season

ValueDefinition.Name: Campaign
ValueDefinition.Description: can this template be used as a campaign start map?

ValueDefinition.Name: AddDecorationIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: True = Small decoration islands will be added to the world in random spots

ValueDefinition.Name: EnlargeDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: Which DLC needs to be active to get the enlarged template

ValueDefinition.Name: EnlargedTemplateFilename
ValueDefinition.Description: this template is used instead if EnlargeDLC is active

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalDecoIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: this template requires more decoration islands than declared in MaxDecorationIslands of MapGenerator

ValueDefinition.Name: EnlargedAdditionalDecoIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: when enlarged template file is used, deco island amount is MaxDecorationIslands (from MapGenerator) + AdditionalDecoIslands + EnlargedAdditionalDecoIslands

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandBaseName
ValueDefinition.Description: To avoid using of too similar islands (e.g. with and without rivers)

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: Higher values have higher priority.

ValueDefinition.Name: HotelHappinessPrios
ValueDefinition.Description: Used to control the Context of a CLICK_OWN_HOTEL PaMSy considering the Happiness Categories with different prios.

ValueDefinition.Name: PositivePrio
ValueDefinition.Description: In case this Happiness Category is positive this is the prio for using the given PaMSy Context. Greater numbers are more priotized. In case you have even Prio Numbers one of the Context will be choosen randomly.

ValueDefinition.Name: PositivePaMSyContext
ValueDefinition.Description: Context for the PaMSy message

ValueDefinition.Name: NegativePrio
ValueDefinition.Description: In case this Happiness Category is negtaive this is the prio for using the given PaMSy Context. Greater numbers are more priotized. In case you have even Prio Numbers one of the Context will be choosen randomly.

ValueDefinition.Name: NegativePaMSyContext
ValueDefinition.Description: Context for the PaMSy message

ValueDefinition.Name: MinReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: minimal reputation value

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal reputation value

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionThreats
ValueDefinition.Description: which actions are threats

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableFeatureDiplomacy
ValueDefinition.Description: Also Disable Trade routes and World Map to remove buttons under minimap.

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomacyTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: Which state has to be reached to trigger this newspaper?

ValueDefinition.Name: Article
ValueDefinition.Description: This article is shown in the newspaper. Only the image, the headline and the body is used, everything else is like prio and effect is ingored

ValueDefinition.Name: TakeoverProbabilityForArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: If the chance for a hostile takeover is higher than this value the system will fire an article (chance 0-1)

ValueDefinition.Name: HighIncidentChanceArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article to trigger when the incident chance is above the HighIncidentChance

ValueDefinition.Name: MediumIncidentChanceArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article to trigger when the incident chance is between High and LowIncidentChance

ValueDefinition.Name: LowIncidentChanceArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article to trigger when the incident chance is below the LowIncidentChance

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyedBuildingsThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If equal or more buildings than this have been destroyed/abandoned during the incident, trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long the balance has to be hold in total to trigger an article

ValueDefinition.Name: DurationPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: If set this will override the duration by the percentage amount of the newspaper interval

ValueDefinition.Name: IncomeBalanceLowMaximumAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: maximum income balance at newspaper release to trigger negative article about income balance

ValueDefinition.Name: IncomeBalanceHighMinimumAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum income balance at newspaper release to trigger positive article about income balance

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleLostThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: How many morale points we have to loose before we trigger this article

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleDestroyedThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: How many morale points of other islands the newspaper participant has to destroy to trigger the MoraleDestroyedArticle

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWinResult
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum result to considers the battle as won (0-100)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLoseResult
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum result to considers the battle as lost (0-100)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDestroyedShipsToTriggerWinLose
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum number of destroyed ships in total (of all participants) before we consider a battle as lost or won (see MinWinResult, MaxLoseResult)

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: The GUID of the monument event

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentEventActiveArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when the monument event is active

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentEventEndedArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when the monument event ended

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentNews
ValueDefinition.Description: News per monument

ValueDefinition.Name: Monument
ValueDefinition.Description: Add the monument this news are related to. Please always use the very first phase of the monument

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionStartedArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: When the monument construction started (placing the foundation)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionFinishedArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: When the monument finished being build

ValueDefinition.Name: NewConstructionPhaseArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: When a bew construction phase started (clicking button next phase)

ValueDefinition.Name: FinishedConstructionPhaseArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: When a construction phase finished

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionStopped
ValueDefinition.Description: If construction is stopped, by workforce or not enough materials, at newspaper release

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionStoppedPast
ValueDefinition.Description: If construction WAS stopped but now its working again

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionSlowedByWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: If the progress is slowed by not sufficient workforce at newspaper release

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionSlowedByWorkforcePast
ValueDefinition.Description: If the construction WAS slowed down but now it's back not normal state

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionNormal
ValueDefinition.Description: When the construction is at full speed at newspaper release

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxProductivitySlowedPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Above this percentage the workforce counts as full for the newspaperSlowedByWorkforce

ValueDefinition.Name: MinProductivityAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: If the productivity was high during the newspaper period the productivity must be higher than this at release to trigger the ConstructionNormal article

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long has the productivity to be below the MaxProductivity value

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackingPastDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long a status has to be hold to trigger the past modification (e.g. monument was stopped for X seconds, now its running again)

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long the satisfaction of a good has to be hold in total to trigger an article

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackingDurationPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: If set this will override the duration by the percentage amount of the newspaper interval

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumNeedSatisfactionAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: the need satisfaction value needs to be higher than this value at newspaper release to trigger the SatisfactionLowArticle

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumNeedSatisfactionAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: the need satisfaction value needs to be smaller than this value at newspaper release to trigger the SatisfactionHighArticle

ValueDefinition.Name: SatisfactionArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article that gets triggert if the condition is met

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: The duration the average satisfaction has to be between averageSatisfaction low and high to trigger the article

ValueDefinition.Name: DurationPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: If set this will override the duration by the percentage amount of the newspaper interval

ValueDefinition.Name: AverageSatisfactionLow
ValueDefinition.Description: If the average satisfaction is between AverageSatisfaction High and Low for duration the article gets triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: AverageSatisfactionHigh
ValueDefinition.Description: If the average satisfaction is for duration below this value a news gets triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSatisfactionLowAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: When average satisfaction is below this value at newspaper release the article doesnt get triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSatisfactionHighAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: when average satisfaction is above this value at newspaper release the article doesnt get triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinResidencesCount
ValueDefinition.Description: To trigger the article this many residences are needed (buildings, not people)

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: The duration the average happiness has to be between averageHappiness low and high to trigger the article

ValueDefinition.Name: DurationPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: If set this will override the duration by the percentage amount of the newspaper interval

ValueDefinition.Name: AverageHappinessLow
ValueDefinition.Description: If the average happiness above this value for the given duration a news gets triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: AverageHappinessHigh
ValueDefinition.Description: If the average happiness below this value for the given duration a news gets triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHappinessLowAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: when average happiness is below this value at newspaper release the article doesnt get triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHappinessHighAtRelease
ValueDefinition.Description: when average happiness is above this value at newspaper release the article doesnt get triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinResidencesCount
ValueDefinition.Description: To trigger the article this many residences are needed (buildings, not people)

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationChangeAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the population needs to change before we trigger PopulationIncrease/Decrease Article

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessChangeAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the happiness needs to change before we trigger HappinessIncrease/Decrease Article

ValueDefinition.Name: SeveralShipsThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When equal or more ships than this have been built trigger the several ships built article

ValueDefinition.Name: SeveralShipsBuiltArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when equal or more ships than the severalShipsBuiltThreshold have been built

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeShipBuiltArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when a trade ship was built

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryShipBuiltArticle
ValueDefinition.Description: Articler when a military ship was built

ValueDefinition.Name: Context
ValueDefinition.Category: This can be a single factory or a workforce (in this case the average over all factories that uses this workforce is taken)

ValueDefinition.Name: SaveForNextNewspaper
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this article has the chance to appear in the next newspaper without be triggered again

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority this article starts with. Is ignored for any filler articles

ValueDefinition.Name: LossOnPublish
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority this article looses when choosen for newspaper

ValueDefinition.Name: RecoveryByInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority this article recovers if priority is smaller than startValue

ValueDefinition.Name: GainByNotPublished
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority this article gains if article was triggered but not choosen for newspaper and priority is bigger or equal to the startValue

ValueDefinition.Name: ResetPriorityOnNotTriggered
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the priority of this article will be resetted if the article was not triggered for a whole interval

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextGuids
ValueDefinition.Description: List of guids this effect has an effect on. Can be workforceGUIDs, production buildings or other things. Interpretation of these values depends on the implementation of the effect.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperIntervalPrioThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the threshold the summed prio of all events has to reach to create a new newspaper. If this threshold is reached before MinNewspaperInterval is reached, we wait until this interval is reached. If the threshold is not reached before MaxNewspaperInterval is reached we create a newspaper anyway

ValueDefinition.Name: MinNewspaperInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum amount of time we wait for events before we create a newspaper

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxNewspaperInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum amount of time we wait for events before we create a newspaper

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPrioForIntervalCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: All articles with a lower prio than this value will not be considered in the calculation for a time interval

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: A newspaper can only exclude other news of the same group if the priority is smaller or equal than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryDebuffs
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of priority that is subtracted (temporary) from each article when another article of the same category is choosen

ValueDefinition.Name: PropagandaEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration for side effects of a continious article replacement (propaganda)

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: Population level this effect affects

ValueDefinition.Name: PropandaSteps
ValueDefinition.Description: List of effects. Only one effect per populationLevel will be activated for each player at the same time

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPropagandaScore
ValueDefinition.Description: Whats the minimum propaganda score in the last X newspapers to activate this effect? X is defined by the newspaperRange

ValueDefinition.Name: SatisfactionDecreasePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Decrease of the satisfaction in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: RiotChanceIncreasePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Increase of the riot chance in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many newspaper will be searched for propaganda articles

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionTimeToConstructionTimeMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the conversion from production time to construction time. E.g. a buff that gives the player a production boost of 50% * a productionTimeToConstructionTimeMultiplier of 0.2 = a construction time boost of 10% for ships

ValueDefinition.Name: ArticleUnlockedNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is fired everytime a new newspaper article gets unlocked. Let field blank to deactivate article notifications

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Pool of items that are used to generate random offers to fill up trade list

ValueDefinition.Name: OfferSlotCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: Money costs for a new slot

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableScenario
ValueDefinition.Description: True indicates that this game setup refers to a scenario

ValueDefinition.Name: CreativeMode
ValueDefinition.Description: disable build cost, maintenance, resident needs, newspaper, influence

ValueDefinition.Name: SavegameFolder
ValueDefinition.Description: Deprecated but required for backwards compatibility

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveDLCs
ValueDefinition.Description: The DLCs which are active in this game

ValueDefinition.Name: InternalLoadAsScenarioSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Internal Value! When set, removes some features not needed when loading the world map only to use it as a scenario selection

ValueDefinition.Name: LockedAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of assets that should be locked when the campaign starts

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockedAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of assets that should be unlocked when the campaign starts

ValueDefinition.Name: ConnectionTimeOut
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum time allowed between finding a quickmatch, and starting it

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of workforce the user needs at least to start the crafting

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumWorkforceTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of crafting with the minimum amount of workforce

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of workforce the user can set at most for crafting

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumWorkforceTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of crafting with the maximum amount of workforce

ValueDefinition.Name: CraftingAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many godlikes the user receives by crafting this? This directly influences e.g. the amount of buildpermits or the number of clay pit move actions

ValueDefinition.Name: RecipePool
ValueDefinition.Description: List of RecipePools. Every pool will create one itemrecipe when researched

ValueDefinition.Name: HarbourFeedbackHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The height used for feedback units which are on the Quay

ValueDefinition.Name: HarbourConstructionAreaRadiusCreativeMode
ValueDefinition.Description: in creative mode, a bigger harbor area is possible because of missing military

ValueDefinition.Name: HarbourBlockerPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: define how many of the harbour poles are displayed, e.g. 75 makes 75% visible and 25% hidden

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumBeachHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Beach ornaments can be built between MinBeachHeight and MaxBeachHeight

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumBeachHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Beach ornaments can be built between MinBeachHeight and MaxBeachHeight

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibleWithoutPermits
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this building is also visible (e.g. in the construction menu)even if the user has no build permits

ValueDefinition.Name: PermitSource
ValueDefinition.Description: used in infotip to explain where player can receive this permit from

ValueDefinition.Name: TextColors
ValueDefinition.Description: Colors used in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: Color
ValueDefinition.Description: A specific UI color

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotGhostColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Ghosts of Slot buildings per Region

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestOutlineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Quest objects can have special outlines

ValueDefinition.Name: GridExtensionLinesColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Grid extension lines

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingRadiusSizeModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: Most radii are context dependent (e.g. radius of module owner), but some can be modified (this value sometimes is an offset, sometimes the exact radius value)

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintColorPerRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the color shade for blueprint per region

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The blueprint color shade that is applied to the half transparent blueprint buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: UnderwaterOutlineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: the outline color for underwater objects that should have a default outline (e.g. sea mines)

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterConnectionHint
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of Connectionhint when in BuildMode IrrigationPipeline

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterConnectionHintBlocked
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of ConnectionHint when blocked

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionCircleColors
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the colors for the selection circle for different active build tools.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemsPerCost
ValueDefinition.Description: How many assets can I pay with one cost

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceCostType
ValueDefinition.Description: Influence costs are balanced in InfluenceFeature

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceCostPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: how many usages of influence are needed

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealChanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The building self heal chance is multiplied by this value to calculate the actual chance

ValueDefinition.Name: IntensityIncreaseChanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The building increase chance is multiplied by this value to calculate the actual chance

ValueDefinition.Name: Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether incidents area enabled at all, If false no incident will ever happen.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceForInvestors
ValueDefinition.Description: Non-Skyscrapers with activated DifficultySource add this amount (normal Investor residences)

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceForInvestorSkyscraper
ValueDefinition.Description: Skyscraper with type Investor and activated DifficultySource chose this amount by their FloorLevels

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceForEngineerSkyscraper
ValueDefinition.Description: Skyscraper with type Engineer and activated DifficultySource chose this amount by their FloorLevels

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableSecondParties
ValueDefinition.Description: These Second Parties can be chosen in Advanced Difficulty Settings

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableThirdParties
ValueDefinition.Description: These Third Parties can be chosen in Advanced Difficulty Settings

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignAutoParticipants
ValueDefinition.Description: These Profiles cannot be deactivated for campaign

ValueDefinition.Name: NormalAutoParticipants
ValueDefinition.Description: These Profiles cannot be deactivated for normal random game

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimalFrights
ValueDefinition.Description: Which cfgs to spawn on easter-egg-explosion-at-mouse-cursor

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceMetaInfos
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes relations between sequences

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredPreSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. layDown02 has layDown01 as preSequence, which means whenever I want to start layDown02 the sequence layDown01 is started first and layDown02 is started after the duration of the preSequence.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredPostSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. layDown02 has layDown03 as postSequence. So Whenever I want to end layDown02, the postSequence layDown03 is queued before starting the new sequence.

ValueDefinition.Name: CompatibleRunSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: Sequence that this sequence (interpreted as a walk sequence) can be blended into (interpreted as run sequence). We can only blend sequences that have the same amount of steps in it and where steps have the same phase (e.g. start with right foot)

ValueDefinition.Name: CompatibleIdleSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: Sequence that this sequence (interpreted as a walk sequence) can be blended into (interpreted as idle sequence). We can only blend sequences where carried objects are considered

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowRandomizeStartOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Some Sequences are required to always start at t=0

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackSequenceIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: Ids of FeedbackEditor Sequences

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderConditionIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: RenderCondition IDs to communicate with renderEngine when modifying CFG states

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotGhostsFadingSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: alpha change per Tick (10 ticks per second, alpha[0..255]) -> speed 3 = 8.5 seconds, speed 6 = 4.25 seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveModeDragThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When dragging at least x pixels in Move mode, the drag is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalVideoDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If videos should stop after the last audio Message, this delay is added before the video is actually stopped

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantMessageCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: Needed by ToolOne GUI to display message view

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipItemDropCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Flotsam is generated for cargo of destroyed ship, content is reduced

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: SequenceDataset to RenderEngine sequence ID

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnAreaConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in AnnoEditor to visualize different Spawn Areas

ValueDefinition.Name: GuidPools
ValueDefinition.Description: Every list represents one pool of guids that will be handled as the same guid internally. Can be used to e.g. handle a ship skin as the same object as the original object

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockAssetsOnAccountLoaded
ValueDefinition.Description: [AP-9493] GUIDs that have to be be unlocked on account level before entering a game. Fixes GUIDs that were locked before and can't be unlocked via ConditionTriggers (e.g. used in main menu).

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockAssetsOnAccountLoadedConsole
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as above but only for console version

ValueDefinition.Name: AirshipAttackIndicatorOnGround
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the airship attack indicator will be rendered on the ground, otherwise at the airship

Property.Name: GoodValueBalancing
Property.Description: The GoodValue gets calculated for every good and is based on multiple factors like workforce costs, factory sizes etc. Here are balancing values for the GoodValue

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: Default Modifier for all Products which don't get produced in any Factory. The Good Value for those goods is BasePrice * DefaultModifier

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetMaxRoadTurnPoint
ValueDefinition.Description: how far the streetbuilding automatically rotates

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowMultipleShortcuts
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this shortcut will not change if another binding has the same shortcut

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableOnPlatforms
ValueDefinition.Description: This shortcut is only available on the given platforms.

ValueDefinition.Name: InvalidOnPlatforms
ValueDefinition.Description: This key binding will only be invalid for the given platforms

ValueDefinition.Name: SubtitleAdditionalDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Messages with subtitles will be displayed for as long as the audio lasts plus this time

ValueDefinition.Name: SubtitleVisible
ValueDefinition.Description: If TRUE the subtitle menu at the bottom will be showing subtitles for any audio triggered through this menu

ValueDefinition.Name: QuesttrackerNotificationFlowTimeDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: The time it takes the quest to show in/be removed from the Questtracker after the Start/Success Notification is shown. Format: hh:mm:ss.ms

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumNewTiles
ValueDefinition.Description: if the system generates a new street which has less than this number of tiles, it might consider a longer street than necessary

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumStreetTileSaved
ValueDefinition.Description: if the system generates a street saves to many tiles, it might consider a longer street than necessary

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDistToKeepCursor
ValueDefinition.Description: if cursor is moves fast enough, the system will clear the old street cursor and not keep it

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialAutoCompleteDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes until an autocomplete tutorial as fulfilled

ValueDefinition.Name: KeyAssetNames
ValueDefinition.Description: List of all keys that are using a special (non default) widget to display this key in a shortcut

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetGroupName
ValueDefinition.Description: The Tag of the associated widget in the asset group

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultKeyAssetName
ValueDefinition.Description: The Tag of the default widget in the asset group

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionConfirmPopupTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Seconds the Confirm Popup is open

ValueDefinition.Name: DragStartToleranceDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the distance the user has to move the mouse to start a drag after he pressed the left mouse button

ValueDefinition.Name: DragStartToleranceTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time the user has to hold the left mouse button before a drag starts. Value in milliseconds

ValueDefinition.Name: HintMarkerPadding
ValueDefinition.Description: How much padding to the object out of screen hint markers use [In px]?

ValueDefinition.Name: FallbackSubtitleDisplayTimePerChar
ValueDefinition.Description: Fallback Display Time calculated as sum of ms for each char.

ValueDefinition.Name: GamepadModeOverrides
ValueDefinition.Description: List of text overrides that occur when the gamepad mode gets active

ValueDefinition.Name: Original
ValueDefinition.Description: The text asset that should be overridden

ValueDefinition.Name: Override
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that overrides the original in case the gamepad mode is active

ValueDefinition.Name: PlatformOverrides
ValueDefinition.Description: List of text overrides depending on the platform

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowSceneDelayMS
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration in MS in which scenes are rendered off the screen to preload images

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentResolverUnitTextMapping
ValueDefinition.Description: Maps multiple resolver units to a single resolver unit. This is done to prevent double entries for, for example, doctors in the infotip if the item affects hospitals in europe and africa (who have different resolver units)

ValueDefinition.Name: Unpackable
ValueDefinition.Description: Is the asset unpackable for the player and will need additional interaction

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCDependency
ValueDefinition.Description: Enter the DLC asset here, if this asset is only available with a DLC

ValueDefinition.Name: Region
ValueDefinition.Description: for which Regions is GUID valid

ValueDefinition.Name: Progress
ValueDefinition.Description: Progress that configures how values are growing in defined steps

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Threshold that has to be exceeded to get this value

ValueDefinition.Name: Value
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute value. Is not added to the previous value

ValueDefinition.Name: PostProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: This configuration is used AFTER all steps in the Progress exceeded the Thresold. The ValueIncrease is added to the Value of the last Value entry of the progress

ValueDefinition.Name: AbsoluteLimit
