ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the absolute limit of the Value that can't be exceeded in any way. If 0, this will be ignored

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionContext
ValueDefinition.Description: If the session context is set, this progress will override the global progress for a specific session. If not set the progress will be set as global progress

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestDeclinedReputationText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that is used for the reputation log history when the player gained reputation as a result of a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestFailedReputationText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that is used for the reputation log history when the player lost reputation as a result of a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestSuccessReputationText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that is used for the reputation log history when the player gained reputation as a result of a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: InvitationCancelPopupConfirmation
ValueDefinition.Description: For cancel an invitation you need also to confirm a popup

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBonusPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal positive deviation of BaseAmount

ValueDefinition.Name: CreativeModeCraftingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The time it takes to craft something in creative mode. Will not consider the crafting times in property craftable anymore.

ValueDefinition.Name: CreativeModeResearchTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The time it takes to research an item in creative mode. Will no longer be based on item rarity.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text / text pool that will be displayed with the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationTextGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: The text group where the text is taken from. Any setting in NotificationText overwrites this one

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationBlockingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The time interval how often this notification is allowed to occur

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationAudioAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: A sound that is played when the notification is triffereg (e.g. "Pling")

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: The priority for the notification queue. A higher value means higher priority to be displayed. A value of -1 means it will never be blocked

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationMinDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum duration the notification will be actively displayed until it is discarded

ValueDefinition.Name: DisplayTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of time the notification is queued without showing before it is deleted (or archived)

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this notfication will not be queued, when a copy is already running or enqueued

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictToSessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true if you want this notification only to be shown in a specific session or region. If the player is in a different session/region the notification will be postponed until the player enters the correct one. If you set this value then <DisplayTimeout> will be ignored. Handle with care!

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: The session or region where this notification may only be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowDuringCameraSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if this notification is visible during a camera Sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: ThirdpartyNotificationButtons
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional: Configure buttons which are shown on the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: PreventAutoClose
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the notification will not be closed when this button is clicked

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveCallback
ValueDefinition.Description: A Textsource statement with a bool return type. If this returns true the button is active. Otherwise the button is greyed out.

ValueDefinition.Name: ThirdpartyDefaultCommand
ValueDefinition.Description: The default command that is executed when there was no decision by the user and the notification times out

ValueDefinition.Name: FilteredByEventSetting
ValueDefinition.Description: If IsFilteredByEventSetting is set, the filter setting applying to this notification

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationMainCallbackType
ValueDefinition.Description: The callback that will be triggered when this notification is clicked

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationMainDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional description line for the title text

ValueDefinition.Name: Subtitle
ValueDefinition.Description: An optional subtitle with audio for the notification.

ValueDefinition.Name: SubtitleGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: The subtitle text group where the subtitle is taken from. Any setting in Subtitle overwrites this one

ValueDefinition.Name: IconAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon that will be displayed with this message. Leave this empty if no icon should be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationSideTitle
ValueDefinition.Description: A title for the Notification

ValueDefinition.Name: IsArchived
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this side notification is deleted after playback or stored in the notification archive

ValueDefinition.Name: IsWarning
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this notification will be shown in the warnings tab in the notification archive. Can not be active at the same time as "IsEvent".

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceOpenArchive
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this notification will force the archive to show after the notification is played

ValueDefinition.Name: HasJumpLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to false the side notification doesn't give the possibility to jump somewhere

ValueDefinition.Name: IsEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this notification will be shown in the events tab in the notification archive. Can not be active at the same time as "IsWarning".

ValueDefinition.Name: EventNotificationSetting
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant when IsEvent is set to true. Then determines which setting can filter out this notification.

ValueDefinition.Name: PostAudioTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional display time after the movie/audio has finished

ValueDefinition.Name: PostAudioTimeLong
ValueDefinition.Description: This time is used instead of the normal PostAudioTime if in gamepad mode

ValueDefinition.Name: PauseActive
ValueDefinition.Description: will this type be active in pause

ValueDefinition.Name: Delay
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the delay between every message of the same type that will be shown to avoid multiple notifications at once (In ms)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum time this notification will be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalInteractionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time that is added when an interaction of the player is prompted

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: This time gets added to the display time of the current notification, after it gets focused by the player (gamepadmode only)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxEntries
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum number of notification entries of this category

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationUnreadThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum time that a notification needs to be displayed to the user until it is marked as read

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon displayed next to the text inside the filter menu for this filter type

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the filter

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: The category this should be added to

ValueDefinition.Name: GameSessionStartupIgnoreNotificationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If a time is entered, all notifications during that time will be skipped

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultFlyoutHeightOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the default flyout starting height

ValueDefinition.Name: AudioNotificationYPos
ValueDefinition.Description: YPosition used to show AudioNotifications

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateWorkforceInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: infotip in residence object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: Buffgroup
ValueDefinition.Description: The buff/group will be shown if at least one textsource is valid and the result in the given borders

ValueDefinition.Name: MinThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimal valid value.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum valid value.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfiniteFarmFieldText
ValueDefinition.Description: refinery can build unlimited amount of farmfields

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstBonusNeedTutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID which will be assigned to the very first bonus need entry

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstDelightBonusNeedTutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID that will be assigned to the very first delight bonus need

ValueDefinition.Name: DelightCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: BonusNeedDelightCategory

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstFoodBonusNeedTutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID that will be assigned to the very first food bonus need

ValueDefinition.Name: UseAssetSpecificMonumentFluffOverDescriptionText
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is used the asset specific monument fluff text will be used over the description text.

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialFirstDropGoodID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID for first drop good in drop good selection

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialFirstBarrageID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID for first barrage entry when dropping goods

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstBuildOptionTutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID which will be assigned to the very first construction entry

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: used for portrait

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildingsPerPage
ValueDefinition.Description: How many buildings/chains we show in one page at max?

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStampsPerPage
ValueDefinition.Description: How many stamp entries do we want to show per page?

ValueDefinition.Name: DeleteStampPopupBuildingThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: How many buildings does a stamp need to contain before deleting it requires a confirmation popup

ValueDefinition.Name: PredefinedStampIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: Icons that will be shown in the stmap icon selection no matter the stamp content. UI can only fit up to 32 elements in total. So don't overdo it here, otherwise the dynamic icons will be cut.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: items need to have this category. you can filter by ItemType, by ItemCategory or both

ValueDefinition.Name: MenuVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines in which menus this category is visible. Warehouse also implies kontors

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemFilterCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: CategoryAsset of the ItemFilter that is activated if a keyword of this category is chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Text which is shown for this category in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: SubCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: All Subcategories. Subcategories won't be shown if it's only 1 entry

ValueDefinition.Name: SubCategoryType
ValueDefinition.Description: Type that is used to identify subcategories in the code to add generated keywords

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown in the UI for this subcategory

ValueDefinition.Name: Keywords
ValueDefinition.Description: All keywords that are shown within this subcategory

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: All keywords are first sorted on their priority and within a priority alphabetically. Keywords generated by code always have prio 0. Priority can also be negative. Higher priorities are shown at first

ValueDefinition.Name: MinBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Keep a minimum distance from screen border, so that popup cannot get unaccessible

ValueDefinition.Name: DisplayedAttractivenessTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: The entries here determine which Attractiveness Types are displayed in which order.

ValueDefinition.Name: AlwaysShowDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the description is not hidden when the detail breakdown is displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: ChatLineTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes until notification will be hidden

ValueDefinition.Name: ChatLineFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes for notification to fade out (in seconds)

ValueDefinition.Name: ChatLinesMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum of chat line notifications visible at once

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSlotsPerRadial
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many slots should show a radial at least. If there are less buildings than slots, the non used slots will be displayed as empty slots

ValueDefinition.Name: AlternativePortraitList
ValueDefinition.Description: Portrait List for the console version

ValueDefinition.Name: AlternativeLogoList
ValueDefinition.Description: Logo list for the console version

ValueDefinition.Name: InUseInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip shown on color and logo entries if they are in use

ValueDefinition.Name: CreditVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: For each language, a different video can be used. If the user has choosen a language with no configured videopath the DefaultCreditVideoPath is used

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultCreditVideoPath
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the video that is used if the user has choosen a language we have no video for

ValueDefinition.Name: AmmunitionFeedbackOffsetX
ValueDefinition.Description: X Offset that is added to the ammunition text and icon

ValueDefinition.Name: AdvancedSettingsGridCellSizeY
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the height of each cell in the grid of the advanced settings scene

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: icon of the button

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomacyAction
ValueDefinition.Description: action the button activates

ValueDefinition.Name: Tooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip of this button

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionType
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 - action (left side); 1 - treaty (right side)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomacyMessageTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: configures all triggers for Participant Message created by the diplomacy actions

ValueDefinition.Name: Message
ValueDefinition.Description: the message which gets triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: Initiator
ValueDefinition.Description: which actor initiated this message

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggeredInCompound
ValueDefinition.Description: also triggered if part of compound offer

ValueDefinition.Name: CompoundPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: priority if different actions in compound offer

ValueDefinition.Name: PeaceState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button when peace

ValueDefinition.Name: PeaceTooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip when in peace

ValueDefinition.Name: WarState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button when war

ValueDefinition.Name: WarTootlip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip when in war

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button for Queen

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenTooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip for queen button

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenKnighthoodState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button for Queen in knighthood

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenKnighthoodTooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip for queen button in knighthood

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenIndependenceState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button for Queen in independence

ValueDefinition.Name: QueenIndependenceTooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip for queen button in independence

ValueDefinition.Name: PeaceState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button when peace

ValueDefinition.Name: PeaceTooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip when in peace

ValueDefinition.Name: WarState
ValueDefinition.Description: state of button when war

ValueDefinition.Name: WarTooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: tooltip when in war

Property.Name: IslandBarPollutionScene
Property.Description: Extention of the island bar scene for the green game jam

ValueDefinition.Name: PerQualityConfiguration
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon to be displayed for each of the qualities in the pollution scene

ValueDefinition.Name: StableWhenLessThan
ValueDefinition.Description: When |ecoDelta| is smaller than this, the tendency is considered stable

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowlyChangingWhenLessThen
ValueDefinition.Description: When |ecoDelta| is smaller than this, the tendency is considered slowly changing, else fast changing

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: These workforces will not be shown in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: This vector describes the order in which the workforces are shown in the islandbar

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowPublicService
ValueDefinition.Description: Show public service products like faith?

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockRequirement
ValueDefinition.Description: Texts will only be shown if this asset is not set or unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundImageFolderMain
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the folder that contains all the mood images for the base game that are used as background images in the loading screen

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundImageFolderDLCs
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the folder that contains all the mood images for the DLCs that are used additionally as background images in the loading screen

ValueDefinition.Name: FrustrumMinFarplaneDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: This is used to determine the size of the camera frustrum

ValueDefinition.Name: FrustrumMaxFarplaneDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: This is used to determine the size of the camera frustrum

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimapDotSortOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the Z-Sorting of Minimap Dots.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: the fertility is only shown, if this DLC is active

ValueDefinition.Name: StrategicMapFogOfWar
ValueDefinition.Description: Texture which is used on the strategic map

ValueDefinition.Name: MinViewFrustrumSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to clamp the size of the frustrum so it stays visible when zooming in. The value determines the minimum length of each line of the frustrum

ValueDefinition.Name: NumOfStaticButtonSlots
ValueDefinition.Description: How many button slots we should create. If this is set to e.g. 12 the buttonindex 0-11 can be set to tools, BuildingOptions and ContextualCommands. In this case a button with index 0 will appear on the very top, 6 on the very bottom

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectCategoryName
ValueDefinition.Description: Is shown on the small red banner in the UI.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartDistancePC
ValueDefinition.Description: Alpha is lerped between start and end distance. Alpha is 1 if distance is < that startdistance

ValueDefinition.Name: EndDistancePC
ValueDefinition.Description: Alpha is lerped between start and end distance. Alpha is 0 if distance is > that enddistance

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryHeadline
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the quest category

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxItemsToDonate
ValueDefinition.Description: How many DIFFERENT items the user can donate at most at one time (max size of donation box)

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceSliderSteps
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the steps in which the workforce slider assigns the workforce e.g. 50 means the user can only assign a multiple of 50 workforce for the crafting process

ValueDefinition.Name: GodlikeRewardInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for godlikes in the reward section of the research UI

ValueDefinition.Name: ProfileButtonEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes if the Profile button should be enabled. If enabled clicking it will lead to Achievements / Highscore and also Profile Customization

ValueDefinition.Name: GameSpeedBarHighlightDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delays the highlight of the game speed bar in milliseconds

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableNegativeBalanceDisplay
ValueDefinition.Description: do not show the highlight for negative balance in the UI (useful for specific scenarios)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxGoodsPreview
ValueDefinition.Description: How many goods should be displayed per route?

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon used while in mouse&keyboard mode

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsoleIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon used while in gamepadmode

ValueDefinition.Name: FocusStrategicMapText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text for the gamepadaction to focus the strategic map

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveOrCreateGroupText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text used for the context menu of a route to open the move or create new group pop up

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandBorderSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Images will be exported by the editor with a full transparent border around the island. This border has a fixed size to ensure the outline fits inside of the image

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipGroupDefaultTextGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: GUID of the infotip, that should be displayed, when no ship group is focused

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoCloseOnSingleSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the ship menu will close when a single ship is selected via A button

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoJumpToOnSingleSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the camera will jump to the selection when a single ship is selected via A button

ValueDefinition.Name: Session
ValueDefinition.Description: The session where the coop peer is currently playing

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon that should be shown for that session

ValueDefinition.Name: HideEventTracker
ValueDefinition.Description: For scenarios: When enabled, hides the event tracker button. Warning: Hiding the event tracker also hides all event notfications

ValueDefinition.Name: DeleteNotificationAction
ValueDefinition.Description: The gamepadaction used to delete notifications

ValueDefinition.Name: JumpToAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Gamepad action to jump to the notification target

ValueDefinition.Name: SeeExpeditionText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text for the expedition action

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessIconAngry
ValueDefinition.Description: Angry looking happiness icon goes here, the red one

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the category

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandSelectionGlobal
ValueDefinition.Description: The name for the global tab inside the statistic menu

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandSelectionMulti
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown if the user selects multiple islands

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetIgnoreList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of assets that should be ignored in the listing of items

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that shoud be ignored in the listing of item sources

ValueDefinition.Name: OldNateItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in research wrapper, indicates that the selected item is only available at Old Nate

ValueDefinition.Name: NoRecipeAvailable
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in research wrapper, indicates that there is no recipe for the the selected item available

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: Scale of the map when the user zoomed out at max. Also used as default value

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: Scale of the map when the user zoomed in at most

ValueDefinition.Name: MapZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast is zooming? 1 means we add 1 to scale per second

ValueDefinition.Name: MinZoomMoveSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How many pixels we move per second with max input when zoomed out completely

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxZoomMoveSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How many pixels we move per second with max input when zoomed in completely

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalSliderSteps
ValueDefinition.Description: How many steps the global slider should have? 0 means a stepless, fluid control

ValueDefinition.Name: FactorySliderSteps
ValueDefinition.Description: How many steps each factory slider should have? 0 means a stepless, fluid control

ValueDefinition.Name: BoostableFactories
ValueDefinition.Description: List here all factories that can be boosted by the workforce menu. The order of the buildings will be preserved

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialConstructionHighlights
ValueDefinition.Description: some production chains are interrupted by trade routes

ValueDefinition.Name: WarningIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: The warning icon that will be shown on items and UI if an item is inside a locked slot

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstAreaItemTutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID that will be set to identify the first item in the area items

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstSharedEmptySlotID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID that will be set to identify the first empty not locked shared item slot

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstSharedItemSlotID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID that will be set to identify the first non empty not locked shared item slot

ValueDefinition.Name: FirstSharedLockedSlotID
ValueDefinition.Description: Tutorial ID that will be set to identify the first empty locked shared item slot

ValueDefinition.Name: ShareInfoHeadline
ValueDefinition.Description: Text will be displayed instead of the island name if no island is focused in the hostile takeover screen.

ValueDefinition.Name: CloseOnSelectionChange
ValueDefinition.Description: if selection changes or a new popup is opened, all popups with CloseOnSelectionChange are closed without action

ValueDefinition.Name: PauseGame
ValueDefinition.Description: Pauses the game when the popup is opened

ValueDefinition.Name: HideDuringPause
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this popup will be hidden when pause is activated

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, only one popup of this type can be active in the stack

ValueDefinition.Name: ButtonLists
ValueDefinition.Description: button lists, 2 lists for negotation, next 2 for threat

ValueDefinition.Name: Action
ValueDefinition.Category: action this button adds to the negotiation

ValueDefinition.Name: ButtonStatePeace
ValueDefinition.Description: buttonstate if in peace

ValueDefinition.Name: ButtonStateWar
ValueDefinition.Description: buttonstate if in war

ValueDefinition.Name: ButtonStateKnighthood
ValueDefinition.Description: buttonstate if in knighthood

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatesAccept
ValueDefinition.Description: this option can activate the accept button

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCsRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: If ANY of the DLCs in the list is active this category will be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenariosRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: If ANY of the Scenarios in the list is active this category will be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableForMouseAndKeyboard
ValueDefinition.Description: Main topic availabiliy

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableForController
ValueDefinition.Description: Main topic availabiliy

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalSubTopicDLCRequirements
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional DLC Filter for Sub Topics. Still have to fulfill the Topic DLCs as well.

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableForMouseAndKeyboard
ValueDefinition.Description: Sub topic availabiliy

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableForController
ValueDefinition.Description: Sub topic availabiliy

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreUnlockStateForCategoryVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: when set to true, the unlock of this building is not enough to show the category

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoLayerPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: Used if 2 or more Info-Layer Icons would be shown. Entries at the start of the List have priority over Entries below them. Icons that are not in the List are not being displayed in Game.

ValueDefinition.Name: MarketplaceEfficiencyWarning
ValueDefinition.Description: Shows a warning on residences if the MarketplaceEfficiency is below this threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: MissingAreaThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: show missing area infolayer if free area factor of woodcutter is less

ValueDefinition.Name: MissingFarmfieldThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: warning is shown if available farmfields provide less productivity than this factor

ValueDefinition.Name: PopupDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: if not 0, the icon does not appear instantly but only if the triggering condition is still active after this time

ValueDefinition.Name: IsQuestInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes if this infolayer is quest related or not. If it is quest related it will not be hidden if the HideInfolayer option is on

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowInCreativeMode
ValueDefinition.Description: Only special infolayer are shown in creative mode

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: If there is no offset defined in phoenix, this is the default offset that will be used. If the infotip direction is bottom right, the infotip will be displayed with an offset of X pixels to the bottom right corner of the regarding UI element

ValueDefinition.Name: GroupVisibilityDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: If the 'ShowDelayed' configuration for a group is enabled, the group will be shown after X seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionCursor
ValueDefinition.Description: Which mousecursor is shown if interaction is possible?

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Which effect is shown on the command ship as interaction feedback?

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long is the command ship blocked for interaction feedback?

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: infolayer shown on actor while interaction is running

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionTargetInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: infolayer shown on target while interaction is running

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionOnScreenText
ValueDefinition.Description: Which OnScreenText is shown at the end of the interaction?

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace shown icon (for plus goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace shown icon (for plus goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace shown icon (for plus goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinEpilepsyWarningTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should be the epilepsy time visible at least? If UI needs longer to load, epilepsy warning might be shown longer than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroVideos
ValueDefinition.Description: List of videos that are shown as intro sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipScaleFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Scaling of the ships and fleets

ValueDefinition.Name: AirShipScaleFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Scaling Factor specifically for airships

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipFleetDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Max distance between two ships on the worldmap to get merged into one fleet

ValueDefinition.Name: Camera
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration for the camera of the worldmap. All changes will be reloaded at runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle of the camera. 0 means camera lies on ground/water, 90 means top down perspective

ValueDefinition.Name: MinZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance from camera to map when max zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance from camera to map when max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: StartZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: How much is the camera zoomed in when starting the game (0-1). 0 means max zoomed in, 1 means max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomStep
ValueDefinition.Description: How much will be zoomed in when rotating the mouse wheel by one step. Value between 0 and 1. One means the camera gets fully zoomed in out with one step

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the camera zooms in/out in progress per second. 1 means the whole distance from min to max in one second. Bigger numbers means faster zooming

ValueDefinition.Name: CloseMaxPanDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How much we can pan around when max zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: FarMaxPanDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How much we can pan around when max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: CenterX
ValueDefinition.Description: The X center of the world. Panning will be around this center.

ValueDefinition.Name: CenterY
ValueDefinition.Description: The Y center of the world. Panning will be around this center.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartX
ValueDefinition.Description: On this point the camera will be located when entering the world map the first time

ValueDefinition.Name: StartY
ValueDefinition.Description: On this point the camera will be located when entering the world map the first time

ValueDefinition.Name: DragSpeedFar
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the camera should be moved when panning around. This value is used when camera is max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: DragSpeedNear
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the camera should be moved when panning around. This value is used when camera is max zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: FOV
ValueDefinition.Description: Field of view. Bigger value means we see more of the world

ValueDefinition.Name: ScrollSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for edge scrolling and arrow keys

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipHeightOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Position of the ships

ValueDefinition.Name: AirshipHeightOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Position of the airships

ValueDefinition.Name: WindDirection
ValueDefinition.Description: Value in degrees

ValueDefinition.Name: PromotedScenario
ValueDefinition.Description: The scenario that is promoted on the world map right when the patch goes live

ValueDefinition.Name: GlacierMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: Replaces the default murmur if placed on a glacier island in the arctic

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivityDependentMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: The Murmur with the highest reached Attractivity is added. (the attractiveness information is taken from this building directly, so e.g. for a zoo, museum or monument this makes sense)

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityDependentMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: The Murmur with the highest reached Productivity is added.

ValueDefinition.Name: ApplyMurmurAndMoodToModules
ValueDefinition.Description: if true the murmur for this building will also be applied to all it's Modules

ValueDefinition.Name: DynamicEnvironmentType
ValueDefinition.Description: When this building is placed it replaces the environment sound with this environment.

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandAttractivityDependentMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: The Murmur with the highest reached Attractivity is added. (the attractiveness information is taken from the whole island)

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentNoEventMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: Murmur that is used when this is a monument and has no event running

ValueDefinition.Name: ClusterRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The range in which similar events are clustered

ValueDefinition.Name: ClusterCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of similar events which start to form a cluster.

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivationRangeOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: The Activation Range is calculated via MaxAttenuation + Offset. If an event is triggered outside of it's activation range it is not send to the soundengine to reduce calls to Wwise.

ValueDefinition.Name: StopEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: if defined this event is used instead of forcing the SoundEngine to stop the sound.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotCluster
ValueDefinition.Description: Please note that clustering of oneshots is actually just a supression of new oneshots! Because we can't predict which oneshots will be spawned in the future and we can't just restart the oneshots when a new one occures. The SoundEventType is still taken into account (so oneshots very close to the listener are never suppressed)

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotClusterRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The range in which other oneshots are supressed

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotClusterAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of other oneshots which can be suppressed by this one. So if a 5 is configured the suppression is removed after 5 other oneshots were supressed - so the sixth oneshot is triggered again. If -1 is configured there is no limit to the amount of suppressed sounds.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotClusterSuppressLength
ValueDefinition.Description: how long should the suppression be active? If this is 0 the duration of the oneshot is taken instead.

Property.Name: AudioLink
Property.Description: Used for Clustering AutoCreateAsset to link a single event to the cluster

ValueDefinition.Name: AudioAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: link to the sound asset that will be played alongside with this subtitle

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeechAudioType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of the speech audio. This type defines the order of speech audios playing.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeechAudioPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: The priority of the speech audio. This defines the order of speech audios playing in some cases. Higher value means higher priority

ValueDefinition.Name: ClusteringDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The min distance between emitter and listener at which clusters may be created. If the distance falls below the threshold the cluster is disabled.

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalAudioTimerRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: An RTPC which is regulary set to values between [0,0 .. 23,99] representing a time.

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalAudioTimerDayCycleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The (real) time for the global audio timer to go from 0 - 24

ValueDefinition.Name: CommandQueueSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Currently set to 2MB

ValueDefinition.Name: MonitorQueueSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Currently set to 64KB

ValueDefinition.Name: VoiceChatVolumeRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: This rtpc is used to modify the volume of the voice chat emitters

ValueDefinition.Name: SeasonGameModeState
ValueDefinition.Description: GameModeState that will be set based on season type that is active

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicStage1_StateChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: used for unescalated incidents / small fights

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicStage2_StateChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: used for escalated incidents / big battles

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWinProbabilityForLoose
ValueDefinition.Description: If the win probability after a fight is below this threshold the loose ending is played

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWinProbabilityForWin
ValueDefinition.Description: If the win probability after a fight is above this threshold the victory ending is played

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeoutAfterThirdPartyMusicPlay
ValueDefinition.Description: After a third party music starts to play the next can only start after this timeout.

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionTickFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor which is multiplied with the amount of ticks the player had a 3rd party object selected before adding it to the total score.

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaTickFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor which is multiplied with the amount of ticks the player looked at a 3rd party island before adding it to the total score.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The 3rd party needs to have reached this threshold before it's considered to be played. Note that looking 1 second at a 3rd party island results in the areaTickAmount to increase by 10 (so a factor of 10 is more or less equal to 1 second interaction)

ValueDefinition.Name: CurrentAreaFactorBonus
ValueDefinition.Description: the area the player is currently looking at gets a bonus on the factor to have it playing with a higher probability. if this is balanced to be >= MinFactor it's more or less sure that this song starts.

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockOtherFirstEncountersDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: After a first encounter is started other first encounters are blocked for the specified amount of time.

ValueDefinition.Name: StateBlockingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: This determines the time the 3rd party states are set and block any other changes from the music system. This should be as short as possible but as long as required to make sure the standard music properly switches to the 3rd party music.

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicPlaying_StateGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to either true or false depending if the music is currently playing.

Property.Name: RequiredSoundBanks
Property.Description: Vector of all Soundbanks which are required by the corresponding Asset. These Soundbanks will then get loaded.

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundBanks
ValueDefinition.Description: This Sounbanks will always be loaded

ValueDefinition.Name: RFXRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The area in which the emitter will be randomly placed. May further be constraint by AreaConstraints.

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When randomly position the emitter it's not allowed to be inside the inner circle.

ValueDefinition.Name: AngleMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The 0° angle is always in the "forward" direction of the building. Use AngleMin and AngleMax to reduce the circle to a piece of cake. If angleMin and angleMax are equal a random angle in the range [0..370°] is choosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampToTerrain
ValueDefinition.Description: If the emitter is below the earth surface it's height is set to the surface height.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampToWater
ValueDefinition.Description: If the emitter is below the water it's height is set to water level. May only be used when ClampToTerrain is also true.

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerRateMin
ValueDefinition.Description: The event is triggered with a random offset between the triggerRateMin and triggerRateMax

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerRateMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The event is triggered with a random offset between the triggerRateMin and triggerRateMax

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: The event which is periodically repositioned and triggered.

Property.Name: RFXList
Property.Description: Used for clustering AutoCreateAsset to link potentially multiple RFX to a cluster

ValueDefinition.Name: EnvironmentTypePriorities
ValueDefinition.Description: This array defines the priority of the environment type therefore if you build a residence and a factory building on the same grid cell this priority determines which environment type will be applied

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: When a murmur is choosen only murmur with the highest priority is considered as option. higher = better

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerPositionInterpolationValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for the interpolation between lookAt and CameraPos for the Listener Position. 0 = Listener at CameraLookAt; 1.0 = Listener at CameraPosition

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerPositionInterpolationValue_WorldMap
ValueDefinition.Description: InterpolationValue for the WorldMap. Note that this will not be changed depending on the camera angle as the camera can not be tilted. Further description see ListenerPositionInterpolationValue

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerPositionExponent
ValueDefinition.Description: The exponent describing the curve the listener follows when lowering the camera angle

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerMaxHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The emitter will be clamped to this height (over terrain) whenever it's above

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundEmitterPositionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Emitters are moved down by this amount - needed for Cone Attenuation

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipCommandConfirmationVoiceDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay for Ship command confirmations (e.g. movement, attack commands)

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionAudioFeedbackDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: When an object is selected sometimes audio Feedback is triggered. To prevent spam this delay is used to only trigger one feedback once every x seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: MurmurCellRange
ValueDefinition.Description: When a murmur is started in a certain cell this radius will be used to collect all cells within range to calculate the count and to ignore them for the next calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: MoodSectorSizeToFrustumRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: percentage concerning what is visible within frustum e.g. 1.2 means grid reads out 20% more than the frustum is showing the player on visual side

ValueDefinition.Name: EnvironmentIrrigationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: the factor of an environment cell which needs to be irrigated in order for the whole cell to be treated as irrigated

ValueDefinition.Name: EnvironmentForestTreeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If in a environment cell (of type meadow) at least the given portion of fields is occupied by trees it's converted to a forest cell. As soon as this proportion is no longer met the cell is also demoted.

ValueDefinition.Name: MoodFilter
ValueDefinition.Description: whenever a mood which is flagged as "overridesFiltered" occures in a cell all moods which have the flag "doFilter" set are removed temporary from this cell when transmitting the data to Wwise.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProjectileHitMaterialSwitchGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Switch set for projectiles depending on the material of the impact location.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructRectFallback
ValueDefinition.Description: This sound will be triggered as UI sound when the player draws a destruction rect without selecting a building or street first. Therefore the rect is either empty or contains vegetation.

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSearchDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance to the listener in which potential rivers are taken into account

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSegmentDiscardThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: PERFORMANCE: For river segments which are smaller than this value only the end points are taken into consideration when finding a spot on the river

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverTestPositionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: the offset for the testpositions around the listener which search for the closest river.

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverEmitterDiscardThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Emitter which would be closer together than this distance will be discarded,

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintSwitchGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: this switch and switch choice will be set for blueprint buildings for their emitter, non blueprint buildings will never set or change this state.

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintSwitchChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: this switch and switch choice will be set for blueprint buildings for their emitter, non blueprint buildings will never set or change this state.

ValueDefinition.Name: SurrenderChanceForLikelyMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: At which surrender percentage should the surrender likely be played

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintMixedSwitchChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used when placing multiple buildings at once (with some blueprints and some real buildings)

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintOffSwitchChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: Only ever used for the multi emitter for normal buildings this switch will never be set (and should be the default choice !)

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiActionBuildingCountRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for multi actions (such as upgrade, delete, build) and represents the count of affected buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiActionBlueprintCountRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used for the construction action represents the counts of the blueprints

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensityThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of units in the FeedbackGrid needs to exceed this count in order for an emitter to get created

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensityDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance around the listener in which emitter for the feedback grid are created

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensitySoundEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: The sound event which is triggered in the feedback grid

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensityCountRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: The rtpc which is set to the feedback count within the cell

ValueDefinition.Name: DaytimeProgressRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: The rtpc will go from [0 .. 1] and reset to 0 whenever the daytime period changes.

ValueDefinition.Name: DaylightPercentageRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 during day, 0 during night, linear increasing / decreasing during sunrise / sunset

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentNoEventTypeSwitchChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: The monument event type switch group (used by monuments to set the switch depending on the running event)

ValueDefinition.Name: DelayBetweenMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: After a murmur finished playing this is the time which is waited before the next murmur is triggered. If this time is negative the murmurs will overlapse

ValueDefinition.Name: RainRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: This rtpc will be set according to the rain intensity [0..1] where 0 means that there is no rain at all. NOTE: we also have a weather were it's snowing and raining simultaniously so both rtpcs can be set at the same time.

ValueDefinition.Name: SnowRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: This rtpc will be set according to the snow intensity [0..1] where 0 means that there is no snow at all. NOTE: we also have a weather were it's snowing and raining simultaniously so both rtpcs can be set at the same time.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorArrivalSwitchGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Switch group for arriving visitors at pier.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorArrivalSwitchOn
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Switch for visitors at pier. If a certain threshold of visitors is reached this will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorArrivalSwitchOff
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Switch for visitors at pier. If there are less then a certain threshold of visitors on the pier this will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundBankLocalized
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this Soundbank is a localized Soundbanks (and therefore contains localized sounds)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildSuccessfulUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be triggered at the same time as the BuildSuccessful sound but only once per Savegame (so e.g. if defined for a fisherhut this will only be played at the first ever build fisherhut)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildAddWaypoint
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered whenever a waypoint is added. This happens once in the very beginning and then whenever the player adds a waypoint by pressing SHIFT + LMB

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildCancelWaypoint
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered when a waypoint is removed by the player (clicking RMB). If it was the last waypoint the current street build try is canceled.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProjectileVolley
ValueDefinition.Description: Volley Sound is triggered once when a ship shoots a volley of projectiles. So it's not triggered for each projectile but only once. NOTE: this sound will actually not be triggered at the projectile but on the shooting object instead

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionOneShots
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: in contrast to the other incidentSounds the explosion sounds whould be oneshots!

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiplayerBuildingSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in Multiplayer if the Action was triggered by another player. If nothing is defined we fallback to the "default" sounds.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaterialType
ValueDefinition.Description: Inserted in the MaterialGrid and sent to the sound engine when a sequence sound is played at this position

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionOptionSoundEventFallback
ValueDefinition.Description: The fallback expedition option sound which should be triggered when an option without overwritten sound event is clicked.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionMusicStateChoiceDefault
ValueDefinition.Description: StateGroup will always be reset to this StateChoice when an associated UI is opened.

Property.Name: WorldMapDynamicSoundEmitter
Property.Description: The sound which should be played by this emitter needs to be set dynamically in code. This property was created in order to deal with the DynamicVariation property...

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveAudioEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: a loop playing persistently

ValueDefinition.Name: UIClickEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when the matching worldmap object is clicked (as 2D sound for the UI emitter)

ValueDefinition.Name: HasCustomName
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this expedition uses a custom name. If not the default category name configured in the global expedition balancing asset will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: UseCustomIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this expedition uses a custom icon (the asset icon). If not the default category icon configured in the global expedition balancing asset will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: HasCustomDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this expedition uses a custom description. If not the default category description configured in the global expedition balancing asset will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Fluff text describing the expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: IsMandatory
ValueDefinition.Description: If mandatory, the expedtion cannot be discarded

ValueDefinition.Name: MandatoryFailExpedition
ValueDefinition.Description: when a mandatory expedition fails, a new one is automatically available (normally the same expedition again). If multiple NewExpeditions are configured, the entry is used that corresponds to the event of the failed expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: EventList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of predefined Events

ValueDefinition.Name: FillEventPool
ValueDefinition.Description: multiple events from this pool are added at the front of EventList, to reach the amount defined by ExpeditionDifficulty

ValueDefinition.Name: Threats
ValueDefinition.Description: List of predefined threats

ValueDefinition.Name: FillThreats
ValueDefinition.Description: Fill this expedition with threats to reach the amount defined by ExpeditionDifficulty

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionTargetSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Unlocks the defined session. At the end of the expedition, the ship does not return to the start session, it transits to this session when the player enters it

ValueDefinition.Name: Reward
ValueDefinition.Description: Reward for finishing an expedition successfully. Use ExpeditionTargetSession for discovering sessions.

ValueDefinition.Name: LastEventNeedsContinue
ValueDefinition.Description: normal expeditions end after a continue. But some handcrafted expeditions end with a success event where a continue question would be wrong

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Background video is used if event has no special video (e.g. region based events possible in multiple regions)

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the BackgroundVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: ContinueVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Background video used on contiue screen

ValueDefinition.Name: ContinueVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the ContinueVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: Captain
ValueDefinition.Description: which profile is used for charater notifications and in expedition UI

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipPerks
ValueDefinition.Description: Only ships with one of the perks are allowed on this expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: StartMorale of an expedition is BaseMorale + AttributeAmount per Item/Goods on expedition ship, only enter a value if there is no ExpeditionAttribute.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: Expedition rewards are only given out, if the expedition was in one of the regions. Leave empty if all regions are allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemDifficulties
ValueDefinition.Description: Expedition rewards are only given out, if the expedition has one of these difficulties. Leave empty if all difficulties are allowed. Only works if item is in a reward pool, not considered if item is directly linked.

ValueDefinition.Name: FluffText
ValueDefinition.Description: Fluff text that only appears in expedition and expedition preparation. Leave empty if the item has no ExpeditionAttributes,

ValueDefinition.Name: EndExpedition
ValueDefinition.Description: the expedition ends if this option is chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: choosing this decision changes the morale (can result in end of expedition)

ValueDefinition.Name: CurrentEventToAdd
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to add previously skipped event to list

ValueDefinition.Name: InsertEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: After this event, a new event is inserted

ValueDefinition.Name: Conclusion
ValueDefinition.Description: If the expedition failes because of the morale loss, this conclusion text explains why the expedition has failed. This is only needed if this decision has options and has a potentially morale loss. Text 3175 is always appended. (you can assign the decision GUID itself if the text is usable as conclusion). If a reward is handed out and there are options, this conclusion is shown when presenting the rewards.

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the DecisionVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: if set, the event shows this video as background from this decison on (until changed again by another decision)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowMap
ValueDefinition.Description: Shows the expedition map if this is the current decision. if there are no options, the continue button is used to accept the decision.

ValueDefinition.Name: PathSegment
ValueDefinition.Description: optional new path element for the expedition map

ValueDefinition.Name: MapLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: optional label for the expedition map

ValueDefinition.Name: ProgressReview
ValueDefinition.Description: when reviewing the expedition progress, this text fragment is added to the summary

ValueDefinition.Name: Sketch
ValueDefinition.Description: optional sketch added to the expedition map

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipSketch
ValueDefinition.Description: optional ship sketch that will be shown for the current ship position

ValueDefinition.Name: EventRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: This event is allowed for expeditions in these Regions. Leave empty if all are allowed.

ValueDefinition.Name: EventRarity
ValueDefinition.Description: relative weight for randomly choosing this event on an expedition (low values are rare events)

ValueDefinition.Name: EventThreat
ValueDefinition.Description: does this event belong to a threat? then its weight is adjusted depending on the threats that are active on an expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: EventOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: if there are events filled from FillEventPool at expedition start, they are ordered by this order (low events first) 0 = keep this event at its random position

ValueDefinition.Name: EventVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Background video shown for the complete event. Keep empty if region video defined in the expedition should be shown. Can be overwritten by a DecisionVideo.

ValueDefinition.Name: EventVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the EventVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: EventPool
ValueDefinition.Description: One of the expeditions is chosen randonly regarding the EventRarity

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: An Expedition with FillEventPool will have at least this amount of events

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: An Expedition with FillEventPool will have at most this amount of events

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAverageMoraleLoss
ValueDefinition.Description: Events are added to the expedition until at least this morale loss is expected and the event amount is between min and max

ValueDefinition.Name: MinThreats
ValueDefinition.Description: An Expedition with FillThreats will have at least this amount of threats

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxThreats
ValueDefinition.Description: An Expedition with FillThreats will have at most this amount of threats

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: Equipment morale needed to start the expedition with 100% morale

ValueDefinition.Name: AttributeImpactOnStartMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: global factor on all primary and secondary base morale of expedition equipment

ValueDefinition.Name: ThreatImpactOnEventRarity
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for rarity of events with a threat that is active on the expedtion. It is used as weight when choosing events randomly. Only the first occurance of a threat has this increased weight. The weight factors decrease for the second and third threat of an expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: WeightFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Only the first occurance of a threat has this increased weight. The weight factors decrease for the second and third threat of an expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedOption
ValueDefinition.Description: When continuing an expedition, the morale costs can be reduced if the crew is fed

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedOptions
ValueDefinition.Description: Which goods can be used to lower the morale costs of continuing an expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When a goods is used for the first time, the morale costs are reduced by this factor

ValueDefinition.Name: FactorOnUse
ValueDefinition.Description: diminishing factor by which the morale factor is reduced if same goods are used consecutively (0 = good is not usable in next event, 1 = no diminishing effect)

ValueDefinition.Name: RegainIfNotUsed
ValueDefinition.Description: if a good is not used, the efficiency for next event is raised (0 = no regain, 1 = fully efficient after one event pause)

ValueDefinition.Name: Traits
ValueDefinition.Description: Is this attribute a specialist trait?

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalMin
ValueDefinition.Description: defines the minimum interval between two expedition distributions

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalMax
ValueDefinition.Description: defines the maximum interval between two expedition distributions (if a free slot is available)

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many expeditions are visible at maximum

ValueDefinition.Name: Expedition
ValueDefinition.Description: This expedition may be distributed

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: All expeditions in this folder may be distributed

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Video shown at end screen of expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the SuccessVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: FailVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Video shown at end screen of expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: FailVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the FailVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: EarlyReturnVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Video shown at end screen of expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: EarlyReturnVideoSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: These events will be started when the EarlyReturnVideo is triggered and stopped when another video is started or the screen is closed.

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableFeatureExpedition
ValueDefinition.Description: When disabling, expeditions will not be created, expedition tracker will stay hidden. No new sessions can be discovered by expedition.

ValueDefinition.Name: PathSegment
ValueDefinition.Description: Graphic of the path to this option

ValueDefinition.Name: PathAlpha
ValueDefinition.Description: Alpha Mask to animate the path

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionAttribute
ValueDefinition.Description: amount of available attribute on expedition ship is used to change the outcome of this option (Thresholds of FollowupAttributeDecisions are changed)

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: decision is used if dice result [0..100] + attribute is at least this high (there has to be an entry with threshold 0, define highest threshold first) The thresholds are balanced in template Expedition

ValueDefinition.Name: ThresholdValue
ValueDefinition.Description: if threshold is set to UseValue, this threshold is used

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if an item/product is available on the expedition ship, the weight of this followupDecision is changed (only the first available option is used)

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemOrProduct
ValueDefinition.Description: if the item/product is available on the expedition ship, the threshold of this followupDecision is changed

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: this folder is only used, if ItemOrProduct is empty. Each Item in the folder is valid to trigger the NewThreshold

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAttribute
ValueDefinition.Description: If ItemOrProduct and ItemGroup is empty, the current expedition Ship counts its attribute sum

ValueDefinition.Name: MinNeededAttribute
ValueDefinition.Description: if ships attribute sum is at least this high, the NewThreshold is used

ValueDefinition.Name: NewThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: replacement threshold if item is available on expedition (set to UseValue if you want to use NewThresholdValue)

ValueDefinition.Name: NewThresholdValue
ValueDefinition.Description: replacement threshold if item is available on expedition (-1 for deactivate outcome)

ValueDefinition.Name: Requirements
ValueDefinition.Description: Only one of the stated requirements are needed to unlock the decision

ValueDefinition.Name: MinItemRarity
ValueDefinition.Description: Items with Rarity lower than this do not fulfil the requirement

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: this folder is only used, if ItemOrProduct is empty. Each Item in the folder is valid as requirement

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: needed item/goods amount of ItemOrProduct/Item from ItemGroup to fulfil the requirement

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAttribute
ValueDefinition.Description: which attribute is checked in MinAttribute?

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAttribute
ValueDefinition.Description: This attribute amount is checked additionally to ItemOrProduct/ItemGroup if NeededAttribute != None

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumeRequirement
ValueDefinition.Description: The first matching requirement is consumed when this decision is chosen?

ValueDefinition.Name: IsFavorableOption
ValueDefinition.Description: This option is highlighted to the player because it has only positive outcomes and has a special requirement

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUnFavorableOption
ValueDefinition.Description: This option is highlighted to the player because it has only negative outcomes

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: If the GUID is Invalid a fallback relative to the OptionAttribute is chosen. The fallback can be configured in the UISoundConfig

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Continue buttons show description of option on mouseover

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: defines which expeditions fit into this slot

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialExpeditionsSlot
ValueDefinition.Description: This is a special slot for a session unlock expedition, only the listed expeditions are allowed for this slot and these expeditions are only allowed in this slot

ValueDefinition.Name: Attributes
ValueDefinition.Description: Which items increase the expedition morale

ValueDefinition.Name: Hint
ValueDefinition.Description: if expedition ship has no skill, explain how to get the correct skill

ValueDefinition.Name: FollowupSuccessOption
ValueDefinition.Description: accept trade to choose this option

ValueDefinition.Name: FollowupFailOrCancelOption
ValueDefinition.Description: cancel the trade or do not offer enough to choose this option

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessConclusion
ValueDefinition.Description: The Description of the next Decision starts with this text if the trade was successful

ValueDefinition.Name: FailOrCancelConclusion
ValueDefinition.Description: The Description of the next Decision starts with this text if the trade was cancelled or failed

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip on the option that leads to this trade

ValueDefinition.Name: AcceptOption
ValueDefinition.Description: Button Text on ConfirmButton

ValueDefinition.Name: CancelOption
ValueDefinition.Description: ButtonText on CancelButton

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeType
ValueDefinition.Description: BribeUI shows a text between ship inventory and offered items

ValueDefinition.Name: TendencyFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: leave empty to show no feedback (e.g. if the trader is not a person)

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessChance
ValueDefinition.Description: All Balancing to calculate the success chance. This only depends on the trade prices.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeValues
ValueDefinition.Description: if item is not listed, normal baseprice is used

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreNormalTradeValues
ValueDefinition.Description: ignore trade values of all other items/products, each element not mentioned in TradeValues counts as 0 (does not chance the success chance)

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreAllTradeValues
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Count Items/Goods, all count 1 to the balance

ValueDefinition.Name: StartTradeBalance
ValueDefinition.Description: An empty trade has this trade balance (0 stands for an equal trade, negative numbers is a debt that needs to be paid before the success chance rises)

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessTradeValue
ValueDefinition.Description: which trade value is needed to reach certain trade success chance (if this is 0, the trade success is certain if the trade balance is >= 0)

ValueDefinition.Name: Discount
ValueDefinition.Description: When buying goods/items, their value is changed by this factor

ValueDefinition.Name: Skonto
ValueDefinition.Description: When selling goods/items, their value is changed by this factor

ValueDefinition.Name: WinConditions
ValueDefinition.Description: The conditions that need to be fulfilled to successfully end this quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreSerializedPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Attention! Currently only for ConditionPlayerCounter considered!

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not play any notification and do not fall back to PamSy configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestStart
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest starts.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestDeclined
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest declined. This will be executed before OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestActive
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest becomes active. This is when the user actually started the quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestAborted
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest is active and aborted by the player. This will be executed before OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestTimedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when the pre activation timer of this quest ran out. This will be executed before OnQuestDiscarded and OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnActiveQuestTimedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when the active quest timer ran out. This will be executed before OnQuestFailed and OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestFailed
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest fails. This will be executed before OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestDiscarded
ValueDefinition.Description: Callback when the quest has been automatically aborted by the system. Gets called before OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestSucceeded
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest succeeds. This will be executed before OnQuestEnd.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestEnd
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when this quest ends - independent from the success of the quest. This will be executed at last.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnPhotographySuccessNewspaperAction
ValueDefinition.Description: This action will be triggered to show the newspaper for a photography quest. It has no effect if no photography objective is present or if all photography objectives set the flag to not show a newspaper on success.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestGiver
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the guys picture will be shown in the quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: StoryText
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the fluff text of a quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: DescriptionText
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the description of a quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: Only enabled quests will be used by the game

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCallOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number that this quest can be triggered. < 0 means infinite calls are possible

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSolveCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number that this quest can be solved. <= 0 means infinite calls are possible

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAbortCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number that this quest can be aborted. <= 0 means infinite calls are possible

ValueDefinition.Name: CountForQuestLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: True if this quest counts for the global and the pool quest limits.

ValueDefinition.Name: PreActivationTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: This timer cancelles a quest if the quest has not become active until the timer runs out.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestTimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: If a time limit is set, the quest will fail if it is not completed within this time

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: The category of the quest defines the internal behaviour of the quest. See DDD for details.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines at which point this quest changes its status to "Activated". Only activated quests are visible in the Quest Tracker.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsAbortable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this quest can be aborted in the assignment center or the quest tracker

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededProgressLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: This quest can only be triggered if the player progress level matches these checked levels.

ValueDefinition.Name: LatencyTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: Latency before a quest can start after all other preconditions are fulfilled. The latency starts again if a single precondition check fails during the countdown. This needs to be checked over the whole duration and is EXPENSIVE for game performance

ValueDefinition.Name: DelayTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay the quest after the preconditions were fulfilled once. The preconditions will be checked once again after the delay finished. This is a CHEAPER alternative to the latency timer in terms of performance

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestTrackerVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines when this quest will be visible in the quest tracker.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestBookVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines when this quest will be visible in the quest book.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConfirmOnReached
ValueDefinition.Description: After solving the quest stays in quest tracker and needs to be confirmed by player

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomizeConfirmOnReachedCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, a custom confirmOnReached condition can be configured for this quest specifically

ValueDefinition.Name: ConfirmOnReachedCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Use this to provide a custom configuration for the resolve confirmation for this quest

ValueDefinition.Name: HasExclusiveQuestGiver
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional quests are only started if no other exclusive quest is already running with the same quest giver
