ValueDefinition.Name: QuestSessionDependencies
ValueDefinition.Description: If not empty, the quest can only be triggered if one of the specified sessions is loaded

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Session or region(= list of sessions) allowed here

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestBlockedSessions
ValueDefinition.Description: If not empty, the quest can not be triggered in one of the specified sessions

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Session or region(= list of sessions) allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: AlternativeRewardTitle
ValueDefinition.Description: An alternative headline for the rewards

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestDifficulty
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the balanced difficulty of this quest

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepCheckingPreconditionsWhenRunning
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the quest keeps checking the preconditions and will abort automatically if they are not met any longer

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignChapter
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines to which chapter of the campaign this quest belongs. This is only useful when the questCategory is set to main quest and will be ignored otherwise

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that rewards reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of reputation that is rewarded. This number can be negative to create a reputation loss

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that rewards reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of reputation that is rewarded. This number can be negative to create a reputation loss

ValueDefinition.Name: ResetPreconditionsAfterQuestWasTriggered
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the interal state of all preconditions will be reset. This is especially important for ConditionEvent which otherwise endlessly remembers any received event

ValueDefinition.Name: RespectRelatedQuestSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this quest tries to spawn in the same session as another quest that is configured in the preconditions. We try to determine the correct quest out of all conditions given. An assert will be thrown if we don't manage to find a quest but this flag is set

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBeActiveForMultipleParticipants
ValueDefinition.Description: Only takes effect in quest pools. Checking this will stop preventing the quest from being called from the pool, while another player has this quest running

ValueDefinition.Name: HasReminderMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if this quest should trigger a reminder message when the starter object or another specified object was selected

ValueDefinition.Name: BasePriority
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the base priority the quest has at the beginning. The base priority cannot be exceeded.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the minimum priority the quest can have.

ValueDefinition.Name: RefreshPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: This value is added to the current priority each time another quest of the pool gets chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: PriorityOnSolved
ValueDefinition.Description: When this quest is solved, the priority will be set to this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: PriorityOnAborted
ValueDefinition.Description: When this quest is aborted, the priority will be set to this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates the progress the player makes in the campaign by fulfilling this quest

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjectCompletionOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the completion order between the starter object condition and the win conditions

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUniqueQuest
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used for ToolOne filter possibility

ValueDefinition.Name: Quest
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of quests that this pool can call

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this quest will be chosen among all quests with the same prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of quest groups that this pool can call

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that one of these quests will be chosen among all quests with the same prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: Lower numbers come first! Defines a priority in the list of sub pools. Equal priorities will be selected randomly.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this pool will be chosen among all pools with the same prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsTopLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this pool will be used directly to select quests and does not depent on a parent pool to be chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: The max number of quests that this pool can call simultaneously

ValueDefinition.Name: PoolCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time the pool is blocked after calling a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownOnQuestStart
ValueDefinition.Description: Starts the pool cooldown if no pool cooldown is running and a quest started

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownOnQuestEnd
ValueDefinition.Description: Starts the pool cooldown if no pool cooldown is running and a quest ended

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: A quest of this pool is blocked for this time when it was resolved.

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedByCooldownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: When true, the cooldown will be affected by the cooldown multiplier of the quest frequencies in the difficulty settings

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionDependencies
ValueDefinition.Description: If any sessions will be linked here, than this pool does only select new quests if one of the given sessions is currently running

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Session or region(= list of sessions) allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: OnQuestDiscarded
ValueDefinition.Description: Callback when the quest of the questpool has been automatically aborted by the system

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount will be modified by ResourcePoolModifier

ValueDefinition.Name: SentToQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates if the reward should be sent to the kontor of the quest area

ValueDefinition.Name: IsHidden
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this reward should not be shown as a reward preview upon quest invitation (i.e. Bonus Reward)

ValueDefinition.Name: IsDisguised
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this (item) reward is disguised as visible, but unknown reward to not give away the actual item earned upon invitation

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: List of reputation rewards distributed

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that rewards reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of reputation that is rewarded. This number can be negative to create a reputation loss

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateIgnoreUnlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: do not check unlocks when generating rewards

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateRewardsUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: same Reward GUID is not chosen multiple times if a pool is listed as reward asset

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: this folder is only used, if ItemLink is empty. All Items in the folder get the same weight

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount is ignored if ItemLink is a pool

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount is ignored if ItemLink is a pool

ValueDefinition.Name: DivingScrapAmountLevelNeeded
ValueDefinition.Description: The weight is only used if this level is reached by upgrades

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreUnlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: is allowed to reward items/goods that are still locked

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateUniqueRewards
ValueDefinition.Description: When this is set to true, Rewards defined in ItemLinks won't be generated multiple times (Resets after each generation)

ValueDefinition.Name: AnnoEditorAreaID
ValueDefinition.Description: Specify here which ConstructionArea when choosing an Island with more than one ContructionArea. The Value is the same as in the AnnoEditor used. 0 = Don't care use the first one you find

ValueDefinition.Name: Ambiente
ValueDefinition.Description: The ambient name from the editor

ValueDefinition.Name: DistributionCenterGhost
ValueDefinition.Description: Preview building that is placed along the coast when a ship is nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: CliffDistributionCenterGhost
ValueDefinition.Description: Preview building that is placed under an airship, leave empty if region does not have cliff islands

ValueDefinition.Name: Trees
ValueDefinition.Description: Lumberjacks automatically plant these trees

ValueDefinition.Name: Prio
ValueDefinition.Description: trees with higher prio steal tiles from low prio tree farms

ValueDefinition.Name: PlantPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: percent of grid that will be filled with trees

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResource
ValueDefinition.Description: these resources are distributed randomly over all available resource slots of an island

ValueDefinition.Name: Residence
ValueDefinition.Description: tier 1 residence of this region

ValueDefinition.Name: ElectricityUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: when is electricity unlocked in this region?

ValueDefinition.Name: MapTemplate
ValueDefinition.Description: If left empty, Template will be chosen randomly (by criteria of GameSetup)

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraSettings
ValueDefinition.Description: Select a derivate of the camera.xml that fits the type of level

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnStartShipAndKontor
ValueDefinition.Description: Is this a start session? Depending on difficulty settings (and campaign) ship(s) and/or a kontor per player is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipTransferEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: If the ship transfer is disabled, the user can't send ships into this session and can't create any inter session trade routes to other sessions

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableIslandDiscovery
ValueDefinition.Description: When true, an island will not be revealed when discovered by a ship

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteSessionAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: To reuse existing Session Routes in special Versions

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyReferenceUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: In order to allow the AI to enter this session this unlock needs to be reached (if any configured)

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyForceFollowPlayer
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the AI will follow the player in the session as soon as possible (even if the AI doesn't need an island in the new session)

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyMotivation
ValueDefinition.Description: If the AI settles this session because it followed the player the AI has nothing to reach there. The TargetPopulation and TargetAmount define the goal of the AI in the session.

ValueDefinition.Name: MapTemplateForMultiplayer
ValueDefinition.Description: When specified use this Template in Multiplayer

ValueDefinition.Name: Scenario
ValueDefinition.Description: invalid GUID/0 or the GUID of a scenario meta asset

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroMovie
ValueDefinition.Description: Intro movie or camera sequence that will be played automatically when the sesion is entered the first time

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long is the duration of the transition in seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBlur
ValueDefinition.Description: The max blur intensity

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The height of the camera at the end of the transition when zooming out of the session

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long is the duration of the transition in seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBlur
ValueDefinition.Description: The max blur intensity

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The height of the camera at the end of the transition when zooming to a worldmap asset

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeTransitionDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: General duration for all fade transitions

ValueDefinition.Name: VideoPath
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the video

ValueDefinition.Name: Loop
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the video loop?

ValueDefinition.Name: SubtitleTexts
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains information about which subtitle Text Assets should be displayed over the course of the Video and their starting point as offset

ValueDefinition.Name: StartTimeOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: offset in Milliseconds after the beginning of the video when SubtitleTextGUID is displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: SubtitleTextGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: GUID of the TextAsset that should be displayed "StartTimeOffset" after the beginning of the video as Subtitle

ValueDefinition.Name: Profile
ValueDefinition.Description: Profile GUID of the character that should be displayed in the notification. If no profile is specified, no Notification will be shown (and TextGUID will be ignored) - only Voice Audio and Subtitle will be shown then

ValueDefinition.Name: StopAfterLastVoiceMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is TRUE the video will be stopped after the last voice message of the video has finished

ValueDefinition.Name: VideoSoundAndMusic
ValueDefinition.Description: All sound tracks that should be triggered at the start of the video - like SFX & Music (NOT VOICE, for voice use SubtitleTexts vector)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumRuntime
ValueDefinition.Description: If configured the video will run at least this duration regardless of how many voices are configured

ValueDefinition.Name: CorporationLogo
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon that is displayed as the corporation logo

ValueDefinition.Name: CorporationPortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: Link to the Profile of the NPC that is the Leader of the corporation (Big 5 Character)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowScore
ValueDefinition.Description: Show this profile in coporation score

ValueDefinition.Name: CamFileConsole
ValueDefinition.Description: Camera config file that is used on consoles. CamFile is used if this field is empty

ValueDefinition.Name: PreventFirstSettleIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Islands entered here will not be settled first by the AI (actually the AI will ignore the islands as long as they belong to nobody)

ValueDefinition.Name: AskForSettlePermissionsCooldowns
ValueDefinition.Description: Should AI Ask human if it is allowed to settle 2nd island? If entries are present it will do. After a query was RJECTED, it will wait at least [Entry0] for next Query. After each consecutive REJECT by human, the next entry is taken. On further rejects, the last entry is taken agian. Caution: Special Treatment for Multiplayer

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: If left empty the Building will be added to the construction queue as soon as it's unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: MinTimeBetweenBuilds
ValueDefinition.Description: Time between consecutive new Buildings if all resources are available

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTimeBetweenBuilds
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum Time between two builds that we allow. If we cannot afford anything within this time, we build more Construction Materials.

ValueDefinition.Name: RubberbandSpeedUp
ValueDefinition.Description: 0: No Rubberbanding --- 1: "Human is double as good: double speed" --- 2: "Human is double as good: speed x4"

ValueDefinition.Name: RubberbandSlowDown
ValueDefinition.Description: 0: No Rubberbanding --- 1: "Human is half as good: 1/2 speed" --- 2: "Human is half as good: speed 1/4"

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredMoneyRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = Try to have exactly as much income as running costs. 2 = Try to have double as much income as running costs.

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredWorkforceRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = Try to have exactly as much workforce as required. 2 = Try to have double as much workforce as required

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumStartMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: StartMoney is Determined by other systems (Game Difficulty and shit), but it always amounts at least to

ValueDefinition.Name: MinTargetRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 2.0 = "Enforce at least double as many buildings of PreferredCivLevel, compared to the ReferenceCivLevel". ReferenceCivLevel is the CivLevel with most buildings among all CivLevels higher than PreferredCivLevel.

ValueDefinition.Name: SimulatedItemProductivity
ValueDefinition.Description: The production of this good gets the given factor (1.0 == no factor, 2.0 == double output)

ValueDefinition.Name: ProducerBuildingCountMain
ValueDefinition.Description: Desired Producer Building Count in main session. Only built as soon as unlocked. Will be requested additionally to crafter needs. If not buildable in a region it will be ignored there.

ValueDefinition.Name: SmallIslandFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If GameSetup says "SmallIslands", we multiply the balanced buildingAmount with this factor. We do the same for SmallFertilities and then take the minimum of what both checks say. When we have "medium island size", we take an interpolation of 1 and the small-factor.

ValueDefinition.Name: SmallFertilitiesFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as SmallIslandFactor, but for the GameSetup of Fertility Sparseness

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumptionConfiguration
ValueDefinition.Description: Population Consumption Configuration per CivLevel. Use this to make certain civ levels consume more or less (or even nothing) of certain goods (or public services).

ValueDefinition.Name: GeneralOptionalSupply
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is used to determine for all >optional< goods which are not overriden how much of this good is required. If zero this also impacts the public services

ValueDefinition.Name: SupplyOverwrite
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: this has precendence before the generalOptionalSupply. You may define optional goods as well as non optional goods / services here.

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceModifiers
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: Every CityInstitution which is not entered here will have the default distance (which equals to factor 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: 2 means the station has double the range (which means a quadratic increase in the covered area). 0.5 means the distance is halfed.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProhibitedCivLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: For the Civ Levels defined here the Construction AI will never build any buildings. Note that this has a couple of implications: The levels above the prohibited CivLevels will also not be reached, also if you prohibit a CivLevel (like SA) which produces goods for other CivLevels those will also not be able to be built

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpandForever
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the AI will continue to build the highest tier buildings when everything is unlocked.

ValueDefinition.Name: LimitBuildingsPerIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Limits Building Count of given guid in given Region to [TinyCount] on tiny islands and to [HugeCount] on huge islands

ValueDefinition.Name: HugeIslandRelative
ValueDefinition.Description: Which relative island size [0...1] does a huge island have

ValueDefinition.Name: TinyIslandRelative
ValueDefinition.Description: Which relative island size [0...1] does a tiny island have

ValueDefinition.Name: InputGoodConsumption
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the consumption of input goods for certain buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumptionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. if a factory needs 2 Lumber per minute and we set this factor to 1.5 it then needs 3 Lumber per minute

ValueDefinition.Name: TryReplaceOrnamentsWithStreets
ValueDefinition.Description: Tries to place 1x1 streets instead of 1x1 ornaments

ValueDefinition.Name: AvenueOrnamental1x1End
ValueDefinition.Description: The Start-and-End of an ornamental-avenue-line. If you configured D and have middle-piece A, a 5-line looks like DAAAD

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount that the ornament is rotated when placed at start in a horizontal line. (for vertical lines +90degrees are added) (for end +180 degrees are added)

ValueDefinition.Name: AvenueOrnamentals1x1Middle
ValueDefinition.Description: The MidTiles of an ornamental-avenue-line. If you configured ABC and have end D, a 7-line will look like DABCABD. If you do not have an endpiece it will be ABCABCA

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount that the ornament is rotated when placed in a horizontal line. (for vertical lines +90degrees are added)

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount that the ornament is rotated when placed at an corner connecting the +z and +x direction

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability3x3In3x3
ValueDefinition.Description: If we have a 3x3 ornament area, how probable is it that we place a 3x3 ornamental within

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability2x2In3x3
ValueDefinition.Description: If we have a 3x3 ornament area and do not place a 3x3 ornamental, how probable is it that we place a 3x3 ornamental within

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability2x2In2x2
ValueDefinition.Description: If we have a 3x3 ornament area, how probable is it that we place a 2x2 ornamental within

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockScale
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = only use small blocks. 1 = only use large blocks. 0.75 = use more large than small blocks

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockScale_SmallIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as BlockScale, but used for small islands

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockTypeRatio_SmallIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as BlockTypeRatio, but used for small islands

ValueDefinition.Name: SameVariationsAndRotationsWithinBlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Within the same city block, all residences have the same rotation and variation

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildsRectengularFreeformFields
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds an additional step to freeform-field-placement that tries to order them rectengularly instead of radial

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeShipRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines in which ratio the AI constructs Trade Ships. Be aware that the AI tries only to produce unlocked ships. Note that when the AI needs a new ship it only takes ships (and their weight) into account if they are fulfill the requirements (e.g. the AI needs a ship to transport oil so only the oil ship weights are taken into account)

ValueDefinition.Name: Overproduction
ValueDefinition.Description: Which products should be produced more than needed

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = no overproduction. 2 = double the needed amount

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuyGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximal amount of goods the AI buys on each kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: MinBuyCapacity
ValueDefinition.Description: A good is only added as buy request if CurrentStorage - TargetStorage > this number.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetStorageAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The target storage amount for buy goods (so if set to 30 and the AI has currently 10 it will buy 20)

ValueDefinition.Name: UpdateInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The AI periodically updates the PassiveTrade offers but doesn't do so every tick to prevent a changing offer if the player buys or sells a small amount of somethin.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSellGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum number of goods the AI sells on each kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStorageToSell
ValueDefinition.Description: the AI needs to have at least a surplus of this number in order to sell it.

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveTrade
ValueDefinition.Description: These values are used per session not globally. The AI will try to have the defined ships per session,

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Define items the AI will cheat in order to fill the modules of the corresponding cultural building

ValueDefinition.Name: Cultural
ValueDefinition.Description: The cultural building associated to the item pool

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemCheatInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The AI tries to cheat items in order to fill the culture modules. This happens with this interval.

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivityThresholdForVisitorHarbor
ValueDefinition.Description: If this amount of attractivity is reached on a city with the culture / visitor role a visitor harbor is build.

ValueDefinition.Name: PlanFence
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the AI tries build a fence around cultural buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: LookAndFeelModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: A flat happiness value which is added to the happiness of every residents

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerRiotDuringCrisisInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = Never trigger Riots. When AI Island has a crisis (e.g. trade ship was destroyed and not replaced) it starts a riot. This value says how much time has to elapse before a consecutive riot is started.

ValueDefinition.Name: RegionPriorities
ValueDefinition.Description: When AI wants to outsource a production to another session and can chose between multiple regions, which will it try first. Higher Number means earlier trying

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchCenterTightPublicBlockRange
ValueDefinition.Description: A range around the ResearchCenter in which we prevent public blocks with space for resident buildings (as this space would be for 3x3 resident buildings which we don't want to have on our campus)

ValueDefinition.Name: Limit
ValueDefinition.Description: As soon as the amount of money for this budget reaches it's limit additional money will be split among all other budgets (-1 means unlimited)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceDurationToPay
ValueDefinition.Description: The time for which the construction AI should pay the maintenance upfront for military ships (the AI will not pay maintenance for those ships)

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestDiplomacyActionThresholdInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: // If two important ships get destroyed within this interval, The DiplomacyAI is requested for help (e.g. ceasefire against pirates). 0 if not desired at all.

ValueDefinition.Name: HarborDefenses
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the ratio of harbor defenses per coast

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is muliplicated with the balanced money maintenance to change the impact the building will have on the AI military budgets

ValueDefinition.Name: SecurityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor influencing how much defense structure the AI wants to build in the course of a game.

ValueDefinition.Name: HighProtectIslandSecurityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Islands which are flagged as "HighProtect" which is mainly the main island. Get their ground security requirement multiplied by this factor.

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusProtectionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The Attack radius * this factor defines the radius in which the towers increase the protection value.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is muliplicated with the balanced money maintenance to change the impact the building will have on the AI military budgets

ValueDefinition.Name: SecurityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor influencing how much defense structure the AI wants to build in the course of a game.

ValueDefinition.Name: HighProtectIslandSecurityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Islands which are flagged as "HighProtect" which is mainly the main island. Get their air security requirement multiplied by this factor.

ValueDefinition.Name: Precondition
ValueDefinition.Description: When should the AI start to place mines?

ValueDefinition.Name: PlaceMinesAroundHarbor
ValueDefinition.Description: Will place a ring of mines around the connected harbors

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceToHarbor
ValueDefinition.Description: the radius around the harbor center where the mines get laid

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: +/- this distance the radius is randomly offsetted (Note: as the mines may deviate in both directions they might vary double the distance configured here)

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceBetweenMines
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance between mines (this is an approximation as it's calculated based on the distance not taking into account the distance variation)

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnDelayAfterMineExploded
ValueDefinition.Description: An additional delay after a mine exploded to prevent mines from directly spawning again

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipSafetyDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Mines are only spawned if there is no ship (owned by another first or second party) within safety distance to prevent spawn of mines directly under enemy ships.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingReplacements
ValueDefinition.Description: Replaces one building with another, the AI will only know of the replacement and use the balancing of the replacement. Warning: Currently it's not supported to change the balancing here for existing participants as this will impact current savegames in an undefined behaviour.

ValueDefinition.Name: StrengthLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the overall behaviour of the AI for different states (superior, inferior, equal).

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum strength ratio to be on this superiority level.

ValueDefinition.Name: Flee
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines whether the AI should flee on this level.

ValueDefinition.Name: UniteUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines whether the AI should keep all of its units together.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttackRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for attack purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxEscortRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for escort purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDefendRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used to defend yourself below this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPatrolRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for patrol purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDefendAllyRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used to defend allies below this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBombardRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for bombard purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: BudgetThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The constructionAI contains military budgets that determine how much of the total budget may be used for military purposes. If the military strength of this AI is below this threshold, the AI considers itself to be threatened and will use the budget that is configured for this scenario.

ValueDefinition.Name: UpdateInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: How often is the strength level recalculated

ValueDefinition.Name: Attack
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains several parameters used to run an attack.

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum strength ratio to run an attack.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalUnitsRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how strong should the AI be in the session to run an attack.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalUnitsStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Min strength of available units used for aditional attacking units. Important for targets with a strength of 0 like buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines intervals in which the AI will search for new targets (= attack frequency), Set to 0 if there should not be any targeted attacks.

ValueDefinition.Name: AirAttackInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Same As AttackInterval, but for AirFleet

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackTargetPrio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines allowed targets and their priority (a target not listed here will only be attacked by auto attack)

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: Usually the AI would always go with the first target in this list that it finds. This value describes the percental likeliness that this criterion is skipped to make the AI less predictable (0-100) ; 0 = never skip

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipTargetWhenInHarbourArea
ValueDefinition.Description: defines if the target should be skipped if it is within a harbour area when trying to find something to attack

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumConsideredTargets
ValueDefinition.Description: (0 = consider all targets) The maximum amount of targets that will be considered for this priority. The targets are sorted based on the condition given

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBlinded
ValueDefinition.Description: [Currently only supports one flag at a time] if an AI is "blinded" it cannot see any enemy ships and/or buildings when they come close, they can only fight back after getting attacked

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnedShareThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the AI owns at least this many shares of an island, it won't actively attack it anymore (currently we got a max amount of 5 shares)

ValueDefinition.Name: RallyBeforeAttack
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the AI makes its units group up before launching an attack

ValueDefinition.Name: OverkillAttackThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if the attack target and it's surroundings are at least this much of the entire military strength of the target participant IN THE CURRENT SESSION, then the AI will send an overkill attack. Otherwise it will scale down its fleets and only send as much as necessary. (0 -100)

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of damage the bomb run should do if it hits all projectiles on one building.

ValueDefinition.Name: Defend
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains several parameters used for defending own buildings/ships

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum strength ratio trying to match for defend groups

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units will be added to a defend group.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefendInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines intervals in which the AI will search for points it has to defend (= defend frequency)

ValueDefinition.Name: AirDefendInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as DefendInterval, but for AirFleet

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackStrongestTargetFirst
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines whether the AI should try to attack the strongest targets first.

ValueDefinition.Name: SharedDefendUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines whether the AI uses every available unit to attack the best target.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum strength ratio to use an item.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemUsageInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the interval how often the AI looks to use an item.

ValueDefinition.Name: Patrol
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains several parameters used to send a squad on patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckPatrolInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval to check for new patrols or update existing ones.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAirPatrolInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CheckPatrolInterval, but for AirFleet

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDistanceToLand
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum distance to land for patrol stations (in tiles).

ValueDefinition.Name: UseStrategicPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines whether the squad will move to a strategic position instead of a patrol station...

ValueDefinition.Name: SquadLogic
ValueDefinition.Description: Handles support, flee, and attack behaviour for ship squads

ValueDefinition.Name: FleeStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 100 = enemy strength. If our squad has this value or less strength relative to the enemy, start to flee

ValueDefinition.Name: BombardFleeStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Like FleeStrengthRatio, but when bombarding

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPriorities
ValueDefinition.Description: Attack: No need to flee, objects in range will be attacked according to this priority list

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipTargetWhenInHarbourArea
ValueDefinition.Description: defines if the target should be skipped if it is within a harbour area when trying to find something to attack

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumConsideredTargets
ValueDefinition.Description: (0 = consider all targets) The maximum amount of targets that will be considered for this priority. The targets are sorted based on the condition given

ValueDefinition.Name: CommandsToSupport
ValueDefinition.Description: Support: Defines which commands are more important than the squad's command

ValueDefinition.Name: CommandsToAbandon
ValueDefinition.Description: Support: Defines which commands might be abandoned in favour of supporting other fleets

ValueDefinition.Name: ObservationRange
ValueDefinition.Description: General: The range around the center of the squad that is used to find things to support, flee from things, and attack things

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSquadLogicInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: General: How frequently the squadLogic is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Min Strength ratio of trade ship attackers.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckEscortInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval to check whether there are any trade ships to escort.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxEscapeDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the distance how far an escort ship should move far away from its protected ship.

ValueDefinition.Name: HPRatioCombat
ValueDefinition.Description: How much HP should a unit have while being in combat to start a repair command.

ValueDefinition.Name: HPRatioIdle
ValueDefinition.Description: How much HP should a unit have while being in idle state to start a repair command.

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOverride
ValueDefinition.Description: override the values of a Shiplimits for a specific session

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: which session guid should have seperate values

ValueDefinition.Name: Percentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much is the value of the original value, e.g. 50% of original numbers

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchupFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: catchup feature for ship limit

ValueDefinition.Name: Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: enable shiplimit catchup

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchupToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much of the human ship count should AI catch up to

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowdownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: slowdown feature for ship limit

ValueDefinition.Name: Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: enable shiplimit slowdown

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowdownToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much of the human ship count should AI slow down to

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSlowdown
ValueDefinition.Description: what the minimal percentage of the

ValueDefinition.Name: AirWarFleet
ValueDefinition.Description: Like WarFleet, but for objects that can fight flying objects. Only loaded when DLC11 is active

ValueDefinition.Name: StartAreaRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the starting radius of the pirates around their kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: ChaseRange
ValueDefinition.Description: A targeted ship must leave the current area of activity + this range for the pirates to stop attacking it

ValueDefinition.Name: GrowPerProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: defines the grow rate of area extents

ValueDefinition.Name: ComebackAfterKontorDestruction
ValueDefinition.Description: Pirates rebuilt their settlement when kontor is destroyed after this time (0 = no rebuilt)

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestCeaseFireTributeIntervalMin
ValueDefinition.Description: pirates regularly offer a temporary cease fire for tribute

ValueDefinition.Name: DecoBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Buildings get invisible if kontor is destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodsTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: If this property is set to false, the participant can't trade with goods anymore. It won't be possible to create traderoutes to this participant or doing active trade but users can still buy ships if it's a ship trader

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStorageLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: CURRENTLY NOT WORKING!

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: whether or not the trader BUYS ships (selling is defined by the ship production)

ValueDefinition.Name: SellShipCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: The Cooldown before a new sell ship is requested after one is bought.

ValueDefinition.Name: SellShipRequestNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The third party notification which is displayed with an "Accept" and "Deny" button when the player wants to sell one of his ships to the trader. NOTE: You may leave the profile field of the notification empty, it then will be automatically filled with the corresponding trader profile.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyShipRequestNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The third party notification which is triggered with an "Accept" and "Deny" button when the player clicks a ship which is for sale. NOTE: You may leave the profile field of the notification empty, it then will be automatically filled with the corresponding trader profile.

ValueDefinition.Name: SellBudget
ValueDefinition.Description: Budget spent on selling at a harbor. Scales with ship amount (twice the ships = twice the budget in the same timeframe).

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyBudget
ValueDefinition.Description: Budget spent on buying at a harbor. Scales with ship amount (twice the ships = twice the budget in the same timeframe).

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipProductionCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: pause between two ship productions

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyShipRequestNoTradeAgreementNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The third party notification which is triggered when the player clicks a ship which is for sale but without a TradeAgreement with this player.

ValueDefinition.Name: TraderItemRerollCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: Basic money costs to reroll the item offerings of a third party trader

ValueDefinition.Name: TraderItemRerollCostIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of money the price for a reroll increases by a manual reroll. An automatic reroll resets the increasing costs

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvidesShipReplacements
ValueDefinition.Description: For all types selected this trader will provide a replacement ship for sale to the player if he lost his.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemBuyLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: Max amount of items the user can buy at this trader. If this limit is reached, no further item can be bought until the timer has restored the trade actions (see ItemBuyLimitRestoreDurations)

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemBuyLimitRestoreDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval that defines when a new Buy-Item-Action is restored for the user at this trader

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyInfinitePreferredGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the trader will buy infinite goods but only out of those that are configured as preferred goods

Property.Name: BuyShares
Property.Description: Roll the Dice when able to takeover island.

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryTakeoverProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: After an Island War AI take the island with this chance (0 = never, 100 = ever)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockForBuyingOtherShares
ValueDefinition.Description: You can choose when the AI starts to buy shares from other parties.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmountOfOtherShares
ValueDefinition.Description: A hard cap of how many other shares AI can buy (replacing the Influence limitations)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceRollProposalMin
ValueDefinition.Description: minimal value of a dice roll for proposals

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceRollProposalMax
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal value of a dice roll for proposals

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceRollThreatMin
ValueDefinition.Description: minimal value of a dice roll for threats

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceRollThreatMax
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal value of a dice roll for threats

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionWeight
ValueDefinition.Description: weight of this action if this is combined in a proposal

ValueDefinition.Name: AgreementThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: threshold when an agreement is reached

ValueDefinition.Name: PartialAgreementThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: threshold when an partial agreement is reached

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPossibleReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: the give payment value is multplied by this value and you cannot ask for more money than this without odds falling steeply, effectivly limiting the amount of excerss reputation you can convert to money with this action

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAddedLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: maximum reputation you can temporary gain in a single negotiation by paying extra money

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAddedSteepness
ValueDefinition.Description: steepness of temporary reputation added in a negotiation: limit / (-1 - steepness * money) + limit

ValueDefinition.Name: AddingTreaty
ValueDefinition.Description: how much reputation is gained if this treaty is added

ValueDefinition.Name: RemovingTreaty
ValueDefinition.Description: how much reputation is lost if this treaty is removed

ValueDefinition.Name: NegBorderMin
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: NegBorderMax
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: PosBorderMin
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: PosBorderMax
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: NegBorderMin
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: NegBorderMax
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: PosBorderMin
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: PosBorderMax
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: NegBorderMin
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: NegBorderMax
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: PosBorderMin
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: PosBorderMax
ValueDefinition.Description: see rep_scaling.xls

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseValue
ValueDefinition.Description: base level of money gift

ValueDefinition.Name: IncreasePerLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: increase of money value for each company level

ValueDefinition.Name: RepeatableActionBalancing
ValueDefinition.Description: setup the success chance, reputatain gain/ loss of repeatable actions

ValueDefinition.Name: Subdivisions
ValueDefinition.Description: balancing of subsequent uses of a repeatable action

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessChance
ValueDefinition.Description: Chance of the action succeeding (percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationGain
ValueDefinition.Description: reputation gain if succeeding (5 -> get 5 RP, -5 -> lose 5 RP)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationLoss
ValueDefinition.Description: reputation loss if failed (-5 -> lose 5 RP, 5 -> get 5 RP)

ValueDefinition.Name: ForgettingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: time until a use of a diplomatic action is forgotten by AI player

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortTermCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: short timer after which the memory might change

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortTimeChange
ValueDefinition.Description: change of reputation which satisfies the short time check

ValueDefinition.Name: LongTimeCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: long timer after which the memory might change

ValueDefinition.Name: UpdateTable
ValueDefinition.Description: table of memory update values

ValueDefinition.Name: Difference
ValueDefinition.Description: if current difference between reputation and memory is bigger than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: Change
ValueDefinition.Description: ...then move the memory for this value

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationUpdateTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: how often will the reputation be updated, if different from memory

ValueDefinition.Name: NegReputationCorrectionMax
ValueDefinition.Description: how much will reputation decrease, if higher than memory

ValueDefinition.Name: PosReputationCorrectionMax
ValueDefinition.Description: how much will reputation increase, if lower than memory

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceDebuff
ValueDefinition.Description: how much does the dice roll drop when debuff is active

ValueDefinition.Name: DebuffTime
ValueDefinition.Description: how long is the debuff active

ValueDefinition.Name: DiminishingDebuff
ValueDefinition.Description: does the debuff diminish over time

ValueDefinition.Name: ApplyWhenSuccesful
ValueDefinition.Description: also apply debuff if the action was successful

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveDebuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Debuff value if the actions debuff mode is set to "remove"

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveDebuffTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Debuff time if the actions debuff mode is set to "remove"

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveDiminishing
ValueDefinition.Description: unused for now

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceRollCounterMin
ValueDefinition.Description: minimal value of a dice roll for counter proposals

ValueDefinition.Name: DiceRollCounterMax
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal value of a dice roll for counter proposals

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterProposalAgree
ValueDefinition.Description: agree threshold for counter proposals

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterProposalPartial
ValueDefinition.Description: partial agree threshold for counter proposals

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterProposalDeclineStart
ValueDefinition.Description: percentage chance to decline first counter proposal round

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterProposalDeclineIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: percentage chance to decline counter proposal increase per round

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerAction
ValueDefinition.Description: which diplomacy action is triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerType
ValueDefinition.Description: how is the action triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinTriggerReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: minimum of the random range which can trigger this

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTriggerReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: maximum of the random range which can trigger this

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckMilitaryStrength
CheckEconomyStrength
TriggerChance
ValueDefinition.Description: 0-100 percent: the higher the chance, the more likely the trigger is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: if multiple triggers are active at same time, only one of the highest priority will be executed

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationTriggerDelayMin
ValueDefinition.Description: how much will the trigger be delayed, minimum

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationTriggerDelayMax
ValueDefinition.Description: how much will the trigger be delayed, maximum

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationMinDice
ValueDefinition.Description: extra dice roll for reputation trigger calculation

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationMaxDice
ValueDefinition.Description: extra dice roll for reputation trigger calculation

ValueDefinition.Name: MinMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: multiples of the counter proposal money value, money request/ offer below this values are discarded

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxMoneyOffering
ValueDefinition.Description: multiples of the counter proposal money value

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxMoneyRequest
ValueDefinition.Description: multiples of the counter proposal money value

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerAction
ValueDefinition.Description: which diplomacy action is triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerType
ValueDefinition.Description: how is the action triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinTriggerReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: action is not triggered when reputation is below this value

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTriggerReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: action is not triggered when reputation is above this value

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckMilitaryStrength
CheckEconomyStrength
TriggerChance
ValueDefinition.Description: 0-100 percent: the higher the chance, the more likely the trigger is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: if multiple triggers are active at same time, only one of the higherst priority will be executed

ValueDefinition.Name: AddMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: add money to this AI diplomacy action

ValueDefinition.Name: AutomaticDiscovery
ValueDefinition.Description: If enabled, this participant will automatically discover any other particpant as soon as A) the timer runs out or B) the OTHER participant reached the given progress level

ValueDefinition.Name: ProgressCheckEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this participant will discover any other participant who reached the DesiredProgress. Normal discovery by a ship is still possible

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: Discovers any participant with the given progress

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeCheckEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this participant will discover every other participant as soon as the configured time has been passed. Timer starts as soon the participant was created. Normal discovery by a ship is still possible

ValueDefinition.Name: Time
ValueDefinition.Description: If this timer runs out, this participant will discover all other participants which are not discovered yet. Does nothing if set to 0

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverAnyoneOnInit
ValueDefinition.Description: When participants are created, they use DefaultTreatiesUndiscovered to initialise their relation to others. When the participant is then discovered, DefaultTreaties and Exceptions override this relationship. However, participants like the General Enemy cannot be discovered and therefore will be stuck in their UndiscoveredTreaties. tl;dr: set this to true to automatically discover (and be discovered by) any other participant

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowDiscoveryPamsyWhenDiscoveryDisabled
ValueDefinition.Description: When starting with disabled DiscoveryFeature, Participants are auto-discovered immediately. Should we trigger a Discovered-Pamsy in that case?

Property.Name: ExpeditionUser
Property.Description: This player can go on expeditions

Property.Name: Highscore
Property.Description: Highscore will be calculated for this player

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Value threshold that needs to be reached before a message is triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueIncreaseFromAction
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount the value towards the threshold will increase when this action is executed on a second party island

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueIncreasePerHitTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount the value towards the threshold will increase per hit target by this action

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeUntilActionIsForgotten
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration the AI will remember this action.

ValueDefinition.Name: CoolDownAfterThresholdHasBeenReached
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration after triggering message in which same actions will not count towards next threshold

Property.Name: MetaInfluence
Property.Description: This player has a influence income

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseInfluenceCapacity
ValueDefinition.Description: influence capacity at profile level 0 (profile starts with level 1!)

Property.Name: ParticipantMessages
Property.Description: How does the Participant react to certain Triggers?

ValueDefinition.Name: Reactions
ValueDefinition.Description: The conditions for all Reactions will be checked from top to bottom. As soon as one is Fulfilled, The Reaction is triggered and the evaluation is stopped.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Reaction is only executed when the two related participants have one of the required diplomacyStates. Empty = Dont Care. (All Checked = Dont Care, but Empty is Recommended)

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredContextAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Type of asset depends on trigger (e.g. a buildingAsset for CREATE_CULTURAL_BUILDING). If a message has an asset as precondition, it will only be executed if the trigger relates to the same asset

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredContextMenu
ValueDefinition.Description: Reaction is only executed when the given menu is currently opened

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredContextValueThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: -1 = Ignore this Requirement. Some Triggers are Fired with a ContextValue (e.g. "Propaganda" can be slight(0), medium(1), heavy(2), ...). If you set this value to X, than the reaction is triggered for all values <= X.

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability
ValueDefinition.Description: If this trigger occurs, how likely (0.0 = never, 1.0 = always) will the reaction be executed?

ValueDefinition.Name: ProbabilityIsOneForFirstOccurence
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Relevant when Probability != 1. Forces the Probability of a Reaction to 100% for first occurence of this trigger.

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreFirstOccurences
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Triggers should be ignored before the first Reaction is Executed? 0 = Execute on first Trigger Occurence

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownOccurences
ValueDefinition.Description: After an Execution of this Reaction, how many Triggers are ignored before the next Reaction is Executed? 0 = Execute on every consecutive Trigger Occurence.

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownTime
ValueDefinition.Description: After an Execution of this Reaction, how much time has to pass before this Reaction is allowed to be Executed again?

ValueDefinition.Name: SideEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the Reaction Execute Any Side Effects? (Details for the Side Effect can be configured in EffectValue). Note: Reputation Changes always Change What THIS profile thinks of the other one (human / other).

ValueDefinition.Name: SideEffectValue
ValueDefinition.Description: If SideEffect needs a value as additional context, put it in here

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is executed by this Reaction

ValueDefinition.Name: Notification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is executed by this Reaction (if NotificationGUID is not set)

ValueDefinition.Name: ProfilePicture
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the profile picture

ValueDefinition.Name: Portrait
ValueDefinition.Description: Portrait assigned to this profile

ValueDefinition.Name: ProfileType
ValueDefinition.Description: Virtual means "never owns any game objects". Pick ThirdParty otherwise.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: A background picture that is used in the character notification menu

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestStarterObject
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the object where all quests triggered by this profile can be accepted

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPoolList
ValueDefinition.Description: The list with all quest pools that are assigned to this character

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestTrackerBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the watermark background that will be shown in the quest tracker UI

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibleInDiplomacy
ValueDefinition.Description: make this

ValueDefinition.Name: AICanActUponProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: AI will do diplomacy actions torwards this profile

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipDropRewardPool
ValueDefinition.Description: When a ship gets destroyed a flotsam may be generated

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateModeMeta
ValueDefinition.Description: In which cases should the MetaParticipant be created?

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateModeSession
ValueDefinition.Description: In which cases should the session participant be created

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackableThroughPirateFlagItem
ValueDefinition.Description: The pirate flag item overrides all diplomatic states. this bool ensures that you still can't attack everyone.

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateIfParentIsCreated
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: This currently only creates SessionParticipant (if parent is created)

ValueDefinition.Name: AvoidIslandsOnEnterSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If this flag is set to true, ships that enter the session will try to avoid a spawnposition near to the islands of this participant

Property.Name: ProfileCounter
Property.Description: Statistics will be tracked for this player

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchingGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: the research is unlocked and the item is relocked if the item is crafted or rewarded. Ensures that the item is only craftable once.

ValueDefinition.Name: CreatesItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to false for research craftings that only unlock and do not generate an item instance. Leave at true for milestone items (that have a research guid to ensure uniqueness but still have a real item)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStackSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Stacklimit for this item. 0 for unlimited. The StackLimit of the ItemContainer still has effect.

ValueDefinition.Name: HasAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Has this Item an Action?

ValueDefinition.Name: ExclusiveGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: only one captain can be equipped, only one motor

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemSet
ValueDefinition.Description: is this item part of a visible item set?

ValueDefinition.Name: Flotsam
ValueDefinition.Description: if the item is thrown overboard, a flotsam of this type is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: FlotsamTerrain
ValueDefinition.Description: if a flotsam is spawned on terrain, this is the asset that is spawned. If empty, a generic terrain flotsam asset is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: TransferBlocked
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in campaign to block slots/sockets for user interaction

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEquippableOnce
ValueDefinition.Description: it is not allowed to have multiple items of this equipped in the same item container

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketOverwriteSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D sound which is triggered at the object this is socketed (overwrites the configuration within the object)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnsocketOverwriteSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D sound which is triggered at the object this is unsocketed (overwrites the configuration within the object)

ValueDefinition.Name: BroadcastMusicEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: This event is triggered if the broadcast button in the Music Pavillion is pressed

ValueDefinition.Name: ReapplyEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: Define versions in which the effect of this item is reapplied. Use this when changing e.g. the item target pool so that those changes are properly applied. Only use always for debugging purposes. The effect is once reapplied on upgrading the savegame version.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemFilterCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: only needed for special item filter

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenarioFilter
ValueDefinition.Description: This item is only part of this scenario, leave empty for vanilla items. Used in StatisticScreen

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenarioUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: item can only exist once in the scenario

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal distance from ship to target position

ValueDefinition.Name: IsDestroyedAfterCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Consumables are deleted after usage (slot is still blocked until cooldown is finished)

ValueDefinition.Name: Charges
ValueDefinition.Description: Consumables may have multiple charges until they are used up

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: duration of an item action

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Active upgrade with duration and cooldown

ValueDefinition.Name: CanEndItemAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Can the duration be ended manually?

ValueDefinition.Name: StopMovementOnInteraction
ValueDefinition.Description: Vehicle stops when the item interaction starts

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateActionSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound triggered when action is activated. It's expected to be a 2D sound which will be triggered, only plays for the triggering player.

ValueDefinition.Name: DeactivateActionSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound triggered when action is deactivated. It's expected to be a 2D sound which will be triggered, only plays for the triggering player.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemSearchText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is used as keyword in the item search to find items with this allocation. If empty, Text is being used as keyword

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGenCrateScale
ValueDefinition.Description: Uniform scale for the item crate asset

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffFluffIndexIncreaseTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: Buffs can have multiple fluff texts. These texts will change according to this timer

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of sockets in which items can be equipped

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketAllocation
ValueDefinition.Description: What item allocation types are allowed in my sockets?

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Which scope is affected by equipped items?

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketScopeRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Radius is effected by items in my sockets?

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketScopeRadiusOverlapCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: OverlapCategory for item container radius buildings. So multiple GUIDs can use the same category (example: Docklands and Harbourmaster)

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of slots in which items or goods can be stacked up to their stacklimit or the stacklimit of the ItemContainer. Items in slots are inactive (only items in sockets are equipped)

ValueDefinition.Name: StackLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of goods or items which fit into one slot

ValueDefinition.Name: CanStoreProducts
ValueDefinition.Description: Ships can store products, Warehouses send products to their LogisticNode

ValueDefinition.Name: EmptySocketItemNonModifiable
ValueDefinition.Description: shown on empty sockets where no modification is allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnsFlotsam
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this item container spawns flotsams on certain events (e.g. destruction)

ValueDefinition.Name: FlotsamNoRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Indiates whether the flotsam should exactly spawn at the object's position. If false, it will apply a random offset

ValueDefinition.Name: FixedSlotContent
ValueDefinition.Description: Coal ships can only transport coal

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D Sound which is triggered when an item is socketed (note this sound can be overwritten by the item)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnsocketSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D Sound which is triggered when an item is unsocketed (note this sound can be overwritten by the item)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectTargets
ValueDefinition.Description: which guids are affected (needed for items with radius allocation: TownHall;GuildHouse;RadiusBuilding and item actions with scope SelfRadius)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingDecoration
ValueDefinition.Description: affected Buildings are decorated using this configuration. If multiple item effects provide decoration only the first one is used.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplacementPools
ValueDefinition.Description: List of items which are replaced with a real reward from the ReplacementPool

ValueDefinition.Name: SetBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: leave empty if the buff depends on the current region (use RegionSetBuff instead)

ValueDefinition.Name: RegionSetBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Set may have different buffs based on the current region

ValueDefinition.Name: Expedition
ValueDefinition.Description: which expedition is started when owning this item?

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyOnClick
ValueDefinition.Description: Item is consumed when click actions are executed

ValueDefinition.Name: UseEffectAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a full asset should be used as an effect or a simple cfg (requires path)

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of Projectiles to launch

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: radius of special actions (e.g. mortar can have an area where the projectiles land randomly)

ValueDefinition.Name: SonarDetector
ValueDefinition.Description: Balance the things which can be detected

ValueDefinition.Name: Target
ValueDefinition.Description: which type of thing is detected

ValueDefinition.Name: Range
ValueDefinition.Description: how close must the thing be to be detected

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDetectedUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: only the n closest things will be detected (0=disable)

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerRange
ValueDefinition.Description: if > 0, everything within this range is detected, even its more than maxdetected

ValueDefinition.Name: ScanColor
ValueDefinition.Description: color of the scan

ValueDefinition.Name: SonarRepeat
ValueDefinition.Description: after how much time the ping repeats

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectFile
ValueDefinition.Description: Visual Effect that will be shown while the item is active

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraSequenceID
ValueDefinition.Description: The previously in the editor defined ID of the camera sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: HideProgressBar
ValueDefinition.Description: Sometimes, the progress of an achievement can not be shown correctly. Use this flag to hide the progress bar of this achievement

ValueDefinition.Name: AchievementPS5ID
ValueDefinition.Description: "TrophyID" on the playstation servers. Gets automatically set by exporting the trophies.

ValueDefinition.Name: StatEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: Event that should be sent to ubisoft

ValueDefinition.Name: ProgressField
ValueDefinition.Description: Event field where progress will be saved, can be empty

ValueDefinition.Name: Dlcs
ValueDefinition.Description: Link here all the DLCs that are communicated as'DLC' to the player e.g. in the MPLobby

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradesSavegame
ValueDefinition.Description: True if this dlc can be activated for an existing game.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductPromotion
ValueDefinition.Description: The promotion asset that should be displayed to the user

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplaceBuildingsWhenDLCisActive
IgnoreSecondParty
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement is not done for AI

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatePlayerPause
ValueDefinition.Description: Pause automatically after replacement
when a DLC gets activated or while it is active, NormalBuilding is replaced by ReplacementBuilding

ValueDefinition.Name: PromotionAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The asset that is containing all the promotion data

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCName
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the DLC displayed to the user

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCType
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of type of DLC (DLC, Digital Mission, Add-on, etc.) displayed to the user

ValueDefinition.Name: MoodImage
ValueDefinition.Description: A big promo image used for the DLC

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCCardImage
ValueDefinition.Description: The image used on the DLC preview cards in the DLC preview menu

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCCardImageExtra
ValueDefinition.Description: The image used on the DLC preview cards in the DLC preview menu when the player has already bought the DLC, but it is not available yet

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCCardImageInfo
ValueDefinition.Description: The image displayed when previewing the buyable DLC in the additional content page

ValueDefinition.Name: DetailedDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: A detailed description of the DLC and its content

ValueDefinition.Name: HeaderIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon that will be shown on the promotion page on top of the card

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: Icons that will be shown on DLC Promotion Popup

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCCardFluffText
ValueDefinition.Description: The fluff text that is shown on hover over a DLC card in order to show him more information about the DLC at click

ValueDefinition.Name: ContentHints
ValueDefinition.Description: A vector containing additional, short information about the content of the DLC

ValueDefinition.Name: ContentIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon of the content hint

ValueDefinition.Name: ContentHeadline
ValueDefinition.Description: The headline of the content hint

ValueDefinition.Name: ContentSubline
ValueDefinition.Description: The subline of the content hint

ValueDefinition.Name: CanInitiateBreadcrumbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether breadcrumbs can be started from the promotion screen to help use the new content (i.e. used in Anarchist)

ValueDefinition.Name: IsReleased
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this asset should be listed as released in the DLC overview

ValueDefinition.Name: EpicShopURL
ValueDefinition.Description: [Deprecated] Currently not used. Epic will always show the "default" store page

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The Uplay product associated with that promotion

ValueDefinition.Name: SpaceReleaseString
ValueDefinition.Description: String used to query the online text for the release date of a DLC

ValueDefinition.Name: PS5ShopProductIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: Regions are defined in the build specific param.json

ValueDefinition.Name: UplayRewardPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: unlocking this reward costs Uplay Points (value is only for ingame UI, does not change the real balancing)

ValueDefinition.Name: RecipeUnlockConditionText
ValueDefinition.Description: Unlock hint text that will be used if the OptionalUnlockAsset is either not set or not unlocked.

ValueDefinition.Name: RecipeUnlockConditionTextOptional
ValueDefinition.Description: If an OptionalUnlockAsset is set and is unlocked this text will be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionalUnlockAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that needs to be unlocked to use the Optional Unlock Text

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetMode
ValueDefinition.Description: The target mode this ammunition uses, which marks the type of ammunition. Any bombing run can only use one type of ammunition at once.

ValueDefinition.Name: BombardmentProjectile
ValueDefinition.Description: The projectile thrown when using this bombardment ammo

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxProjectilesPerShaft
ValueDefinition.Description: How many projectiles of this ammo type can at maximum be loaded into one shaft?

ValueDefinition.Name: AmmoPerProjectile
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of load (good) needed to fire one projectile within this barrage

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageDecalCfg
ValueDefinition.Description: The cfg of the decal for barrages of this type

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageDecalRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius of the decal shown for this barrage

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in which the projectiles of each barrage get randomly placed

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageMinimumDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum distance this barrage can have from other barrages

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageMaximumDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum distance this barrage can have from other barrages

ValueDefinition.Name: ImpactFlyout
ValueDefinition.Description: When hitting a target, this is the flyout that is shown

ValueDefinition.Name: AmmoDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the ammunition shown in the drop UI when selecting the type of ammunition

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxProjectileDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: The timespan in which all projectiles in a barrage are randomly dropped. Can be 0

ValueDefinition.Name: LaunchWithRandomYRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the projectile will be launched with a random rotatiion around the y-axis/height-axis

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionBuffs
ValueDefinition.Description: Different Productivity Buffs the factory applies. Always order the buffs from lowest threshold (first) to highest threshold (last)

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Buff that will always be applied no matter the productivity

ValueDefinition.Name: IsAreaWidePublicService
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the need will not distributed via streets but is availbe area wide

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalRangeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: factor is used to transform beach ornament units to an addional range for the beach

ValueDefinition.Name: StartOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of population of population level on island needed to activate metropolis factor

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of additional employees for next tax interval

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalIncreasePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: percentile increase of interval per interval (e.g. 10%, to make it 1.100 investors for the second interval)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectPerInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of tax cuts for each interval (e.g. 1%)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of increase for each additional threshold reached (e.g. +0,5%)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectMaximum
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum effect strength

ValueDefinition.Name: SaturationTrackerSharpnessDivisor
