ValueDefinition.Description: This value divides the given pointcount for every saturationtracker. Higher values means the function gets sharper so the target value is faster reached. This was implemented as we switched from SaturationTracker to SaturationTrackerSimple without touching any balancing values

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceThresholdInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the threshold of the notification. 10 means the user is missing 10% of his currently available workforce e.g. has 700 farmer but more than 770 needed

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTriggers
ValueDefinition.Description: How often does this notification will be triggered at most (when workforce becomes stable, this counter gets resetted)

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaProductShortageNotifications
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: Since there was no use anymore the code for this is currently commented out. Talk to swenz if you want to reactivate it. Notifications that can trigger when the storage amount for a product falls below a certain threshold on an island

ValueDefinition.Name: Product
ValueDefinition.Description: The product we want to check to trigger the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: Notification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification asset

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludedRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification will not be triggered if the area is in one of this regions

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount af goods the storage has to fall below to trigger the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyTriggerWhenTrendIsNegative
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines if the notification should only be triggered when the current trend for the product is negative

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredBuildingOnIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggers only if at least one of this buildings is on the island

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableMaintenance
ValueDefinition.Description: Building and Ship maintenance can be disabled for scenarios

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumptionWaste
ValueDefinition.Description: when a need is consumed by residents, a waste product is created in storage

ValueDefinition.Name: ElectricityBoost
ValueDefinition.Description: Boosts productivity and shipyard construction speed. The factor that is used to determine the boost of electricity. 0 = neutral (no boost)

ValueDefinition.Name: ElectrifiedEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Effect that is applied on electrified building if it is electrified

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount consumed per cycle

ValueDefinition.Name: StorageAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum stored amount, excluding anything currently being consumed.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount produced at the end of each cycle.

ValueDefinition.Name: CycleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: processing time in seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseProductivity
ValueDefinition.Description: Productivity in %

ValueDefinition.Name: OutputAmountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor on amount of all output goods

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampedMaxTransporterLogisticCost
ValueDefinition.Description: ("This value" x transporter speed ) / 2 results in the clamped max range

ValueDefinition.Name: IsMainFactory
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for calculating good export values. When setting this to true, the space, workforce and region of this factory will be used for the calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsFiniteResources
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this factory removes resources with every production cycle

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxUsableResourceSpots
ValueDefinition.Description: Factory is boosted with more spots in range

ValueDefinition.Name: FiniteResourceSearchRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: range of resource gathering the nearest will be used first, set to 0 for snapped mines

ValueDefinition.Name: TeleportProducedGoodsIntoAreaStorage
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the produced goods are teleported to the area storage immediately and will not be transported via carts

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterFertility
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this fertility is considered to be in the water. If false, the fertility is on the land. This has no impact on gameplay but is used in the UI

Property.Name: FreeAreaProductivity
Property.Description: Lumberjacks have reduced productivity if they do not have enough free forest area in their influence

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Be careful with high values, this has impact on performance

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAreaPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: if availabe area reaches this threshold, there is no impact on productivity anymore

ValueDefinition.Name: MinProductivityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: if there is no free space, this productivity factor is used

ValueDefinition.Name: FreeAreaType
ValueDefinition.Description: only FreeAreas of same type have influence on each other (sharing overlapping tiles)

ValueDefinition.Name: GrowingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long does it take for a tree to fully grow?

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWorkerAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: when running on 100% productivity, this amount of worker units show feedback

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalWorkerForForestation
ValueDefinition.Description: in forestation phase, more worker are active to speed up the planting process

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkerPause
ValueDefinition.Description: pause at working and after returning to building

ValueDefinition.Name: InitializeForestMinTreeAreaPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: needed tree area percent to start production

ValueDefinition.Name: CutTree
ValueDefinition.Description: Hunter does not cut its trees

ValueDefinition.Name: CleanWrongTree
ValueDefinition.Description: cut down trees on unused tiles and trees that have wrong type. Additional workers are spawned if cleaning tasks are available

ValueDefinition.Name: PlantTree
ValueDefinition.Description: does this farm plant trees? (And clears wrong trees)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowCollectFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: if CutTree is false, a collect feedback can be shown instead

ValueDefinition.Name: WayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time the simulated workers need to get from the hut to the working spot. Used for cutting & growing tree timing

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTreePropPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: how many trees should show the AdditionalTreeProp

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTreeProp
ValueDefinition.Description: Prop that is shown at tree when a collector is working

ValueDefinition.Name: HideGrassInRange
ValueDefinition.Description: After destroying the building, the grass gets restored

ValueDefinition.Name: MissingHeatNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification to trigger when heat turns off

ValueDefinition.Name: MandatoryIndustrialization
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this object needs to be powered in order to work

ValueDefinition.Name: BoostedByIndustrialization
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the object can be boosted by electricity

Property.Name: IrrigationSource
Property.Description: If Set, lets the BuildBlocker Area act as a source/sink. E.g. if SourceBig is chosen, it acts as a river.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsSourceForPiping
ValueDefinition.Description: Can Fertilize-Pipes (e.g. Canal) be connected to this building to pipe Fertilization (e.g. Irrigation)?

ValueDefinition.Name: PipeFillCapacity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many pipes can this Source fill

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBeFilledDynamically
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the capacity can be increased dynamically by events

ValueDefinition.Name: PathLayers
ValueDefinition.Description: connection in these layers are interesting for the building

ValueDefinition.Name: OilPumpsNeeded
ValueDefinition.Description: how many oil pumps are needed to reach 100% productivity

ValueDefinition.Name: ResetOnGUIDChange
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the object will do a full cleanup of transporters and storage on guid change

ValueDefinition.Name: HideTransportersBeforeTheyMove
ValueDefinition.Description: Initially transporters are not visible

ValueDefinition.Name: ShutdownThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if delta maintenance saturation is below this threshold, the building pauses automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceAmountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Base Value for maintenance upgrades

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumerPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority of demands coming from this consumer. Only applies to delta products. Higher Priority will always be served before lower prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumerPriorityAlarmed
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority of demands coming from this consumer when alarm is active. Only applies to delta products. Higher Priority will always be served before lower prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: CanRequestAdditionalWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: An additional workforce that can be requested. In itself it has no effect except from the workforce consumption. But others can react on it (see bufffactory)

Property.Name: MonoCulture
Property.Description: Needs property EcoSystemProvider

ValueDefinition.Name: EcoImpactRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius shown in build mode and when selecting the farm, other monocultures in this radius are checked for the resulting soil delta

ValueDefinition.Name: SoilDeltaWithOverlap
ValueDefinition.Description: if another farm is inside my EcoImpactRadius, this soil delta will be added (once per croptype at maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalModulesForEachAdditionalCompanyLevelHigherMax
ValueDefinition.Description: How many additional palace modules can be added for each company lvl above the max setup level

ValueDefinition.Name: ParagonEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: As soon as the player reaches a paragon level the base effect is replaced by the associated paragon effect

Property.Name: PalaceMinistry
Property.Description: Represents a ministry building from the palace that will distribute palace effects over the island

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: The multiplier that is applied on the range of the ministry (compared to palace range)

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Every full house consumes [Amount] every second

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOptionalHappinessValue
ValueDefinition.Description: If set then the calculation for happiness will not go into the negative value but will be scaled from 0 - Max

ValueDefinition.Name: MoneyValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Money that is produced by 100 residences per minute

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Research that is produced by 100 residences per minute

ValueDefinition.Name: HeatValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Relative amount of heat satisfaction this good provides

ValueDefinition.Name: FullWeightPopulationCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Population Count at which this input has reached 100% of configured satisfaction weight

ValueDefinition.Name: NoWeightPopulationCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Population Count at which this input has reached 0% of configured satisfaction weight. If "IsOptionalHappinessValue" is not set this + 1 will also be the need unlock.

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionalInputPopulationUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is != 0 it wll be used for the need unlocked. Otherwise "NoWeightPopulationCount" will be used. Looks strange, but since it was added afterwards we don't want to manually touch every input.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalGlobalUnlockRequirement
ValueDefinition.Description: Each PopulationInput can have an addition unlock requirement. The own population has to be bigger than NoWeightPopulationCount and the configured Population in AdditionUnlockRequirement has to get reached GLOBALLY ONCE. So it will not get locked again after dropping below it. Also it doesn't need to be on the same island but globally.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredFloorLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: Floor level that is required before this need is calculated and visible to the player

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludePopulationFromMoneyAndConsumptionCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true the amount of additional population gained from this input is excluded from money and consumption calculation. Used for the bonus needs for skyscraper monuments.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBonusNeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Bonus needs are needs that are excluded from regular calculations. Population generated from them will not count into the required population for for upgradeability. They will also popup in a different UI in the OM.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Need will only be active if residence is ONE of the listed buildings!

ValueDefinition.Name: IsConsideredByAI
ValueDefinition.Description: If false, this need will not be fulfilled and calculated for AI. If this is true it will still not be considered if it is a Bonus Need, Skyscraper Need or

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultResidence
ValueDefinition.Description: The default residence for this population Tier. Used to determine base resident amount for consumption calculation. Also used for AI purposes as they con only build one residence building per population level.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: calculated per 100 people

ValueDefinition.Name: TotalPointCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of data points for average satisfaction calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay between data points for average satisfaction calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialPointCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of points a new need satisfaction tracker will be initialized with. Higher number means slower reaction to initial need fulfillment.

ValueDefinition.Name: TotalPointCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of satisfaction points per consumption cycle for a need.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Tracked time for satisfaction as multiplier on consumption cycle. Can not be below 1.

ValueDefinition.Name: DebuffAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount the affected needs are reduced by if a debuff from this category is active.

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes which happiness categories are relevant for this population level

ValueDefinition.Name: MoodText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown in the residence object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityFactorByResidents
ValueDefinition.Description: the productivity factor is linear interpolated between the configured thresholds, please sort them by ResidentAmount (starting with lowest amount)

ValueDefinition.Name: HasMailmanFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: If true a spawngroup mailman will be created for this building

ValueDefinition.Name: IndustrializationDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Range in seconds below which every factory is supplied to 100% electricity.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Category name

ValueDefinition.Name: IsAbstract
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this product is never represented in the game world as a physical object. Public Services use these.

ValueDefinition.Name: CanUseWorkforceTransfer
ValueDefinition.Description: If product is workforce this determines if it can be transfered via the workforce transfer

ValueDefinition.Name: PathLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Which path planner layer is used to transport this product

ValueDefinition.Name: IsStrategicResource
ValueDefinition.Description: Strategic resources can not be transported on a normal ship, unless the FixedSlotContent in the itemcontainer points on a strategic resource

ValueDefinition.Name: AssociatedRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Not Producing regions! Can also be consuming regions. Is used for Statistic Screen

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBusNeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Need is distributed via bus network

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBusDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: At this distance the need is considered as not supplied. Saturation is linear interpolated between Min and MaxBusDistance

ValueDefinition.Name: MinBusDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Up to this distance the need is considered as fully supplied. Saturation is linear interpolated between Min and MaxBusDistance

ValueDefinition.Name: BusDistancePenalty
ValueDefinition.Description: Saturation of a need that has higher distance than MaxBusDistance

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: a bus need that is supplied by a culture building is only fully supplied if the building has at least this attractiveness

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines in which category the product is put if it grants happiness

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: Regions in which this product can be produced (not considering item effects). Used for RecipeBookUI and TradRouteUI

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockTransfer
ValueDefinition.Description: Block slots for user interaction (drag/dump/transfer)

ValueDefinition.Name: HighscoreValueModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: If no factory produces this product, this value can be used to manually modify the highscore of this product. The Highscore Value is then calcualted: BasePrice * GlobalModifier * ProductModifier

ValueDefinition.Name: HideInUI
ValueDefinition.Description: This product should not be visible in UI

ValueDefinition.Name: FullSatisfactionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Range in seconds below which every residence is supplied to 100% satisfaction. Satisfaction will drop off above this.

ValueDefinition.Name: NoSatisfactionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Range in seconds at which satisfaction for residences has dropped to 0%.

ValueDefinition.Name: FunctionDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: used in object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidentMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines the default max amount of residents in this building. Not considering upgrades and bonus needs. Will be used by AI and consumption calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidentsRequiredForUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of residents required to be in the house to be upgradeable

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeSatisfactionThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: minimal satisfaction to allow upgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBeforeRuin
ValueDefinition.Description: Time a residence has to stay at 1 inhabitant before downgrading

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeAsRuin
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum time before a ruin can be resettled

ValueDefinition.Name: StressFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: changes the impact of working conditions on satisfaction

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidentsOccupancyThresholdMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Threshold of occupancy for when this building should register to feedback latest

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodViewStartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: This value defines the start index for the panorama effect when no one is affecting this building. Everything affecting this building else will added / subtractetd from this.

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodViewRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius in which neighbor Residences are counted for the GoodViewBuffs.

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodViewBuffs
ValueDefinition.Description: One of these buffs may be active if no same residence is in the neighborhood. The amount of different residences decides which buff is applied

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodViewBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: The index of the Buff is the amount of different residences in the GoodViewRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodViewEmpty
ValueDefinition.Description: Is displayed for skyscrapers instead of good view buff

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveInMs
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval in ms for residents moving in (a position based random MoveRandomMs is added)

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveOutMs
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval in ms for residents moving out (a position based random MoveRandomMs is added)

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveRandomMs
ValueDefinition.Description: A position based random additional time added when calculating the move in or out interval

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBaseResidence
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines if this is the default residence building for its population. Used for AI purposes.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverflowFlotsam
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration of flotsam generation when this building is destroyed and storage amount now exceeds storage capacity.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverflowSpawnPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Of all the products that are overflowing, take only a percentage of them for flotsam. Example: 10 products overflowing, 10% percentage, results in one flotsam crate.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxFlotsamCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of spawned flotsam crates. Do not increase too much, will clutter the harbour.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetInfectionFactor_DEPRECATED
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor [0..100] as percentPoints which is used to calculate the target infections

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaPopulationUnlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: if any of the population amounts listed here is reached on an area this incident is unlocked for the area. Note for the same kind of residences you don't need multiple entries. If you configure 200 T1 people are sufficient than 1 T2 / T3 / ... will do as well.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentTypesPositiveText
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for the detail break down of city Attractiveness if an item is socketed which gives positive attractiveness for incidents.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipIncidentTickRate
ValueDefinition.Description: How frequent shipIncidents should try to spread or get infected

ValueDefinition.Name: HighIncidentRiskThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: This value is used to cmopare the incident chance against to determine if the chance is "high" this is especially used to display or hide the warning sign in the infection risk info corner of the objectmenu header

ValueDefinition.Name: SubRiskFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The session incident chance is calculated by the highest incident type chance + this factor x sum of other chances

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperEffectFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The factor with which newspapereffects influence the incident chance of buildings (this is multiplied to the newspaper effect so 0,1 means a newspaper effect of 50 will result in a chance increase of 5)

ValueDefinition.Name: IntensitySelfHealBlockingTicks
ValueDefinition.Description: amount of ticks the intensity needs to be stable (not necessary in a row) before the building has a self resolve probability

ValueDefinition.Name: IntensityAdditionalSelfHealChance
ValueDefinition.Description: This additional self heal chance is added to the self heal chance if we infected more than the target infections

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectionChancePercentile
ValueDefinition.Description: All buildings which have an >= infection chance then the here defined percentile of all possible infection chances can be selected to start the incident (by weighted random)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPoolSize
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimal amount which should always be in the pool of buildings which might start the incidents (e.g. if you have 4 buildings the 75-Percentile might only choose one but this number can ensure that the others are added as well)

ValueDefinition.Name: BasePerBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: attractiveness malus per building

ValueDefinition.Name: EscalatedPerBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: attractiveness malus per building for an escalated incident

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipIncidentDefaultDebuff
ValueDefinition.Description: In case there's no debuff defined when an incident is started, this one will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipIncidentSpreadChance
ValueDefinition.Description: How likely is it that this ship infects others in its proximity (0-100)

ValueDefinition.Name: ResolverConfigs
ValueDefinition.Description: cfgs used for resolving this incident

ValueDefinition.Name: FreeSpaceSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: configuration in case of random spawning on available feedback space

ValueDefinition.Name: ChunkSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the parcels where the building is divided

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of feedback space available inside the searching distance

ValueDefinition.Name: SearchDistanceScale
ValueDefinition.Description: Area relative to the Chunk Size in which the empty feedback is checked

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumSpawnNumber
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum units spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MinUnitDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: minimum distance between spawned units. Relative to chunk size

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSpawnPerChunk
ValueDefinition.Description: How many units will spawn relative to the number of chunks. I.E.: 0.25 units per chunk means 1 unit every 4 chunks

ValueDefinition.Name: ResolverNextToCarSpawnRight
ValueDefinition.Description: cfg to spawn a resolver unit next to the car when the building is on the right of the car. Leave empty if no unit wanted

ValueDefinition.Name: ResolverNextToCarSpawnLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: cfg to spawn a resolver unit next to the car when the building is on the left of the car. Leave empty if no unit wanted

ValueDefinition.Name: DangerUnsafeExtents
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of inner Danger bounds. People in here will move away of the area

ValueDefinition.Name: DangerSafeExtents
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of outer danger bounds, where people can gather and watch the incident

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetInfectionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor which is used to calculate the target infections

ValueDefinition.Name: HasOwnSessionTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true this incident will no longer use the meta timer which triggers most incidents but instead use a per session timer which can be defined in this config

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionIntervalBonusChance
ValueDefinition.Description: This chance is added everytime the interval ends without starting an incident if the chance without bonus is > 0

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentStartNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: If set gets triggered when the incident starts.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentStartWithoutNearbyResolverNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: If an incident starts at a building with no institution nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentLostFirstBuildingNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: If an incident started with a institution nearby but consumed it's first building. NOTE: only triggered when no other start notification was triggered before.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentEscalatedNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered once when the incident escalates

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentEndDestructionNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification to trigger when an incident ends and a building was destroyed or abandoned

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentStart
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when incident started

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentSolved
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when incident resolved by healing units

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentTimedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when incident stopped by itself

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentSpecialAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when the player used the special action

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentEscalated
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when incident escalated

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentEscalatedSolved
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when an escalated incident was solved

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentEscalatedTimedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when an escalated incident timed out without any solving unit

ValueDefinition.Name: NewspaperArticleIncidentEscalatedSpecialAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Article when the player used the special action during an escalated incident

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Effects below this position will not be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the relative probability that this effect will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: UseDummyScale
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, the effect will scale according to the extents X of the dummy

ValueDefinition.Name: UnusedDummyPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: percentage of dummies that will be ignored when spawning the effect

ValueDefinition.Name: FallbackConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration to use in case of not using the dummies of a building. Horizontal effects will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnBlockSize
ValueDefinition.Description: size of the blocks in which the building is divided in order to spawn effects (one effect per block)

ValueDefinition.Name: RandomBoundsPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: This shrinks the area where the effect is placed to prevent spawining on edges. If set to zero the effect will be centered

ValueDefinition.Name: UnusedDummyPercentageSkyscraper
ValueDefinition.Description: percentage of dummies that will be ignored when spawning the effect on a skyscraper

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageAndFireSpreadDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds between the explosion animation and the actual effects, i.e. damage & fire spread

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: When a festival starts the type is chosen by weighted random with this weight. If the weight is 0 this type can be randomly chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinParadeDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum distance between buildings where the parade spawns / despawns

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxParadeDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance between buildings where the parade spawns / despawns

ValueDefinition.Name: ParadeSoundEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered as 3D sound at the head of the parade

ValueDefinition.Name: BombardmentFireChance
ValueDefinition.Description: After a building gets damage from any source it's checked whether its hitpoints are between the min and max percentage and then a fire starts with the given chance

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHitPointPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: exclusive

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHitPointPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: inclusive

ValueDefinition.Name: FireTickRateMs
ValueDefinition.Description: Fire tick rate in milliseconds

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveOutInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The interval the population of residences moves out when they are ill

ValueDefinition.Name: Base
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this building is infectable by the non escalated version of this incident type

ValueDefinition.Name: Escalated
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this building is infectable by the escalated version of this incident type

ValueDefinition.Name: InitiallySpreadToSameGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the initial spreading of the incident doesn't happen locally but instead other buildings with the same guid are considered.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionCoreDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: The damage this building does in the core radius

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionCoreRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in which the full core damage is dealt

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionOuterRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The damage will be reduced linear from core radius to outer radius.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionOuterDamagePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The Outer damage is [0..100]% of the coreDamage.

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageExplosionChance
ValueDefinition.Description: The Chance [0..100] that this building explodes, when getting damage.

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageExplosionCheckMin
ValueDefinition.Description: A single explosion check is triggered between CheckMin and CheckMax Percentage of this buildings hitpoints

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageExplosionCheckMax
ValueDefinition.Description: See DamageExplosionCheckMin

ValueDefinition.Name: HitpointFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds the missing hitpoints percentage multiplicated by this value to the infection chance

ValueDefinition.Name: DensityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Multiplies the chance to get infected from the infection chances of other nearby buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: DensityDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance in which other buildings are considered to modify the infection chance of this building

ValueDefinition.Name: DilapidatedFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds this value to the infection chance when the building is dilapidated / this value should be equal or bigger than HitpointFactor * 100 to stay consistent

ValueDefinition.Name: FactoryOvertimeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: factor which is multiplied by the working conditions [0 .. 1] for this factory.

ValueDefinition.Name: FactoryHappinessFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The avg happiness of the population level providing the workforce for this factory (Uses HappinessMin, HappinessMax and HappinessThreshold).

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidenceSatisfactionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The chance to get infected based on a low satisfaction (satisfaction below moveInThreshold)

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidenceHappinessFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The factor depending on the happiness of this residence building. (Uses HappinessMin, HappinessMax and HappinessThreshold)

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessMin
ValueDefinition.Description: - (happiness - happinessThreshold) / happinessMin * 100 * happinessFactor

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessMax
ValueDefinition.Description: (happiness - happinessThreshold) / happinessMax * 100 * happinessFactor

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the happiness is below this threshold the incident chance is increased, if it's above the incident chance is decreased

ValueDefinition.Name: SatisfactionThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the satisfaction is below this threshold it will increase the incidentChance

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidenceFullOvertimeChance
ValueDefinition.Description: when the people have to work full overtime this chance is added. The chance is multiplied by the average working conditions [0 .. 1] for the population level of this residence.

ValueDefinition.Name: NoHeatFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If there is no heat provided this factor is added to the chance. Factor scales linear with supplied heat (so 50% means half the factor is applied)

ValueDefinition.Name: EcoSystemFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum caused factor by the ecosystem feature (Green Game Jam only)

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentInfectableExists
ValueDefinition.Description: This attribute only exists for others to create a visibility condition about the existance of this property :)

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentFireIncreaseBase
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value for incident calculation. Should be 100

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentIllnessIncreaseBase
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value for incident calculation. Should be 100

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentRiotIncreaseBase
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value for incident calculation. Should be 100

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentExplosionIncreaseBase
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value for incident calculation. Should be 100

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentArcticIllnessIncreaseBase
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value for incident calculation. Should be 100

ValueDefinition.Name: Influence
ValueDefinition.Description: This value is added to the incident chance [-100, 100]

ValueDefinition.Name: Distance
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum distance to affect other infectable buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: DecreaseType
ValueDefinition.Description: How the influence should decrease

Property.Name: IncidentResolver
Property.Description: The parameters starting with resolver_ configure the units which are send by default from the building to resolve incidents. The properties starting with special_ are responsible for the special forces which might be send by user action

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityForBaseOperation
ValueDefinition.Description: if this building is a factory, it needs at least that much productivity to enable the basic operation of the Incident Resolver, if set to -1 base operation is always disabled

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityForAdvancedOperation
ValueDefinition.Description: if this building is a factory, it needs at least that much productivity to enable the advanced operation of the Incident Resolver, if set to -1 advanced operation is always disabled

ValueDefinition.Name: MobSizeIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: amount of people which join the protest mob for every additional infected building after the initial amount (so e.g. the mob spawns at 10 infected buildings and currently 13 are infected => 3 * thisValue additional riotors join the mob)

ValueDefinition.Name: MobInfectionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: the time the mob gathers around a not infected building before it gets infected (also the time a mob stays infront of an already infected building when idle moving)

ValueDefinition.Name: MobAvgInfectionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The average time a mob tries to infect new buildings. This is never accurate as the mob has to move to the different buildings first.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectedBuildingsSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: when this amount of buildings is actively infected a new mob will spawn

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectedBuildingsDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: after the mob was spawned it gets despawned when this amount of buildings is actively infected (this should be a smaller amount of buildings to make sure that a mob doesn't spawn and immediately despawns again)

ValueDefinition.Name: RiotMoveOutInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The interval the population of residences moves out when they are rioting

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandWarFirstCheckPercentPoint
ValueDefinition.Description: During an island war, when morale drops below this threshold [0..100] a first additional riot check is executed.

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandWarAdditionalCheckCount
ValueDefinition.Description: After the IslandWarFristCheckPercentPoint is reached this amount of additional riot checks is executed on certain, evenly distributed morale percentages

ValueDefinition.Name: MobInfectFactors
ValueDefinition.Description: Modify the probability of different incidents getting triggered by the mob. Note this list contains all incidents even though the mob can only trigger a subset of them.

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: To determine which incident a mob should start at the target building the chances of that building are taken into account and one is chosen by weighted random. This factor changes the chance for this incident. Note: Not only the chances are taken into consideration but the incident limits as well so if the island limit is reached no new incident type can be started.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHitpointsUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: upgrades the maximum amount of hitpoints for units with PropertyAttackable

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: When receiving damage of this type, change it by this factor (0 = immunity against this type of damage)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReloadTimeUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: DEPRECATED!

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProjectile
ValueDefinition.Description: Use this projectile for auto attacks instead of the normal

ValueDefinition.Name: AddStatusEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: When Hitting targets with auto attack, these status effects are additionally applied to the target

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: change affected damage based on island morale (hostile takeover)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: only use this configuration if island morale is between MinMorale and MaxMorale

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: only use this configuration if island morale is between MinMorale and MaxMorale

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDamageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: damage factor if island morale is at MinMorale

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDamageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: damage factor if island morale is at MaxMorale

ValueDefinition.Name: HitpointDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: change affected damage based on attackers hitpoint ratio

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHitpointPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: only use this configuration if hitpoint percent is between MinHitpointPercent and MaxHitpointPercent

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHitpointPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: only use this configuration if hitpoint percent is between MinHitpointPercent and MaxHitpointPercent

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDamageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: damage factor if hitpoint ratio is at MinHitpointPercent

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDamageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: damage factor if hitpoint ratio is at MaxHitpointPercent

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: When applying damage to this type of target, change it by this factor (0 = impossible to damage target)

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: inverted and then applied as a reload time buff. formula: 100/(x + 100). e.g. +20 attackSpeed -> 83.33% reload time.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShouldBeShownInForeignObjectMenu
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this buff will be shown in the foreign object menu when selecting AI / other players.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplacingWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: Replaces the required workforce of the target building with this workforce type

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeModule
ValueDefinition.Description: equipping this item changes the socket module

ValueDefinition.Name: HideBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: This is not shown as normal buff

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowInStatisticScreen
ValueDefinition.Description: a hidden buff may still be shown in statistic screen

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalModuleSoundLoop
ValueDefinition.Description: When this item is placed in a culture module this sound will be played as additional active sound.

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessUpgradePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: elements of the item set get additional attractiveness

ValueDefinition.Name: ScrapAmountLevelUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not use %, because base value is 0! This value multiplied by 10 is shown to the player as percental effect. Some entries in Scrappool need this level unlock

ValueDefinition.Name: DeltaValueUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Upgrades the delta value of the affected eco system provider

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterRegenerationUpgrade100
ValueDefinition.Description: Care: The upgrade gets divided by 100 before being applied. This is to give the possibility to balance values like -150 (=-1.5).

ValueDefinition.Name: AirRegenerationUpgrade100
ValueDefinition.Description: Care: The upgrade gets divided by 100 before being applied. This is to give the possibility to balance values like -150 (=-1.5).

ValueDefinition.Name: SoilRegenerationUpgrade100
ValueDefinition.Description: Care: The upgrade gets divided by 100 before being applied. This is to give the possibility to balance values like -150 (=-1.5).

ValueDefinition.Name: OutputAmountFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Deprecated, please use AdditionalOutput instead!

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceProductSameAsFactoryOutput
ValueDefinition.Description: When this is set, the set product will be ignored and the output good of the affected factory will be used instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalOutputCycle
ValueDefinition.Description: The Nth cycle will produce the specified good. Use "1" for every cycle, "2" for every second, etc.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount by which the input of the factory should be changed. Multiple upgrades get summed up first, then applied. Amount here can be negative. The total input amount can not be negative.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAreaPercentUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: changes the tolerance of free area buildings. use -10 (not -10%) to increase the tolerance by 10%

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWorkerAmountUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: changes planting speed

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentFireIncreaseUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Percental deviation of incident likeliness. This value gets added to the total chance of fires.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentIllnessIncreaseUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Percental deviation of incident likeliness. This value gets added to the total chance of illness.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentRiotIncreaseUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Percental deviation of incident likeliness. This value gets added to the total chance of riots.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: Attractiveness change only gets applied when this is true

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentExplosionIncreaseUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Percental deviation of incident likeliness. This value gets added to the total chance of riots.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentArcticIllnessIncreaseUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Percental deviation of incident likeliness. This value gets added to the total chance of arctic illness.

ValueDefinition.Name: FireInfluenceUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds to influence. which is multiplied with the probability. +1 would (at most) double the probability because the influence might fall off over distance

ValueDefinition.Name: IllnessInfluenceUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds to influence. which is multiplied with the probability. +1 would (at most) double the probability because the influence might fall off over distance

ValueDefinition.Name: RiotInfluenceUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds to influence. which is multiplied with the probability. +1 would (at most) double the probability because the influence might fall off over distance

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Percental Distance Upgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvideIndustrialization
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, target building magically gets electricity

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockHostileTakeover
ValueDefinition.Description: Takeover by Share majority is blocked when kontor has this upgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockBuyShare
ValueDefinition.Description: Enemy cannot buy shares when kontor has this upgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: HappinessIgnoresMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: Morale has no impact on happiness

ValueDefinition.Name: GenProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: How probable is it that an additional good gets generated (0-100)

ValueDefinition.Name: PierSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: tons per second, should affect pier and kotors

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidentsUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Change population capacity of residences

ValueDefinition.Name: StressUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: changes the impact of working conditions on satisfaction

ValueDefinition.Name: IndustrializationRangeUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: asdf

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedProvideNeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: The SubstituteNeed also provides for the ProvidedNeed (e.g. Beer also provides for Religion)

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodConsumptionUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Reduces the need for a specific good by X%

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The corresponding PopulationInput value in the Population Level is affected by this value. Meaning the max required input is reduced and therefore it's not displayed in the UI. Only negative Amounts are allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceModifierInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the workforce output should increase in percent. (0 = no increase, 100 = double the workforce, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: TaxModifierInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the tax output should increase in percent. (0 = no increase, 100 = double the taxes, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionCostInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the construction costs should increase in percent. (-100 = fee, 0 = no increase, 100 = double the cost, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionTimeInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the construction time should increase in percent. (-50 = halfed, 0 = no increase, 100 = twice as long, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplaceAssemblyOptions
ValueDefinition.Description: Replaces assembly options in the construction menu of a shipyard

ValueDefinition.Name: AddAssemblyOptions
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds new assembly options to the construction menu of a shipyard

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveTradePriceInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: how much discount the player gets when trading. 80 would be -20%. (effectively 120 would mean the product costs 20% extra)

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: actual Loading Speed consists of two factors: Loading speed of LoadingPier of building and Loading speed of trade route ship

Property.Name: UpgradeList
Property.Description: object can hold upgrades

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Upgrade description used in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateWhiteFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: Activates white flag. The ship can not attack and can not be attacked by others (only hijacked or plundered)

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatePirateFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: Activates Assassin's Creed Black Flag mode that lets your ship attack ships with whose owner you're not at war with.

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreWeightFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: reduce impact of weight on ship speed (up to 100% = ignore weight)

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreDamageFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: reduce impact of damage on ship speed (up to 100% = ignore damage)

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideSpecialistPool
ValueDefinition.Description: When applied to the visitor harbour, this pool will replace the regular pool of specialists when generating visitors

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockLayoutTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: The BlockLayoutTypes which provide a bonus.

ValueDefinition.Name: CountOrnamentalBlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: If false ornamental blocks don't count towards a higher score. If true they do.

Property.Name: RatingBuildableWithinRadius
Property.Description: Counts how many buildable points are found

ValueDefinition.Name: _ZeroTo
ValueDefinition.Description: For every distance < this value the rating is 0. Between ZeroUntil to OneFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: _OneFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For values OneTo >= x >= OneFrom the rating is 1

ValueDefinition.Name: _ZeroFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For every value > this value the rating is 0. Between OneTo to ZeroFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: _DisableUpperBorders
ValueDefinition.Description: If you don't need the upper borders (e.g. for a range request like from distance 10 on everything is fine) check this bool.

ValueDefinition.Name: ValuesArePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. for coastal points we want n coastal points independent of radius. for buildable tiles, we want p% of the whole area.

Property.Name: RatingCityBlockOverride
Property.Description: Gives a negative rating if a city block is overriden. The rating is even more negative the more public buildings are destroyed by this action (as they need to be rebuild and need to be able to reach the city buildings in the center)

Property.Name: RatingCompactness
Property.Description: Compounds only. Good Rating is given if the BoundingBox of the compound has equal width and height and has as few tiles as possible which don't belong to a compound element

Property.Name: RatingDistance
Property.Description: Rates the distance to a specific position

ValueDefinition.Name: ZeroTo
ValueDefinition.Description: For every distance < this value the rating is 0. Between ZeroUntil to OneFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For values OneTo >= x >= OneFrom the rating is 1

ValueDefinition.Name: ZeroFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For every value > this value the rating is 0. Between OneTo to ZeroFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableUpperBorders
ValueDefinition.Description: If you don't need the upper borders (e.g. for a range request like from distance 10 on everything is fine) check this bool.

Property.Name: RatingFreeformInnerRatio
Property.Description: 0 = no static blocker within, 1 = only static blockers within. Depends on blockingPercentage within context (to avoid recalculation by FreeformFarmFields)

Property.Name: RatingHarborDefense
Property.Description: Only available for harbor defenses

Property.Name: RatingInsideTiles
Property.Description: Rates the AIFineGrid-TileStates inside the rect. ((Maybe sometimes the inner area is already filled with a preview state or something ...?))

Property.Name: RatingNearestBuilding
Property.Description: Checks Distance to nearest other Building within the same Block

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreFreeAreaProductivityBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Ignores FreeAreaProductivityBuildings when checking neighbor buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: NearIsGood
ValueDefinition.Description: True: Near = GoodScore. False: Near = Bad Score.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDist
ValueDefinition.Description: Maps Score Distance [0,MaxDist] to score [0,1] (or [1,0] )

Property.Name: RatingNeighborTiles
Property.Description: Rates the neighbor FineGridTiles with the given score.

ValueDefinition.Name: Use8Neighborhood
ValueDefinition.Description: If false uses the 4 Neighborhood.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredNeighborCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: Every set flag means: The associated Category needs to have atleast a count of 1 otherwise te whole try is cancelled.

Property.Name: RatingProvideBoosterCoverage
Property.Description: For booster buildings like the guildhouse this checks if there is an overlapse to another booster building of the same type and how many boostable buildings are inside.

Property.Name: RatingPublicCoverage
Property.Description: Use for resident buildings. This rates how much of the needs of this and upgraded stages are covered.

Property.Name: RatingSubRect
Property.Description: A single placement try may consist of different elements. E.g. when placing a water building there is the rect of the building itself, the shippath and the water blocker which might all need to be rated differenty. Therefore if such rects are provided you may define a PlacementScore for such sub rects here.

ValueDefinition.Name: Rating
ValueDefinition.Description: Rating will always be in the range [0..1]

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeWeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The relative weight of this subscore to the

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscardThresholdScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If this Subscore is below-or-equal the threshold the whole placement try will be discarded.

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: This is just to leave some notes about what this specific score is supposed to do it has no impact whatsoever on the game

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardCurrencyAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of online currency that the user is rewarded with upon completion of the phase

ValueDefinition.Name: EventSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session that is the jump-to session of the "EventSession" button inside the online event overview ui

ValueDefinition.Name: PreparationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: preparation time to fetch requested preparation goods

ValueDefinition.Name: EventDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: during this time, the event is running (visitors generate money) and at the end, rewards are generated

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: workforce level 5

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: unlock threshold (event can only be started if the condition is currently fulfilled)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxUsableWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: This amount is used while preparation

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionText
ValueDefinition.Description: Investor response to selection of this event in monument event screen

ValueDefinition.Name: RunningText
ValueDefinition.Description: Investor text monument event screen while event is running

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardText
ValueDefinition.Description: Investor text monument event screen when event has finished

ValueDefinition.Name: PotentialEventReward
ValueDefinition.Description: Text and Icon is shown when chosing the monument event

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPreparationAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: Attractiveness after Preparation if all requested goods were delivered

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPreparationAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: Attractiveness after Preparation if no goods were delivered

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodsOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: only Products or RewardPools containing Products are allowed as input for the preparation

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortSizeName
ValueDefinition.Description: the size of the event without the event name

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: event needs to reach and keep this attractiveness (order is not important anymore)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxGoodsReductionPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Requested preparation goods can be reduced by this percentage with workforce (if MaxUsableWorkforceAmount is available)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: Attractiveness can fall down to this value if incidents or missing electricty while event is running

ValueDefinition.Name: ReduceAttractivenessPerMinute
ValueDefinition.Description: while event is running but monument has no electricity or there is an escalated incident on the island

ValueDefinition.Name: RequirementText
ValueDefinition.Description: Texts are shown when selecting this event size

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackTexts
ValueDefinition.Description: while event is running, visitors leave comments on the event

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: While event is running, feedback texts are added each interval

ValueDefinition.Name: IconGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: icon of specialist if picked randomly from this group

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAttractivenessFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor of the MaxPreparationAttractiveness

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttractivenessFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor of the MaxPreparationAttractiveness

ValueDefinition.Name: TextGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Feedback text is picked randomly from this group

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentEventTypeSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: When this event is running this switch is set for the monument object emitter in the switchgroup defined in the SessionSoundConfig

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownAfterEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: After receiving the rewards of an event, this cooldown blocks events in the whole session for the hosting player

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBlockingEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: only one event can be active in a session per player

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentVariations
VariationIndex
ValueDefinition.Description: variation of the monument is chosen randomly from this list
which variations of the monument are allowed for this event? One of them is chosen randomly

ValueDefinition.Name: PotentialCategoryReward
ValueDefinition.Description: Text and Icon is shown when chosing the monument event category

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: Categroy button shows this background image

ValueDefinition.Name: SizeSelectionBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: When selecting the size of the event, this background is shown

ValueDefinition.Name: GamepadActionRemappingUnassigned
ValueDefinition.Description: Is displayed instead of the gamepad action text, if a gamepad button has no session action assigned to it

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipButtonRemappingAllowed
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip that is displayed for button remappings, if remapping the button is allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipActionRemappingForbidden
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip that is displayed for button remappings, if remapping the button is forbidden

ValueDefinition.Name: SaveLoadSettingButtonText
ValueDefinition.Description: Save / load difficulty preset button text.

ValueDefinition.Name: SaveLoadSettingsInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip GUID to display when a save / load difficulty preset button is focused.

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderingConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the grid radius

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness of minor grid lines in active build mode

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineFadeoutStart
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the length of minor grid lines, after which they start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineLengthMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: The length of minor grid lines will be multiplied with this value

ValueDefinition.Name: GridRadiusColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the grid radius lines

ValueDefinition.Name: GridRadiusThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: Thickness of the grid radius lines

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The color of major grid lines, going out of building corners in active build mode

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness of major grid lines, going out of building corners in active build mode

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineFadeoutStart
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the length of major grid lines, after which they start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineLengthMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: The length of major grid lines will be multiplied with this value

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineDepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: The z-depth bias, that the grid lines are rendered with

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMinThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The outlining ground line thickness in build mode will get closer to this value, if the camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMaxThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The outlining ground line thickness in build mode will get closer to this value, if the camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: The outlining ground line in build mode will be rendered with this texture

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineTextureScrollSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Animation speed of the outline texture

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineDepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: The z-depth bias, that the outlines are rendered with

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Line color of preview outlines of prebuilt objects, e.g. in street and railway build mode

ValueDefinition.Name: RailwayConnectorHintPath
ValueDefinition.Description: CFG that is rendered at building connectors during railway build mode

ValueDefinition.Name: SingleTileCursorPath
ValueDefinition.Description: CFG that is rendered at the cursor position during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineOffsetY
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Offset of the animated line during move mode

ValueDefinition.Name: GroundOutlineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the animated line on the ground during move mode

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoZoomOutBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines an area, which is used to auto zoom out the camera automatically during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the left side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: RightBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the right side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: TopBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the top side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: BottomBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the bottom side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoZoomInBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines an area, which is used to auto zoom in the camera automatically during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the left side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: RightBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the right side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: TopBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the top side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: BottomBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the bottom side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: DebugRenderAutoZoomAreas
ValueDefinition.Description: If enabled, the Auto Zoom Areas are rendered during active build modes

ValueDefinition.Name: CursorSpeedZoomFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor between 0.0 and 1.0 for linear interpolation between start zoom level and current zoom level. 0 = Only start and 1 = only current zoom level is used to calculate the cursor speed.

ValueDefinition.Name: CosmeticModuleIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Displayed at the cursor during cosmetic module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildingBlockerDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance between the end of a building block and the current build position. If the distance is greater, the street might be incomplete.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildBlockerTileCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of tiles of a building block. If the number of tiles of the current build blocker is greater than this value, the algorithm will stop and no streets will be added.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTileTraverseCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of tiles that can be traversed to find the street tiles around the building block

ValueDefinition.Name: EnterHybridDragThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Object dragging during hybrid mode is only possible, if the camera speed (world units per second) is below this threshold during button press

ValueDefinition.Name: MinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraDistanceForMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When the camera distance is lower than this value, we use the MinSelectionRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraDistanceForMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When the camera distance is greater than this value, we use the MaxSelectionRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleDownSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes (in seconds) for the selection circle to be scaled down if it picked an object with a build tool.

ValueDefinition.Name: LineThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: Thickness of the circle

ValueDefinition.Name: BorderRenderTechnique
ValueDefinition.Description: Technique that is used to render the circle

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as MinRadius, but for the World Map

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as MaxRadius, but for the World Map

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapCameraDistanceForMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CameraDistanceForMinRadius, but for the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapCameraDistanceForMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CameraDistanceForMaxRadius, but for the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulePlacementCircleRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Selection circle radius multplier during module placement, during which also a beam is rendered

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulePlacementCircleCenterVisible
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, a small dot is rendered at the cursor position during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: LineTexturePath
ValueDefinition.Description: The texture that is used to render the rectangle

ValueDefinition.Name: MinThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: GapPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The size of the gap in between the rectangle brackets in percent / 100

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines, how objects inside the SelectionCircle are sorted and which gets picked and snapped to, fist. Size: Choses building with max blocker size. Distance: Choses buildings closest to the selectionCircle first. SizeAndDistance: Choses buildings closest to the circleDistance and with the smallest blocker size first.

ValueDefinition.Name: SizeDistanceSortFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Only for SizeAndDistance sorting:; Value from 0.0 - 1.0, with 0.0 only using size and 1.0 not using size at all

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildBlockerArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used for size and distance sorting comparisons: the max blocker size a building can have, every building with a greater blocker size will be treated the same.

ValueDefinition.Name: MarkerPylonSize
ValueDefinition.Description: This value will be multiplied with the size of the pylons that are shown, when a ship is moved

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraFollowShipSafeRadiusMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: If other objects are nearer than this value multiplied with the current selection circle radius, the camera will not start following an object

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMinThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The line thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMaxThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The line thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineDepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: Z-Depth bias for the outline lines

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipItemLineRendering
ValueDefinition.Description: Line width of the dashes

ValueDefinition.Name: DashSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the line dashes

ValueDefinition.Name: GapSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the gaps betweem line dashes

ValueDefinition.Name: DepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: Depth bias of both lines

ValueDefinition.Name: DirectLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the direct line

ValueDefinition.Name: CurveLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the curve line

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimateGroundLine
ValueDefinition.Category: If true, the direct projectile line will also be animated

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutEasing
ValueDefinition.Description: Applied to the circle tail radius over time

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Strength between 0.0 and 1.0 of the tail radius fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: TickLifetime
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of Time in ms the brush tail is visible

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBetweenCircles
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of time in ms between filled circles being rendered in the tail

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderItemTargetAtPrediction
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if ship item target feedback should be rendered at the predicted enemy position, instead of the camera position

ValueDefinition.Name: DragObjectDistanceThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When dragging at least x world units in Move mode during gamepad mode, the drag is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: EnterDragObjectThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Move Mode via drag only starts when the current camera movement (world units per second) is lower than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomDeceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds it takes to to stop camera zoom on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomAcceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds to reach max zoom speed on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: PanDeceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds it takes to stop camera pan movement on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: PanAcceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds to reach max pan speed on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: PanSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Max pan speed in tiles per second

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Max zoom speed

ValueDefinition.Name: CircleLineThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness of the selection circle on the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipMinBottomDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Mininum distance in pixels between infotips and the bottom of the screen

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipScreenOffsetX
ValueDefinition.Description: X Offset in pixels of infotips. Zero means that the infotip is located at the border of the objects bounding box.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipScreenOffsetY
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Offset in pixels of infotips. Zero means that the infotip will be at the y position of the selected object

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapZoomDelayInSec
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds the user has to hold the zoom out button until the jump to worldmap sequence is initialized

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipScaleMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Scale multiplier for ship objects and route paths

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpeditionCircleColliderRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance of the selection circle until which expeditions will be selected

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapZoomEasingStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Easing factor of the zoom to world map. A lower value means faster acceleration.

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapZoomCancelSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Speed in ms per tick it takes the camera to return to the max zoom, when the zoom to world map is cancelled

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumCharacterInput
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum character input for virtual keyboard text requests. If a value of zero or less is defined, the DefaultMaximumCharacterCount is used instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: LanguagePerRegion
TextLanguage
ValueDefinition.Description: Available Text languages in this region

ValueDefinition.Name: AudioLanguage
ValueDefinition.Description: Available audio languages in this region
Defines what languages are available for what regions

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifierButtonTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: A GamepadAction is triggered. if all checked ButtonTypes are in the right state, defined by the EventTypes. If OnAnyDefinedButtonType is checked, only one of the buttons has to be in the correct ButtonState.

ValueDefinition.Name: EventType
ValueDefinition.Description: The event type that triggers this action. ShortRelease is only intended for very specific situations, please use Release events in regular cases.

ValueDefinition.Name: StickMoveType
ValueDefinition.Description: StickMovement that is displayed in the UI for this action. The action won't be triggered without additional PRG support. Don't set up ButtonTypes when using StickMoveType

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedContext
ValueDefinition.Description: A GamepadAction is only triggered, if the current GamepadActionContext of the game is checked.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsGlobal
ValueDefinition.Description: Global events will be executed at first and can't get blocked by FocusGroups

ValueDefinition.Name: RemappableButtonTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Set of buttons that can be remapped to session gamepad actions

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredMappedButtonActions
ValueDefinition.Description: These gamepad action always have to be mapped. If the user tries to unmap them, the remapping request will be canceled and a warning will be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerStickDeadzoneLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum stick input between 0.0 and 1.0 for the left stick. Any stick input below that value will not be procesed in the game.

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerStickDeadzoneRight
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum stick input between 0.0 and 1.0 for the right stick. Any stick input below that value will not be procesed in the game.

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterStickDeadzoneLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Outer deadzone value for the left stick. Stick input will reach its maximum once it reaches the outer deadzone.

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterStickDeadzoneRight
ValueDefinition.Description: Outer deadzone value for the right stick. Stick input will reach its maximum once it reaches the outer deadzone.

ValueDefinition.Name: StickCurveStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve factor for easing camera movement input. A higher value means slower camera movement for smaller stick input.

ValueDefinition.Name: HoldTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in ms a gamepad button has to be pressed to trigger a hold event

ValueDefinition.Name: DoubleTapTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in ms between two gamepad button presses to trigger a double tap event

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortReleaseTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum allowed time in ms between press and release events for short release events to trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The threshold between 0.0 and 1.0 for trigger buttons before a press event is fired

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumReleaseDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the minimum release duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumReleaseDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the maximum release duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumHoldDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the minimum hold duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHoldDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the maximum hold duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumTriggerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Between 0.0 and 1.0 the minimum trigger threshold that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumTriggerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Between 0.0 and 1.0 the maximum trigger threshold that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: RadialMenuMinimumStickInput
ValueDefinition.Description: Threshold value between 0.0 - 1.0. Radial menus only select entries when stick input is above this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumInnerDeadzone
